1.verse: Book 1: Psalms 1–41 Two Ways to Live - ·Happy [Blessed] are those who don’t ·listen to [walk in the counsel of] the wicked, who don’t ·go where sinners go [stand in the way of sinners], who don’t ·do what evil people do [sit in the seat of mockers].

2.verse: They ·love [delight in] the LORD’s ·teachings [laws; instructions], and they ·think about [meditate on] those ·teachings [laws; instructions] day and night.

3.verse: They are like a tree planted by ·a river [streams of water; full of life, strong, vibrant]. The tree produces fruit in season, and its leaves don’t ·die [wither]. Everything they do will ·succeed [prosper].

4.verse: But wicked people are not like that. They are like chaff that the wind blows away [dead, unstable].

5.verse: So the wicked will not ·escape God’s punishment [stand in the judgment]. Sinners will not ·worship with God’s people [be in the assembly of the righteous].

6.verse: This is because the LORD ·takes care of his people [knows the way of the righteous], but the way of the wicked will be destroyed.

1.verse: The Lord’s Chosen King - Why ·are the nations so angry [do the nations rage/or conspire]? Why ·are the people making useless plans [do the people plot in vain]?

2.verse: The kings of the earth ·prepare to fight [take their stand], and their leaders ·make plans [plot] together against the LORD and his ·appointed one [anointed; Messiah; the king, ultimately Jesus; Acts 4:25–28].

3.verse: They say, “Let’s break ·the chains that hold us back [their chains/bonds] and throw off ·the ropes that tie us down [their ropes/cords from us].”

4.verse: But the one who sits in heaven [God] laughs; the Lord ·makes fun of [ridicules; derides] them.

5.verse: Then the LORD ·warns them [speaks to them in anger] and frightens them with his ·anger [fury].

6.verse: He says, “I have ·appointed [installed; set] my own king over my holy mountain, Zion [the location of the Temple in Jerusalem; 9:11; 48:2, 11; 50:2; 1 Kin. 8:1].”

7.verse: Now I will ·tell [recount to] you what the LORD has ·declared [decreed]: He said to me, “You are my son. Today I have become your father [2 Sam. 7:14; Matt. 3:17; Mark 1:11; Luke 3:22; Acts 13:32–33; Heb. 1:5].

8.verse: ·If you ask me [Ask of me], I will give you the nations as your inheritance; all the ·people on [ends of the] earth will be ·yours [your possession].

9.verse: You will rule over them with an iron ·rod [scepter; a symbol of royal authority; Rev. 12:5; 19:15]. You will ·break [dash] them into pieces like pottery.”

10.verse: ·So [Now], kings, be wise; ·rulers [rulers/judges of the earth], ·learn this lesson [be warned].

11.verse: ·Obey [Serve] the LORD with great fear. ·Be happy [Rejoice], ·but tremble [with trembling].

12.verse: ·Show that you are loyal to his [Kiss the] son, or ·you will be destroyed by his anger [he will be angry and you will perish on the way], because he can quickly become angry. But ·happy [blessed] are those who ·trust him for protection [find refuge in him].

1.verse: A Morning Prayer - David sang this when he ran away from his son Absalom [2 Sam. 15–19]. LORD, ·I have many enemies [how many are my foes?]! ·Many people [How many…?] have ·turned [risen] against me.

2.verse: Many are saying about me, “·God won’t rescue him [There is no salvation for him in God].” ·Selah [Interlude]

3.verse: But, LORD, you are my shield [protector], my ·wonderful God [glory] who ·gives me courage [lifts up my head].

4.verse: I will ·pray [lift my voice] to the LORD, and he will answer me from his holy mountain [Zion, the location of the Temple]. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: I can lie down and go to sleep, and I will wake up again, because the LORD ·gives me strength [sustains/upholds me].

6.verse: Thousands of troops may ·surround me [set themselves around me], but I am not afraid.

7.verse: LORD, rise up! My God, come ·save [rescue; deliver] me! You have struck my enemies on the cheek; you have broken the teeth of the wicked.

8.verse: ·The LORD can save his people [Salvation/Rescue/Deliverance belongs to the LORD]. ·Bless your people [May your blessing be on your people]. ·Selah [Interlude]

1.verse: An Evening Prayer - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of David. Answer me when I ·pray [call] to you, my God who ·does what is right [is righteous; or who vindicates me]. ·Make things easier for me [Give me room; Widen my way] when I am in trouble. Have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

2.verse: People, how long will you turn my ·honor [glory] into shame? How long will you love what is ·false [empty] and ·look for [seek] lies [possibly referring to false gods]? ·Selah [Interlude]

3.verse: You know that the LORD has ·chosen [set apart; distinguished] for himself those who are loyal to him [in covenant relationship with him]. The LORD listens when I ·pray [call] to him.

4.verse: When you ·are angry [are disturbed; tremble], do not sin. ·Think about these things [Meditate; Speak to your heart] quietly ·as you go to bed [on your bed]. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: ·Do what is right as a sacrifice to the LORD [Sacrifice right/righteous sacrifices] and trust the LORD.

6.verse: Many people ask, “Who will ·give us [make us see] anything good?” LORD, ·be kind to us [let the light of your face shine on us; Num. 6:24–26].

7.verse: But you have ·made me very happy [given joy to my heart], happier than they are, even with all their grain and new wine.

8.verse: I ·go to bed [lie down] and sleep in peace, because, LORD, only you ·keep me safe [make me secure].

1.verse: A Morning Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. For flutes. A psalm of David. LORD, ·listen [give ear] to my words. Understand my ·sadness [moans; sighs].

2.verse: ·Listen [Pay attention] to my cry for help, my King and my God, because I pray to you.

3.verse: LORD, every morning you hear my voice. Every morning, I ·tell you what I need [or prepare a sacrifice for you; stretch out/arrange before you], and I ·wait for your answer [watch].

4.verse: You are not a God who ·is pleased with the wicked [takes delight in evil]; ·you do not live with those who do evil [evil does not sojourn with you].

5.verse: Those people who ·make fun of you [or boast] cannot stand before ·you [your eyes]. You hate all those who do evil.

6.verse: You destroy ·liars [those who speak lies]; the LORD ·hates [despises] those ·who kill and trick others [with bloodguilt and deceit].

7.verse: Because of your great ·love [loyalty; covenant love], I ·can [or will] come into your ·Temple [house]. Because I ·fear you [hold you in awe], I can ·worship [bow down] ·in [or toward] your holy Temple.

8.verse: LORD, since I have many enemies, ·show me the right thing to do [lead/guide me in your righteousness]. ·Show me clearly how you want me to live [Make your way straight before me].

9.verse: My enemies’ mouths do not tell the truth; ·in their hearts they want to destroy others [their innards are destruction]. Their throats are like open graves [Rom. 3:13]; they use their tongues for ·telling lies [flattery].

10.verse: God, ·declare them guilty [make them bear their iniquity]! Let them fall ·into their own traps [or by their own advice]. ·Send [Cast] them away because their ·sins [transgressions] are many; they have ·turned [rebelled] against you.

11.verse: But let everyone who ·trusts [finds refuge in] you ·be happy [rejoice]; let them sing glad songs forever. ·Protect [Spread your protection on] those who love you and ·who are happy because of you [let those who love your name rejoice in you].

12.verse: LORD, you bless those who ·do what is right [are righteous]; you ·protect them [surround them with favor] like a shield.

1.verse: A Prayer for Mercy in Troubled Times - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. Upon the ·sheminith [eighth; a reference to an eight-stringed instrument or possibly the manner of singing]. A psalm of David. LORD, don’t ·correct [rebuke; reprove] me when you are angry; don’t ·punish [discipline] me when you are ·very angry [enraged].

2.verse: LORD, ·have mercy on [be gracious to] me because I ·am weak [languish; faint]. Heal me, LORD, because my bones ·ache [are in agony].

3.verse: I ·am very upset [ache; am in agony]. LORD, how long will it be?

4.verse: LORD, return and save me; ·save [rescue; deliver] me because of your ·kindness [loyalty; covenant love].

5.verse: Dead people don’t remember you; those in ·the grave [or the underworld; Sheol] don’t praise you.

6.verse: I am ·tired [weary] ·of crying to you [because of my moaning]. Every night ·my bed is wet [I flood my pillow] with tears; my bed is soaked from my crying.

7.verse: My eyes are weak ·from so much crying [because of my grief]; they are weak ·from crying about [because of] my enemies.

8.verse: Get away from me, all you who do evil, because the LORD has heard my ·crying [supplication].

9.verse: The LORD has heard my cry for help; the LORD will ·answer [accept] my prayer.

10.verse: All my enemies will be ashamed and ·troubled [in agony; vv. 2–3]. They will turn and suddenly leave in shame.

1.verse: A Prayer for Fairness - A shiggaion [a musical or literary term of uncertain meaning] of David which he sang to the LORD about Cush, from the tribe of Benjamin [an unknown person, but the tribe of Benjamin, Saul’s tribe, resisted David’s kingship at first; 2 Sam. 3–4]. LORD my God, I ·trust in you for protection [find refuge in you]. ·Save [Rescue; Deliver] me and rescue me from those who are ·chasing [pursuing] me.

2.verse: Otherwise, like a lion they will tear me apart. They will ·rip me to pieces [or drag me away], and no one can ·save [rescue; deliver] me.

3.verse: LORD my God, what have I done? Have my hands done something ·wrong [to make me guilty]?

4.verse: Have I done wrong to ·my friend [the one at peace with me] or stolen without reason from my enemy?

5.verse: If I have, let my enemy ·chase [pursue] me and ·capture [overtake] me. Let him trample ·me [my life] into the ·dust [earth] and ·bury me [lay my honor] in the ground. ·Selah [Interlude]

6.verse: LORD, rise up in your anger; ·stand up [lift yourself up] against my enemies’ ·anger [fury]. ·Get up [Wake up], ·my God [or for me], and ·demand fairness [insist on/command judgment].

7.verse: Gather the ·nations [assembly/congregations of the peoples] around you and ·rule [or take a seat over; return] them from ·above [on high].

8.verse: LORD, judge the people. LORD, ·defend [judge] me ·because I am right [according to my righteousness], ·because I have done no wrong [according to my innocence].

9.verse: God, you ·do what is right [are righteous]. You ·know [test] our ·thoughts [hearts/minds] and ·feelings [kidneys; the seat of emotions in Hebrew thought]. Stop those wicked actions done by evil people, and ·help [establish] those who ·do what is right [are righteous].

10.verse: God ·protects me like a [is my] shield; he saves those whose hearts ·are right [have integrity].

11.verse: God ·judges by what is right [is a righteous judge], and God is ·always ready to punish the wicked [angry every day].

12.verse: If they do not ·change their lives [repent], God will sharpen his sword; he will string his bow and take aim.

13.verse: He has prepared his deadly weapons; he has made his flaming arrows.

14.verse: There are people who ·think up [conceive] evil and ·plan [are pregnant with] ·trouble [malice] and ·tell [give birth to] lies.

15.verse: They dig a ·hole [pit] ·to trap others [and dig it deep], but they will fall into it themselves.

16.verse: ·They will get themselves into trouble [Their trouble/malice will return to their head]; the violence they cause will ·hurt only themselves [come down on their heads; Prov. 26:27; Matt. 26:52].

17.verse: I praise the LORD ·because he does what is right [according to his righteousness]. I sing praises to the LORD Most High.

1.verse: The Lord’s Greatness - For the director of music. On the gittith [perhaps a musical term or instrument]. A psalm of David. LORD our Lord, ·Your name is the most wonderful name [How majestic is your name] in all the earth [Ex. 3:14–15]! ·It brings you praise [You have set your splendor/glory] in heaven above [Rom. 1:20].

2.verse: ·You have taught children and babies to sing praises to you [Out of the mouth of babies and infants you have established/founded strength] because of your enemies. And so you silence your enemies and those who try to get ·even [revenge].

3.verse: I look at your heavens, ·which you made with [the work of] your fingers. I see the moon and stars, which you ·created [established; Gen. 1:17–18].

4.verse: ·But why are people even important to you [What are people that you remember them]? Why do you take care of ·human beings [the son of man]?

5.verse: You made them a little lower than ·the angels [or God] and crowned them with glory and honor [Gen. 1:26–27].

6.verse: You ·put them in charge of [give them rule over] ·everything you made [the work of your hands]. You put all things under their ·control [feet; Heb. 2:6–8]:

7.verse: all the sheep, the cattle, and the ·wild animals [beasts of the field],

8.verse: the birds in the ·sky [heavens], the fish in the sea, and everything that ·lives under water [passes/travels on the paths of the sea; Gen. 1:28; 9:1–3].

9.verse: LORD our Lord, ·your name is the most wonderful [how majestic is your] name in all the earth!

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Victory - For the director of music. To the tune of “The Death of the Son.” A psalm of David. I will ·praise [or give thanks to] you, LORD, with all my heart. I will ·tell [recount] all ·the miracles you have done [your wonderful deeds].

2.verse: I will be happy and rejoice because of you; God Most High, I will sing praises to your name.

3.verse: My enemies turn back; they ·are overwhelmed [stumble] and ·die [perish] ·because of [or before] you.

4.verse: You have ·heard [upheld; maintained] my ·complaint [just cause; or right and my cause]; you sat on your throne and judged ·by what was right [righteously].

5.verse: You ·spoke strongly against the [rebuked; reproved] foreign nations and destroyed the wicked; you ·wiped out [blotted out; erased] their names forever and ever.

6.verse: The enemy is ·gone [done; a ruin] forever. You ·destroyed [uprooted] their cities; ·no one even remembers them [their memory perishes].

7.verse: But the LORD ·rules [is enthroned; sits] forever. He ·sits on his throne to judge [has established his throne for justice/judgment],

8.verse: and he will judge the world ·in fairness [with righteousness]; he will decide what is fair for the ·nations [peoples; 96:10; 98:9].

9.verse: The LORD ·defends [is a refuge for] those who ·suffer [are oppressed/exploited]; ·he defends them [a refuge] in times of ·trouble [distress].

10.verse: Those who know ·the LORD [your name] trust ·him [you], because ·he [you] will not ·leave [abandon; forsake] those who ·come to him [seek you; Deut. 31:6, 8; Matt. 28:20; Heb. 13:5].

11.verse: Sing praises to the LORD who ·is king on Mount [dwells on] Zion [the location of the Temple]. Tell ·the nations [among the peoples] what he has done.

12.verse: ·He remembers who the murderers are [or The one who avenges blood remembers them; God]; he will not forget the cries of those who suffer.

13.verse: LORD, ·have mercy on [be gracious toward] me. See how ·my enemies [those who hate me] ·hurt [afflict; persecute] me. ·Do not let me go through [Lift me up from] the gates of death.

14.verse: Then, at the gates of ·Jerusalem [the daughter of Zion; a name of Jerusalem], I will ·praise you [declare your praises]; I will rejoice ·because you saved me [in your salvation].

15.verse: The nations have ·fallen [sunk] into the pit they ·dug [made]. Their feet are caught in the nets they ·laid [hid].

16.verse: The LORD has made himself known by ·his fair decisions [the judgments he has made]; the wicked get trapped by ·what they do [the deeds of their palms/hands]. ·Higgaion [a musical notation]. ·Selah [Interlude]

17.verse: Wicked people will ·go [return] to the ·grave [or underworld; Sheol], and so will all ·those who [the nations that] forget God.

18.verse: But those who ·have troubles [are afflicted] will not always be forgotten. The hopes of the ·poor [oppressed; exploited] will never ·die [perish].

19.verse: LORD, rise up and don’t let people ·think they are strong [prevail]. Judge the nations in your presence.

20.verse: ·Teach them to fear you [or Strike them with terror; Deut. 4:34; 28:8; 34:12], LORD. The nations must learn that they are ·only human [mere mortals]. ·Selah [Interlude]

1.verse: A Complaint About Evil People - LORD, why ·are you [do you stand] so far away? Why do you hide ·when there is [in times of] ·trouble [distress]?

2.verse: Proudly the wicked ·chase down [hunt down; persecute] ·those who suffer [or the poor]. Let them be caught in ·their own traps [the schemes they have thought up].

3.verse: They ·brag [boast] about the ·things they want [cravings/desires of their soul]. ·They bless the greedy but [or The greedy curse and] ·hate [reject] the LORD.

4.verse: The wicked people are too proud. They do not ·look for [pursue; seek] God; there is no room for God in their thoughts.

5.verse: ·They always succeed [Their ways are always successful/prosperous]. ·They are far from keeping your laws [Your judgments are above their grasp]; they ·make fun of [sneer/scoff at] their enemies.

6.verse: They say ·to themselves [in their hearts], “·Nothing bad will ever happen to me [I will never be moved/shaken]; I will never ·be ruined [have trouble/be harmed].”

7.verse: Their mouths are full of curses, ·lies [deceit], and ·threats [violence]; ·they use their tongues for [under their tongues is] ·sin [trouble] and evil [Rom. 3:14].

8.verse: They ·hide [lie in ambush] near the villages. They ·look for innocent people to kill [murder the innocent; Prov. 1:11]; ·they watch in secret [their eyes look intently] for the helpless.

9.verse: They ·wait in hiding [lie in ambush in a covert/cover] like a lion. They ·wait [lie] to catch poor people; they catch the poor in nets and drag them off.

10.verse: The poor are crushed and thrown down; they ·are defeated [fall] ·because the others are stronger [by their might].

11.verse: The wicked ·think [say in their hearts], “God has forgotten us. He ·doesn’t see what is happening [has hidden his face and does not see anything].”

12.verse: LORD, rise up and ·punish the wicked [raise your hand, God]. Don’t forget those who ·need help [are oppressed].

13.verse: Why do wicked people ·hate [despise] God? They say ·to themselves [in their hearts], “·God won’t punish us [You will not pursue].”

14.verse: LORD, surely you see these ·cruel [troublesome] and ·evil [grievous] things; look at them and ·do something [put it in your hands]. ·People in trouble [The helpless] ·look to you for help [entrust/abandon themselves to your hands]. You are the one who helps the orphans.

15.verse: Break the ·power [hand] of wicked and evil people. ·Punish them for the evil they have done [You will seek out their wickedness until you find none].

16.verse: The LORD is King forever and ever. ·Destroy from your land those nations [The nations will perish from his land].

17.verse: LORD, you have heard ·what the poor people want [the desires of the poor]. ·Do what they ask [You will strengthen their heart], and ·listen to them [you will cause your ear to pay attention].

18.verse: ·Protect [Bring justice to] the orphans and ·put an end to suffering [the oppressed] so ·they will no longer be afraid of evil people [those from the earth may terrify no more].

1.verse: Trust in the Lord - For the director of music. Of David. I ·trust in the LORD for protection [find refuge in the LORD]. So why do you say to me, “·Fly [Flee] like a bird to your mountain.

2.verse: For, look, the wicked ·string [bend] their bows; they set their arrows on the bowstrings. They shoot from dark places at those who are ·honest [upright/virtuous in heart].

3.verse: When the foundations [a stable society] collapse, what can ·good [righteous] people do?”

4.verse: The LORD is in his holy Temple; the LORD sits on his throne in heaven. ·He sees what people do [His eyes watch]; ·he keeps his eye on them [his gaze examines/tests people].

5.verse: The LORD ·tests [examines] ·those who do right and those who do wrong [the righteous and the wicked], but he hates those who love ·to hurt others [violence].

6.verse: He will ·send [rain] hot coals and burning sulfur on the wicked. A ·whirlwind [scorching wind] is ·what they will get [the portion of their cup; an image of judgment; Is. 51:17, 22; Ezek. 23:31–33; Matt. 26:39].

7.verse: The LORD ·does what is right [is righteous], and he loves ·justice [righteousness], so ·honest people [the upright/virtuous] will see his face.

1.verse: A Prayer Against Liars - For the director of music. Upon the ·sheminith [eighth; a reference to an eight-stringed instrument or possibly the manner of singing]. A psalm of David. Save me, LORD, because the ·good [faithful; godly; covenantal; loyal] people are all gone; ·no true believers are left on earth [the faithful have vanished among humanity].

2.verse: Everyone ·lies [speaks falsehood] to his neighbors; they ·say one thing and mean another [speak with flattering lips and with a double heart/heart and heart].

3.verse: The LORD will ·stop [cut off] those flattering lips and those bragging tongues.

4.verse: They say, “Our tongues will ·help us win [prevail]. ·We can say what we wish [Our lips belong to us]; ·no one [who…?] is our master.”

5.verse: But the LORD says, “I will now rise up, because the ·poor [weak] are ·being hurt [destroyed; plundered; oppressed]. Because of the ·moans [groans; sighs] of the ·helpless [needy], I will give them the ·help [victory] they ·want [long for].”

6.verse: The LORD’s ·words [or promises] are ·pure [flawless], like silver ·purified [refined] ·by fire [or in a furnace], ·purified [refined] seven times over [18:30; 119:140].

7.verse: LORD, you will ·keep us safe [guard/protect them]; you will always ·protect [guard] us from such ·people [a generation].

8.verse: But the wicked ·are [walk] all around us; ·everyone loves what is wrong [what is vile is lifted up among the sons of man/humanity].

1.verse: A Prayer for God to Be Near - For the director of music. A psalm of David. How long will you forget me, LORD? Forever? How long will you hide your face from me?

2.verse: How long must I ·worry [or bear pain; hold counsels] and ·feel sad [hold sorrow] in my heart all day? How long will my enemy ·win [rise up] over me?

3.verse: LORD, look at me. Answer me, my God; ·tell me [light up my eyes], or I will ·die [sleep the sleep of death].

4.verse: Otherwise my enemy will say, “I have ·won [finished him off]!” ·Those against me [My foes] will rejoice that I’ve been ·defeated [shaken; moved].

5.verse: I ·trust [have confidence] in your ·love [loyalty; covenant love]. My heart ·is happy [rejoices] because ·you saved me [of your victory/salvation].

6.verse: I sing to the LORD because he has ·taken care of [been good to] me.

1.verse: The Unbelieving Fool - For the director of music. Of David. Fools say ·to themselves [in their hearts], “There is no God [Psalm 53 largely parallels this psalm].” ·Fools are evil [They are corrupt] and do ·terrible [detestable] things [Deut. 32:5]; there is no one who does anything good.

2.verse: The LORD looked down from heaven on all people to see if anyone ·understood [was wise/insightful], if anyone was ·looking to God for help [seeking God].

3.verse: But all have ·turned [wandered] away. Together, everyone has become ·evil [perverse]. There is no one who does anything good, not even one [Rom. 3:10–12].

4.verse: Don’t ·the wicked [those who do evil] ·understand [know]? They ·destroy [consume; eat] my people as if they were ·eating [consuming] bread. They do not ·ask the LORD for help [call on the LORD].

5.verse: But the wicked are ·filled [terrified] with terror, because God is with ·those who do what is right [the company of the righteous].

6.verse: The wicked ·upset [confuse; frustrate] the plans of the poor, but the LORD ·will protect them [is their refuge].

7.verse: I pray that ·victory [salvation] will come to Israel from Mount Zion [the location of the Temple]! May the LORD ·bring them back [restore the fortunes of his people; perhaps at the end of the exile]. Then the people of Jacob will rejoice, and the people of Israel will be glad.

1.verse: What the Lord Demands - A psalm of David. LORD, who may ·enter [dwell/abide/sojourn in] your Holy Tent [the Tabernacle]? Who may live on your holy mountain [Mount Zion]?

2.verse: Only those who ·are innocent [walk innocently] and who do ·what is right [righteousness; 1:1; Job 1:1]. Such people speak the truth from their hearts

3.verse: and do not ·tell lies about others [slander with their tongue]. They do no ·wrong [evil] to their neighbors and do not ·gossip [raise a reproachful matter with their associates].

4.verse: ·They do not respect hateful people [The wicked are despised in their eyes] but honor those who ·honor [fear] the LORD. They keep their promises to their neighbors, even when it hurts.

5.verse: They do not charge interest on money they lend [Ex. 22:25–27; Lev. 25:35–36; Deut. 23:19] and do not take ·money [a bribe] to hurt innocent people [Ex. 23:8; Deut. 16:19]. Whoever does all these things will never be ·destroyed [moved].

1.verse: The Lord Takes Care of His People - A miktam [perhaps “inscription”] of David. ·Protect [Guard] me, God, because I ·trust [take refuge] in you.

2.verse: I said to the LORD, “You are my LORD. ·Every good thing I have comes from you [I have no good apart from you].”

3.verse: As for the ·godly people [holy ones; saints] in the ·world [or land], they are the ·wonderful [noble] ones I ·enjoy [take pleasure in].

4.verse: But those who ·turn to [run/hurry after] ·idols [other gods] ·will have much [multiply] pain. I will not ·offer [pour out offerings of] blood to those idols or even ·speak [take on my lips] their names.

5.verse: No, the LORD is ·all I need [my portion and my cup]. ·He takes care of me [You hold my lot; a device like the Urim and Thummim whereby God reveals one’s future; Ex. 28:30].

6.verse: ·My share in life has been pleasant [The boundary lines fall for me in pleasant places]; my ·part [inheritance] has been beautiful.

7.verse: I ·praise [bless] the LORD because he advises me. Even at night, ·I feel his leading [my innards instruct me].

8.verse: I keep the LORD before me always. Because he is ·close by my side [at my right hand], I will not be ·hurt [moved; Acts 2:25].

9.verse: So ·I rejoice and am glad [my heart exults and my glory/soul/or innards is glad]. Even my body ·has hope [dwells securely; Acts 2:26],

10.verse: because you will not ·leave [abandon] me in ·the grave [or the underworld; Sheol]. You will not let your ·holy one [saint; loyal one] ·rot [see the Pit; the grave; Acts 2:27; 13:35].

11.verse: You will teach me ·how to live a holy [the path of] life. ·Being with you will fill me with joy [In your face/presence is the fullness of joy; Acts 2:28]; at your right hand I will find pleasure forever.

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - A prayer of David. LORD, hear ·me begging for fairness [a just cause]; ·listen [pay attention] to my cry for help. ·Pay attention [Bend your ear] to my prayer, because ·I speak the truth [my lips are not deceitful].

2.verse: ·You will judge that I am right [My judgment/vindication will come from before you]; your eyes can see what is ·true [virtuous].

3.verse: You have examined my heart; you have ·tested me all [or visited me at] night. You ·questioned [tested] me without finding anything wrong; ·I have not sinned with my mouth [my mouth has not transgressed].

4.verse: ·I have obeyed your commands [As for the deeds of people, by the word of your lips], ·so I have not done what evil people do [I have kept away from the ways of the violent].

5.verse: ·I have done what you told me [My steps have held fast to your paths]; ·I have not failed [My feet have not slipped].

6.verse: I call to you, ·and [for] you answer me, O God. ·Listen [Extend your ear] to me now, and hear what I say.

7.verse: Your ·love [loyalty; covenant love] is wonderful. ·By your power [At your right hand] you save those who ·trust [find their refuge in] you from ·their enemies [those who rise up against them].

8.verse: Protect me as ·you would protect your own [or the apple/pupil of your] eye. Hide me under the shadow of your wings.

9.verse: Keep me from the wicked who ·attack [mistreat] me, from my enemies who surround me.

10.verse: They ·are selfish [close their callous hearts] and ·brag about themselves [their mouths speak proudly].

11.verse: They have ·chased [tracked] me until they have surrounded me. They ·plan [set their eyes] to throw me to the ground.

12.verse: They are like lions ready to ·kill [tear up prey]; like lions, they sit in ·hiding [ambush; cover].

13.verse: LORD, rise up, ·face [confront] the enemy, and ·throw them down [subdue them]. ·Save [Rescue; Deliver] me from the wicked with your sword.

14.verse: LORD, save me by your ·power [hand] from mortals, from mortals whose ·reward [portion] in the world is in this life. ·They have plenty of food [Your stores have filled their bellies]. ·They have many sons [or Their sons have plenty] and leave ·much money [their surplus] to their children.

15.verse: ·Because I have lived right [In righteousness], I will see your face. When I wake up, I will see your likeness and be satisfied.

1.verse: A Song of Victory - For the director of music. By the LORD’s servant, David. David sang this song to the LORD ·when [on the day] the LORD had ·saved [rescued; delivered] him from Saul and all his other enemies [the occasion is unknown; 2 Sam. 22 parallels this psalm]. He said: I love you, LORD. You are my strength.

2.verse: The LORD is my rock, my ·protection [fortress], my ·Savior [rescuer; deliverer]. My God is my rock. ·I can run to him for safety […in whom I find protection/take refuge]. He is my shield and ·my saving strength [the horn of my salvation; symbolizing strength based on an animal lifting its head triumphantly], my ·defender [stronghold].

3.verse: I ·will call to [call upon] the LORD, who is worthy of praise, and I ·will be [or am] saved from my enemies.

4.verse: The ·ropes [cords] of death ·came around [swirled about; encompassed] me; the ·deadly rivers [floods/torrents of destruction] overwhelmed me.

5.verse: The ·ropes [cords] of death ·wrapped around [entangled; coiled around] me. The ·traps [snares] of death ·were before [confronted; lay ahead of] me.

6.verse: In my ·trouble [distress; anguish] I ·called [cried out] to the LORD. I ·cried out [called] to my God for help. From his ·Temple [sanctuary] he heard my voice; my ·call for help [cry] reached his ears.

7.verse: The earth ·trembled [reeled; quaked] and ·shook [rocked]. The foundations of the mountains began to ·shake [shudder]. They ·trembled [reeled; quaked] because the LORD was angry.

8.verse: Smoke ·came out of his nose [poured/rose from his nostrils], and ·burning [devouring] fire came out of his mouth. Burning coals ·went before [blazed/flamed out from] him.

9.verse: He ·tore open [parted] the ·sky [heavens] and came down with ·dark clouds [storm clouds; thick darkness] under his feet.

10.verse: He rode a ·creature with wings [cherub; a mighty spiritual being/angel; Ezek. 1] and flew. ·He raced […soaring] on the wings of the wind.

11.verse: He made darkness his covering, his ·shelter [canopy; shroud] around him, surrounded by ·fog [thick rain] and clouds.

12.verse: Out of the brightness ·of his presence [before him] came clouds with hail and ·lightning [fiery coals].

13.verse: The LORD thundered from heaven; the ·Most High raised his voice [voice of the Most High resounded], and there was hail and ·lightning [fiery coals].

14.verse: He shot his arrows and scattered his enemies. His many bolts of lightning ·confused them with fear [routed them].

15.verse: ·LORD, you spoke strongly [At your rebuke, O LORD…]. ·The wind blew from your nose […at the blast of breath from your nostrils…]. Then the ·valleys [floor; channels] of the sea ·appeared [were exposed], and the foundations of the earth were ·seen [laid bare].

16.verse: The LORD reached down from ·above [heaven; on high] and ·took [rescued] me; he ·pulled me from the deep water [drew me out of mighty waters].

17.verse: He ·saved [rescued; delivered] me from my powerful enemies, from those who hated me, because they were too strong for me.

18.verse: They ·attacked [confronted] me ·at my time of trouble [in the day of my distress/calamity/disaster], but the LORD ·supported me [was my stay].

19.verse: He took me to a ·safe [spacious; open; broad] place. Because he delights in me, he ·saved [rescued; delivered] me.

20.verse: The LORD ·spared [rewarded] me ·because I did what was right [according to my righteousness]. Because ·I have not done evil [of my innocence; of the cleanness of my hands], he has ·rewarded [restored] me.

21.verse: I have ·followed [obeyed; kept; guarded] the ways of the LORD; I have not done evil by turning away from my God.

22.verse: I ·remember [follow; have before me] all his ·laws [regulations] and have not ·broken [abandoned; turned aside from] his ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

23.verse: I am ·innocent [blameless] before him; I have kept myself from ·doing evil [sin; guilt; iniquity].

24.verse: The LORD ·rewarded [repaid] me ·because I did what was right [according to my righteousness], ·because I did what the LORD said was right [according to my cleanness/purity in his sight].

25.verse: LORD, you ·are [show yourself] ·loyal [faithful; kind] to those who are ·loyal [faithful; kind], and you are good to those who are good.

26.verse: You ·are [show yourself] ·pure [sincere] to those who are ·pure [sincere], but you ·are [show yourself] ·against [hostile/shrewd/cunning/perverse to] those who are ·bad [perverse; devious; crooked].

27.verse: You ·save [rescue; deliver] the ·humble [afflicted], but you ·bring down [watch and humiliate] ·those who are proud [the haughty].

28.verse: LORD, you give light to my lamp. My God ·brightens the darkness around me [lights up/illuminates my darkness].

29.verse: With your help I can ·attack [crush] an army. With God’s help I can ·jump over [scale] a wall.

30.verse: The ·ways [way; path] of God are ·without fault [blameless; perfect]. The LORD’s ·words [promises] are ·pure [tested; flawless; proven true]. He is a shield to those who ·trust [seek protection/take refuge in] him.

31.verse: Who is God? Only the LORD. Who is the Rock? Only our God.

32.verse: God ·is my protection [is my strong fortress; or girds me with strength]. He makes my way ·free from fault [perfect; secure; a wide path].

33.verse: He makes ·me [my feet] like a deer that does not stumble [sure-footed]; he ·helps me stand [sets me] on the ·steep mountains [heights].

34.verse: He trains my hands for battle so my arms can bend a bronze bow.

35.verse: You ·protect me with your saving shield [have given me the shield of your salvation/victory]. You support me with your right hand. ·You have stooped to make [Your help makes] me great.

36.verse: You ·give me a better way to live [broaden my path; widen my steps beneath me], so ·I live as you want me to [my feet do not slip; my ankles do not weaken].

37.verse: I ·chased [pursued] my enemies and ·caught [exterminated] them. I did not ·quit [turn back] until they were ·destroyed [annihilated; consumed].

38.verse: I ·crushed them [shattered them; struck them down] so they couldn’t ·rise [get] up again. They fell beneath my feet.

39.verse: You ·gave me [armed/girded me with] strength ·in [for] battle. You ·made my enemies bow [humbled/subdued my enemies] ·before me [or under my feet].

40.verse: You made my enemies ·turn back [turn their backs; retreat], and I destroyed ·those who hated me [my foes].

41.verse: They ·called for help [looked around], but no one came to ·save [rescue; deliver] them. They ·called [looked] to the LORD, but he did not answer them.

42.verse: I ·beat my enemies into pieces [ground/pulverized them], like dust in the wind. I poured them out like ·mud [mire] in the streets.

43.verse: You ·saved [rescued; delivered] me when the people ·attacked me [quarreled; fought]. You made me the ·leader [ruler; head] of nations. People I never knew serve me.

44.verse: As soon as they hear ·me [or of me], they obey me. Foreigners ·obey [cower/cringe before] me.

45.verse: They all ·become afraid [lose heart/their courage] and ·tremble in [come trembling from] their ·hiding places [fortresses; strongholds].

46.verse: The LORD lives! May my Rock be ·praised [blessed]. Praise the God ·who saves me […of my salvation]!

47.verse: God gives me ·victory [revenge; vengeance] over my enemies and brings ·people [nations] under ·my rule [me].

48.verse: He ·saves [rescues; delivers] me from my enemies. You ·set me over those who hate me [exalt/lift me above my enemies]. You ·saved [rescued; delivered] me from violent people.

49.verse: So I will ·praise [extol] you, LORD, among the nations. I will sing praises to your name.

50.verse: The LORD ·gives great victories [is a tower of salvation] to his king. He ·is loyal [shows kindness/faithful love] to his ·appointed king [anointed], to David and his descendants forever.

1.verse: God’s Works and Word - For the director of music. A psalm of David. The heavens ·declare [recount; narrate] the glory [the manifest presence] of God, and the ·skies [firmament; dome; Gen. 1:6] ·announce [speak out] ·what his hands have made [the works of his hands].

2.verse: Day after day they ·tell the story [bubble/pour forth speech]; night after night they ·tell it again [declare knowledge].

3.verse: They have no speech or words; they have no voice to be heard.

4.verse: But their ·message [line] goes out through all the world; their words go ·everywhere on [to the ends of the] earth. ·The sky [Heaven; In them] is like a ·home [tent] for the sun.

5.verse: The sun comes out like a bridegroom from his ·bedroom [wedding chamber]. It rejoices like an ·athlete [strong man] eager to run a race.

6.verse: The sun rises at one end of the ·sky [heavens] and ·follows its path [its circuit is] to the other end. Nothing hides from its heat.

7.verse: The ·teachings [laws; instructions] of the LORD are perfect; they ·give new strength [revive the soul]. The ·rules [testimonies] of the LORD ·can be trusted [are faithful/sure]; they make ·plain [simpleminded; immature] people wise [Prov. 1:4].

8.verse: The orders of the LORD are ·right [virtuous]; ·they make people happy [rejoicing the heart]. The commands of the LORD are pure; ·they light up the way [giving light to the eyes].

9.verse: ·Respect [Fear] for the LORD [Prov. 1:7] is ·good [pure]; it will ·last [endure] forever. The judgments of the LORD are true; they are ·completely [altogether] ·right [righteous].

10.verse: They are ·worth [desired; coveted] more than gold, even ·the purest [fine] gold. They are sweeter than honey, even the ·finest honey [droppings of the honeycomb].

11.verse: By them your servant is warned. ·Keeping [Observing] them brings great reward.

12.verse: ·People cannot [Who can…?] ·see [detect; understand] their own ·mistakes [errors]. ·Forgive [Clear] me for my ·secret [hidden] sins.

13.verse: ·Keep me [Restrain your servant] from ·the sins of pride [proud thoughts]; don’t let them ·rule [dominate] me. Then I can be pure and innocent of the greatest of sins.

14.verse: ·I hope my ·words [The words of my mouth] and ·thoughts [meditations of my heart] ·please [be before] you. LORD, you are my Rock, ·the one who saves me [and my redeemer].

1.verse: A Prayer for the King - For the director of music. A psalm of David. May the LORD answer you in ·times [the day] of ·trouble [distress]. May the name of the God of Jacob ·protect [defend; provide refuge for] you [Num. 6:24].

2.verse: May he send you help from ·his Temple [the sanctuary] and support you from Mount Zion [location of the Temple].

3.verse: May he remember all your ·offerings [gifts; tributes; grain offerings; Lev. 2] and ·accept [look with favor on] all your ·sacrifices [whole burnt offerings; Lev. 1]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: May he give you ·what you want [all your heart] and ·make all your plans succeed [fulfill all your plans],

5.verse: and we will shout for joy when you ·succeed [are victorious; as in battle], and we will raise a ·flag [banner] in the name of our God. May the LORD ·give you [fulfill] all that you ask for.

6.verse: Now I know the LORD ·helps [saves; gives victory to] his ·appointed king [anointed]. He answers him from his holy heaven and ·saves him [gives him victory] with his strong right hand.

7.verse: Some ·trust in [boast in; rely on] chariots, others in horses, but we ·trust [boast in; rely on] the name of the LORD our God [Is. 2:7].

8.verse: They ·are overwhelmed and defeated [collapse and fall], but we ·march forward and win [rise and stand erect].

9.verse: LORD, ·save [give victory to] the king! Answer us when we call for help.

1.verse: Thanksgiving for the King - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, the king rejoices because of your strength; he is so happy when you ·save him [give him victory/help]!

2.verse: You gave the king ·what he wanted [the desire of his heart] and did not ·refuse [withhold] ·what he asked for [the request of his lips]. ·Selah [Interlude]

3.verse: You put ·good things [rich blessings] before him and placed a gold crown on his head.

4.verse: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him, ·so his years go on and on [length of days forever and ever].

5.verse: He has great glory because you gave him ·victories [help]; you gave him ·honor [splendor] and ·praise [majesty].

6.verse: You ·always [forever] gave him blessings; you made him glad because ·you were with him [of the joy of your presence].

7.verse: The king truly ·trusts [has confidence in] the LORD. Because God Most High always ·loves [is loyal toward] him, he will not be ·overwhelmed [moved].

8.verse: Your hand ·is against [will find out] all your enemies; ·those who hate you will feel your power [your right hand will find out those who hate you].

9.verse: When ·you [the LORD] appear, you will burn them as in a furnace. In your anger you will swallow them up, and fire will burn them up.

10.verse: You will destroy their ·families [offspring] from the earth; their ·children [seed] will not live.

11.verse: They made evil plans against you, but ·their traps [the schemes they devise] won’t ·work [succeed].

12.verse: You will make them turn their backs when you aim your arrows at ·them [their faces].

13.verse: Be ·supreme [exalted], LORD, in your power. We sing and praise your ·greatness [strength].

1.verse: The Prayer of a Suffering Man - For the director of music. To the tune of “The Doe of Dawn.” A psalm of David. My God, my God, why have you ·abandoned [forsaken] me [Matt. 27:46; Mark 15:34]? You seem far from ·saving [helping] me, far away from my groans.

2.verse: My God, I call to you during the day, but you do not answer. I call at night; I ·am not silent [or get no rest].

3.verse: You ·sit as the Holy One [are holy]. ·The praises of Israel are your throne [You are enthroned on the praises of Israel].

4.verse: Our ·ancestors [fathers] ·trusted [had confidence in] you; they ·trusted [had confidence], and you ·saved [rescued; delivered] them.

5.verse: They ·called [cried out] to you for help and were rescued. They ·trusted [had confidence in] you and were not ·disappointed [shamed; humiliated].

6.verse: But I am like a worm instead of ·a man [human]. People ·make fun of [scorn; reproach] me and ·hate [despise] me.

7.verse: Those who look at me ·laugh [ridicule/mock me]. They ·stick out their tongues [throw insults; open lips] and shake their heads.

8.verse: They say, “·Turn to the LORD for help [Trust the LORD]. Maybe he will ·save [rescue; deliver] you. If he ·likes [delights/takes pleasure in] you, maybe he will ·rescue [save; deliver] you.”

9.verse: You ·had my mother give birth to me [brought me out of the womb]. You made me ·trust [have confidence in] you while I was ·just a baby [at the breasts of my mother].

10.verse: ·I have leaned on you since the day I was born [On you I was cast from the womb]; you have been ·my God [mine] ·since my mother gave me birth [from the womb of my mother].

11.verse: So don’t be far away from me. Now ·trouble [distress] is near, and there is no one to help.

12.verse: People have surrounded me like ·angry [many] bulls. Like the strong bulls of Bashan [Deut. 32:14; Mic. 7:14], they ·are on every side [encircle me].

13.verse: Like ·hungry [rending; tearing their prey], roaring lions they open their mouths at me.

14.verse: My strength is gone, like water poured out onto the ground, and my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax [weak, formless]; it has melted inside me.

15.verse: My strength has dried up like a ·clay pot [potsherd], and my tongue sticks to the top of my mouth. You laid me in the dust of death.

16.verse: Evil people have surrounded me; like dogs ·they [a group of evil people] have trapped me. They have ·bitten [pierced; or shriveled] my ·arms [hands] and ·legs [feet].

17.verse: I can count all my bones; people look and stare at me.

18.verse: They divided my clothes among them, and they ·threw [cast] lots for my clothing.

19.verse: But, LORD, don’t be far away. You are my ·strength [or help]; hurry to help me.

20.verse: ·Save [Rescue; Deliver] me from the sword; save my life from the dogs.

21.verse: ·Rescue [Save; Deliver] me from the lion’s mouth; ·save [answer] me from the horns of the bulls.

22.verse: Then I will ·tell my brothers and sisters about you [recount your name/reputation to my brothers]; I will praise you in the ·public meeting [assembly; congregation].

23.verse: Praise the LORD, all you who ·respect [fear] him [Prov. 1:7]. All you ·descendants [seed] of Jacob [Israelites], ·honor [glorify] him; ·fear [revere] him, all you Israelites.

24.verse: He does not ·ignore [despise or disdain] ·those in trouble [the suffering of the afflicted]. He doesn’t hide his face from them but listens when they ·call out to him [cry to him for help].

25.verse: LORD, ·I praise you [from you comes my praise] in the great ·meeting of your people [assembly]; these ·worshipers [who fear him] will see me ·do what I promised [fulfill my vows].

26.verse: ·Poor [or Afflicted] people will eat ·until they are full [and be satisfied]; those who ·look to the LORD [seek him] will praise him. May your hearts live forever!

27.verse: ·People everywhere [All the ends of the earth] will remember and will turn to the LORD. All the families of the nations will worship him

28.verse: because ·the LORD is King [rule belongs to the LORD], and he rules the nations.

29.verse: All the ·powerful people [fat ones] on earth will eat and worship. Everyone will ·bow down to [kneel before] him, all who will ·one day die [go down to the dust and cannot keep themselves alive].

30.verse: The ·people in the future [posterity; seed] will serve him; they will always be told about the Lord.

31.verse: They will ·tell that he does what is right [recount his righteousness]. People who are not yet born will hear what God has done.

1.verse: The Lord the Shepherd - A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd; I ·have everything I need [will lack nothing].

2.verse: He ·lets me rest [makes me lie down] in green pastures. He leads me to ·calm [quiet] water.

3.verse: He ·gives me new strength [renews my soul]. He leads me on paths that are ·right [righteous; or straight] for the ·good [sake] of his ·name [reputation].

4.verse: Even if I walk through ·a very dark valley [or the shadow of death], I will ·not be afraid [fear no evil], because you are with me. Your rod and your shepherd’s staff comfort me.

5.verse: You prepare a ·meal [table] for me in ·front [the presence] of my enemies. You ·pour oil of blessing on my head [anoint my head with oil; oil was a means of refreshment in a hot, dry environment]; you ·fill my cup to overflowing [make my cup overflow; a cup of blessing].

6.verse: Surely your goodness and ·love [loyalty; mercy] will ·be with [pursue; follow] me all my life, and I will live in the house of the LORD ·forever [for length of days].

1.verse: A Welcome for God into the Temple - A psalm of David. The earth belongs to the LORD, and ·everything in it [its fullness]— the world and all its ·people [inhabitants].

2.verse: He ·built [founded] it on the waters and ·set [established] it on the rivers [Gen. 1:9–10; Is. 45:18].

3.verse: Who may go up on the mountain of the LORD [Zion, the location of the Temple]? Who may stand in his holy ·Temple [place]?

4.verse: Only those with clean hands and pure hearts [innocent in actions and thoughts], who have not ·worshiped idols [lifted their souls to false things], who have not made promises ·in the name of a false god [or deceitfully].

5.verse: They will receive a blessing from the LORD; the God who ·saves [rescues; delivers] them will ·declare them right [vindicate them].

6.verse: ·They try to follow God [This is the generation/people of those who seek him]; they ·look to the God of Jacob for help [search for your face, O God of Jacob]. ·Selah [Interlude]

7.verse: ·Open up [Lift up your heads], you gates. ·Open wide [Be lifted up], you ·aged [ancient] doors and the ·glorious King [King of glory] will come in.

8.verse: Who is this ·glorious King [King of glory]? The LORD, strong and mighty. The LORD, ·the powerful warrior [mighty in battle].

9.verse: ·Open up [Lift up your heads], you gates. ·Open wide [Be lifted up], you ·aged [ancient] doors and the ·glorious King [King of glory] will come in.

10.verse: Who is this ·glorious King [King of glory]? The LORD ·All-Powerful [of Heaven’s Armies/Hosts]— he is the ·glorious King [King of glory]. ·Selah [Interlude]

1.verse: A Prayer for God to Guide - Of David. LORD, I ·give myself [lift my soul] to you;

2.verse: my God, I ·trust [have confidence in] you. Do not let me be ·disgraced [shamed]; do not let my enemies ·laugh at [triumph/exult over] me.

3.verse: No one who ·trusts [hopes in; waits on] you will be ·disgraced [shamed], but those who ·sin [betray; are treacherous] without excuse will be ·disgraced [shamed].

4.verse: LORD, ·tell me [make me know] your ways. ·Show [Teach] me ·how to live [your paths].

5.verse: ·Guide [Lead] me in your truth, and teach me, my God, my ·Savior [Helper; Victor]. I ·trust [hope in; wait on] you all day long.

6.verse: LORD, remember your ·mercy [compassion] and ·love [loyalty; covenant love] that you have shown since long ago.

7.verse: Do not remember the sins and ·wrong things I did when I was young [transgressions of my youth]. But remember ·to love me [according to your love/loyalty/covenant love] always ·because you are good [on account of your goodness], LORD.

8.verse: The LORD is good and ·right [upright; virtuous]; he ·points [instructs] sinners to the right way.

9.verse: He shows those who are humble how to do right, and he teaches them his ways.

10.verse: All the LORD’s ·ways [paths] are ·loving [loyal] and ·true [reliable] for those who ·follow [keep; guard] the demands of his ·agreement [covenant].

11.verse: For the sake of your ·name [reputation], LORD, forgive my many sins.

12.verse: ·Are there [Who are…?] those who ·respect [fear] the LORD [Prov. 1:7]? He will ·point [teach] them ·to the best way [the way they should choose].

13.verse: ·They will enjoy a good life [Their soul will dwell/lodge in goodness], and their ·children [seed] will inherit the ·land [or earth].

14.verse: The LORD ·tells his secrets to [confides in; or makes friends with] those who ·respect [fear] him; he ·tells them about [makes known to them] his ·agreement [covenant].

15.verse: My eyes are always ·looking to the LORD for help [toward the LORD]. He will ·keep me [remove my feet] from any traps.

16.verse: Turn to me and ·have mercy on [be gracious to] me, because I am lonely and hurting.

17.verse: ·My troubles have [The distress of my heart has] ·grown larger [widened]; ·free me from [bring me out of] my ·problems [anguish; distress].

18.verse: Look at my ·suffering [affliction] and troubles, and ·take away [forgive] all my sins.

19.verse: Look at how many enemies I have! See how ·much [violently] they hate me!

20.verse: Protect me and ·save [rescue; deliver] me. I ·trust [find refuge in] you, so do not let me be ·disgraced [shamed].

21.verse: My hope is in you, so may ·goodness [blamelessness; innocence] and ·honesty [virtue] guard me.

22.verse: God, ·save [redeem; ransom] Israel from all their ·troubles [distress]!

1.verse: The Prayer of an Innocent Believer - Of David. LORD, ·defend [vindicate] me because I have ·lived an innocent life [walked in innocence; Job 1:1]. I have ·trusted [confidence in] the LORD and never ·doubted [wavered; faltered].

2.verse: LORD, try me and test me; look closely into my ·heart and mind [kidneys and heart; the seat of emotions and mind in Hebrew thought].

3.verse: ·I see your love [Your loyalty/covenant love is before my eyes], and I ·live by your truth [walk in your truth/faithfulness].

4.verse: I do not ·spend time [sit] with ·liars [or worthless people], nor do I ·make friends [go] with ·those who hide their sin [hypocrites].

5.verse: I hate the ·company [assembly] of evil people, and I won’t sit with the wicked.

6.verse: I wash my hands ·to show I am innocent [in innocence], and I ·come to [go around] your altar, LORD.

7.verse: I raise my voice in ·praise [or thanks] and tell of all the ·miracles [wonderful things] you have done.

8.verse: LORD, I love the ·Temple [house] where you live, where your glory [manifest presence] ·is [dwells].

9.verse: Do not ·kill me [take me away] with those sinners or take my life with ·those murderers [the bloodthirsty; men of blood].

10.verse: ·Evil is [Schemes are] in their hands, and ·they do wrong for money [their right hand is full of bribes].

11.verse: But I have ·lived an innocent life [walked in innocence; v. 1], so ·save [redeem; ransom] me and have mercy on me.

12.verse: ·I stand in a safe place [My feet stand on level ground]. LORD, I ·praise [bless] you in the great ·meeting [assembly].
