12.verse: The wicked make evil plans against ·good [righteous] people. They ·grind [gnash] their teeth at them [in anger].

13.verse: But the LORD laughs at the wicked, because he sees that their day [of judgment] is coming.

14.verse: The wicked draw their swords and ·bend [string] their bows to ·kill [fell] the poor and helpless, to ·kill [slaughter] those ·who are honest [whose way is straight].

15.verse: But their swords will ·stab [enter] their own hearts, and their bows will break.

16.verse: It is better to have little and be ·right [or righteous] than to have much and be ·wrong [or wicked; Prov. 15:16; 16:8, 19].

17.verse: The ·power [arm] of the wicked will be broken, but the LORD ·supports [upholds] those who ·do right [are righteous].

18.verse: The LORD ·watches over [knows] the ·lives [days] of the ·innocent [blameless], and their ·reward [inheritance] will last forever.

19.verse: They will not be ashamed ·when trouble comes [in the day of evil/trouble]. They will be ·full [satisfied; satiated] in times of ·hunger [famine].

20.verse: But the wicked will ·die [perish]. The LORD’s enemies will be like the ·beauty [best] of the ·fields [pastures; flowers or animals]; ·they will disappear [vanishing, they will vanish] ·like [or in] smoke.

21.verse: The wicked borrow and don’t pay back, but ·those who do right [the righteous] give freely to others.

22.verse: Those whom ·the LORD [he] blesses will inherit the land, but those he curses will be ·sent away [cut off].

23.verse: When people’s steps ·follow [are made firm/established by] the LORD [Prov. 24:16], God ·is pleased with [delights in] their ways.

24.verse: If they stumble, they will not fall, because the LORD ·holds [upholds] their hand.

25.verse: I was young, and now I am old, but I have never seen ·good [righteous] people ·left helpless [abandoned; forsaken; Gen. 28:15; Matt. 28:20] or their ·children [seed] ·begging for [seeking] food [Prov. 10:3].

26.verse: Good people always lend freely to others, and their ·children [seed] are a blessing.

27.verse: ·Stop doing [Turn aside from] evil and do good, so you will ·live [dwell] forever.

28.verse: The LORD loves ·justice [judgment] and will not ·leave [abandon; forsake] ·those who worship him [his loyal ones/saints]. He will always ·protect [keep; guard] them, but the ·children [seed] of the wicked will ·die [be cut off].

29.verse: ·Good [Righteous] people will inherit the land and will ·live [dwell] in it forever.

30.verse: ·Good people speak with [The mouth of the righteous mutters] wisdom, and ·they say what is fair [their tongue speaks justice/judgment].

31.verse: The ·teachings [instructions; laws] of their God are in their heart [Jer. 31:33], so ·they do not fail to keep them [their steps do not slip/slide/totter].

32.verse: The wicked watch for ·good [righteous] people ·so that they may [to seek to] kill them [Prov. 1:8–19].

33.verse: But the LORD will not ·take away his protection [abandon/forsake them to their hand/power/control] or let ·good people be judged guilty [them be condemned when brought to trial].

34.verse: ·Wait for [Hope in] the LORD and ·follow him [keep/guard his way]. He will ·honor [exalt] you and ·give you [you will inherit] the land, and you will see the wicked ·sent away [or destroyed].

35.verse: I saw a wicked and ·cruel [oppressive] man who ·looked [flourished] like a luxurious cedar tree [strong and healthy].

36.verse: But he ·died [passed on] and was ·gone [no more]; I ·looked for [sought] him, but he couldn’t be found.

37.verse: ·Think of [Observe] the ·innocent [blameless] person, and watch the ·honest [upright; virtuous] one. The man who has peace will have ·children to live after him [posterity].

38.verse: But sinners will be destroyed; ·in the end [or the posterity of] the wicked will ·die [be cut off].

39.verse: The LORD ·saves [rescues; delivers] ·good [righteous] people; he is their strength in times of ·trouble [distress].

40.verse: The LORD helps them and ·saves [rescues; delivers] them; he ·saves [rescues; delivers] them from the wicked, because they ·trust [take refuge] in him for protection.

1.verse: A Prayer in Time of Sickness - A psalm of David ·to remember [or for the memorial offering]. LORD, don’t ·correct [rebuke; reprove] me when you are angry. Don’t ·punish [discipline] me when you are ·furious [enraged; 6:1].

2.verse: Your arrows have ·wounded [pierced] me, and your hand has come down on me.

3.verse: My ·body [flesh] is ·sick [not sound] from your ·punishment [indignation]. Even my bones are not healthy because of my sin.

4.verse: My guilt has ·overwhelmed me [passed over my head]; like a ·load [burden] it ·weighs me down [is too heavy for me].

5.verse: My sores stink and become infected because I was foolish.

6.verse: I am bent over and bowed down; I ·am sad [walk around mourning] all day long.

7.verse: ·I am burning with fever [My loins are burned with fever], and my ·whole body [flesh] is ·sore [not sound].

8.verse: I am weak and ·faint [completely crushed]. I ·moan [groan] from the ·pain I feel [anguish of my heart].

9.verse: LORD, you know everything I ·want [desire; long for]; my ·cries [sighs] are not hidden from you.

10.verse: My heart pounds, and my strength ·is gone [abandons/forsakes me]. ·I am losing my sight [The light of my eyes is not with me].

11.verse: Because of my wounds, ·my friends [those who love me] and neighbors ·avoid [stand away from] me, and my relatives ·stay [stand] far away.

12.verse: ·Some people set traps to kill me [Those who seek my life set traps for me]. Those who ·want [seek] to ·hurt [harm; trouble] me plan trouble; all day long they ·think up [meditate on] ·lies [deception].

13.verse: I am like the deaf; I cannot hear. Like the mute, I cannot ·speak [open my mouth].

14.verse: I am like those who do not hear, who have no ·answer [reproof] ·to give [in their mouth].

15.verse: I ·trust [hope in; wait for] you, LORD. You will answer, my Lord and God.

16.verse: I said, “Don’t let them ·laugh at [rejoice in] me or ·brag [boast] when ·I am defeated [my foot totters/slips].”

17.verse: I am ·about to die [ready to stumble], and ·I cannot forget my pain [my pain is constantly with me].

18.verse: I confess my guilt; I am troubled by my sin.

19.verse: My ·enemies are strong and [living enemies are] healthy, and many hate me for no reason.

20.verse: They repay me with evil for the good I did. They ·lie about me [are my accusers/adversaries] because I ·try to do [pursued] good.

21.verse: LORD, don’t ·leave [abandon; forsake] me; my God, don’t ·go away [be far from me].

22.verse: Quickly come and help me, my Lord and Savior.

1.verse: Life Is Short - For the director of music. For Jeduthun [Levitical musician; 1 Chr. 16:41–42; 25:1, 6; 2 Chr. 5:12]. A psalm of David. I said, “I will ·be careful how I act [guard my way] and will not sin ·by what I say [with my tongue]. I will ·be careful what I say [keep a muzzle on my mouth] around wicked people.”

2.verse: So I kept ·very quiet [silent and still]. I didn’t even say anything good, but ·I became even more upset [my agony/sorrow got worse].

3.verse: ·I became very angry inside [My heart grew hot within me], and as I ·thought [meditated] about it, ·my anger [a fire] burned. So I ·spoke [said with my tongue]:

4.verse: “LORD, ·tell [inform; reveal to] me when ·the end [or my end] will come and how long ·I will live [will be my days]. Let me know how ·long I have [fleeting I am; 90:1–12].

5.verse: You have given ·me only a short life [my days a handbreadth; about four inches]; my lifetime is like nothing to you. Everyone’s life is only ·a breath [vapor; Eccl. 1:2]. ·Selah [Interlude]

6.verse: People are like shadows moving about. All their ·work [or wealth; or turmoil] is ·for nothing [a breath/vapor; Luke 12:13–21; James 4:3–17]; they ·collect things [accumulate riches/wealth] but don’t know who will ·get [gather] them.

7.verse: “So, Lord, what ·hope do I have [do I wait for]? You are my hope.

8.verse: Save me from all my ·sins [transgressions]. Don’t ·let wicked fools make fun of me [set the scorn of fools on me].

9.verse: I am quiet; I do not open my mouth, because you are the one who has done this.

10.verse: ·Quit punishing me [Turn your blows/scourge away from me]; ·your beating is about to kill me [I am exhausted/finished from the hostility/beatings of your hand].

11.verse: You correct and punish people for their sins; like a moth, you destroy what they ·love [covet; desire]. Everyone’s life is only a ·breath [vapor; Eccl. 1:2]. ·Selah [Interlude]

12.verse: “LORD, hear my prayer, and listen to my cry. Do not ignore my tears. I am like a ·visitor [sojourner; wanderer; resident alien] with you. Like my ·ancestors [fathers], I’m only ·here a short time [a temporary resident].

13.verse: Leave me alone so I can be happy before I leave and am no more.”

1.verse: Praise and Prayer for Help - For the director of music. A psalm of David. I waited patiently for the LORD. He ·turned [bent down; inclined; stooped] to me and heard my cry.

2.verse: He ·lifted [drew] me out of the pit of ·destruction [or desolation], out of the ·sticky mud [miry/muddy pit/bog/swamp]. He ·stood me [placed my feet] on a rock and made my ·feet [step] steady.

3.verse: He put a new song [celebrating victory; 33:3; 96:1; 98:1; 144:9; 149:1; Is. 42:10; Rev. 5:9; 14:3] in my mouth, a song of praise to our God. Many people will see this and ·worship [fear] him. Then they will ·trust [find refuge in] the LORD.

4.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] is the person who ·trusts [finds refuge in] the LORD, who doesn’t turn to those who are proud or to those who ·worship [go astray to] ·false gods [a lie].

5.verse: LORD my God, you have done many ·miracles [wonders; great acts]. Your plans for us are many. If I tried to tell them all, there would be too many to count [104:24; 139:17–18; John 21:25].

6.verse: You do not want sacrifices and ·offerings [grain offerings; or gifts; tribute; Lev. 2:1]. But you have ·made a hole in [or pierced; dug] my ear [to make him hear better or perhaps a reference to the ritual that made one a slave forever; Ex. 21:6; Heb. 10:5–7]. You do not ask for burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] and ·sin [or purification] offerings [Lev. 4:3].

7.verse: Then I said, “Look, I have come. It is written about me in the ·book [scroll].

8.verse: My God, I ·want [delight; take pleasure] to do ·what you want [your pleasure]. Your ·teachings [instructions; laws] are in my heart.”

9.verse: I will tell ·about your goodness [the good news] in the great ·meeting of your people [assembly]. LORD, you know ·my lips are not silent [I have not restrained my lips].

10.verse: I do not hide your ·goodness [righteousness] in my heart; I speak about your ·loyalty [faithfulness] and ·salvation [victory]. I do not hide your ·love [loyalty] and ·truth [faithfulness] from the people in the great ·meeting [assembly].

11.verse: LORD, do not ·hold back [restrain] your ·mercy [compassion] from me; let your ·love [loyalty] and ·truth [faithfulness] always protect me.

12.verse: ·Troubles [Evils] have surrounded me; ·there are too many to count [without number]. My ·sins [iniquities] have ·caught [overtaken] me so that I cannot see [a way to escape]. I have more ·sins [iniquities] than hairs on my head, and ·I have lost my courage [my heart fails/abandons/forsakes me].

13.verse: ·Please [Be pleased], LORD, ·save [rescue; deliver] me. Hurry, LORD, to help me.

14.verse: People are ·trying to kill me [seeking my life]. Shame them and disgrace them. People want to hurt me. Let them ·run away [be turned back] in disgrace.

15.verse: People are ·making fun of me [saying to me, “Aha! Aha!”]. Let them be ·shamed into silence [devastated by their own shame].

16.verse: But let those who ·follow [seek] you be happy and glad. They love you for ·saving [delivering] them. May they always say, “·Praise [Magnify; Great is] the LORD!”

17.verse: Lord, because I am poor and ·helpless [needy], please ·remember [think of; consider] me. You are my helper and ·savior [rescuer; deliverer]. My God, do not ·wait [delay].

1.verse: A Prayer in Time of Sickness - For the director of music. A psalm of David. ·Happy [Blessed] are those who ·think about [or care for] the poor [James 1:27]. ·When trouble comes [In the day of trouble/evil], the LORD will ·save [rescue; deliver] them.

2.verse: The LORD will ·protect [guard; keep] them and ·spare their life [keep them alive] and will ·bless them [make them happy] in the land. He will not ·let their enemies take them [give their lives to their enemy; or give them over to the desire of their enemy].

3.verse: The LORD will give them strength when they are ·sick [on their sickbed], and he will ·make them well again [restore them from their bed of illness].

4.verse: I said, “LORD, have ·mercy [compassion] on me. Heal me, because I have sinned against you.”

5.verse: My enemies are saying evil things about me. They say, “When will he die and ·be forgotten [his name/reputation perish]?”

6.verse: Some people come to see me, but ·they lie [speak deceptive/vain things]. ·They just come to get bad news [Their hearts collect iniquities]. Then they go ·and gossip [out and speak].

7.verse: All ·my enemies [those who hate me] whisper about me and ·think [imagine] ·the worst [trouble; evil] about me.

8.verse: They say, “·He has a terrible disease [or An evil spell has been cast on him]. He ·will never get out of bed again [lies down and will not get up].”

9.verse: ·My best and truest friend [A man of peace in whom I trust/find support], who ate at my table, has ·even turned against me [lifted his heel against me; an act of treachery; 55:12–14; Matt. 26:23; Mark 14:18; Luke 22:21; John 13:18].

10.verse: LORD, have ·mercy [compassion] on me. ·Give me strength [Raise me up] so I can pay them back.

11.verse: Because my enemies do not ·defeat [triumph over; or make fun of] me, I know you are ·pleased [delighted] with me.

12.verse: Because I am ·innocent [blameless], you support me and will ·let me be with you [set me in your presence] forever.

13.verse: ·Praise [Blessed be] the LORD, the God of Israel. ·He has always been […from everlasting to everlasting], and he will always be. Amen and amen [verse 13 is a doxology that closes Book 1].

1.verse: Book 2: Psalms 42–72 Wishing to Be Near God - For the director of music. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. As a deer ·thirsts [longs; pants] for streams of water, so ·I [my soul] ·thirst [longs] for you, God.

2.verse: ·I [My soul] thirst for the living God. When can I go to ·meet with [see] ·him [the face of God]?

3.verse: Day and night, my tears have been my food. People are always saying, “Where is your God?”

4.verse: When I remember these things, I ·speak with a broken heart [pour out my soul]. I used to walk with the ·crowd [throng] and lead them to ·God’s Temple [the house of God] with ·songs of praise [the sound of praise and thanks, a crowd in procession].

5.verse: Why ·am I so sad [are you cast down, my soul]? Why ·am I so upset [are you groaning/in an uproar]? I ·should [or will] ·put my hope in [wait for] God and ·keep praising [or will again praise] him, my ·Savior [Victor] and

6.verse: my God. ·I am very sad [My soul is cast down]. So I remember you ·where the Jordan River begins [from the land of Jordan], ·near the peaks of [and from] Hermon and Mount Mizar [far from the Temple where God made his presence known].

7.verse: ·Troubles have come again and again [Deep calls to deep], ·sounding like waterfalls [at the sound of your torrents; waters represent distress; 69:1–2]. Your waves and your breakers ·are crashing all around [pass over] me.

8.verse: The LORD ·shows [commands] his ·true love [loyalty; covenant love] every day. At night I have a song, and I pray to my living God.

9.verse: I say to God, my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me? Why am I ·sad [going around in mourning] and ·troubled [oppressed] by my enemies?”

10.verse: My enemies’ ·insults [scorn] make me feel as if my bones were ·broken [murdered]. They are always saying, “Where is your God?”

11.verse: Why ·am I so sad [are you cast down, my soul]? Why ·am I so upset [are you groaning/in an uproar]? I ·should [or will] ·put my hope in [wait for] God and ·keep praising [or will again praise] him, my ·Savior [Victor] and my God.

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - God, defend me. ·Argue my case [Vindicate me, O God, and contend for/defend me] against ·those who don’t follow you [a godless nation]. ·Save [Rescue; Deliver] me from ·liars [deceivers] and those who ·do evil [are unjust].

2.verse: God, you are my ·strength [refuge]. Why have you rejected me? Why am I ·sad [going around in mourning] and ·troubled [oppressed] by my enemies?

3.verse: Send me your light and ·truth [faithfulness] to ·guide [lead] me. Let them ·lead [bring] me to your holy mountain [Zion, the location of the Temple], to ·where you live [your dwelling].

4.verse: Then I will go to the altar of God, to God who is my joy and happiness. I will praise you with a ·harp [lyre], God, my God.

5.verse: Why ·am I so sad [are you downcast, my soul]? Why ·am I so upset [are you groaning/in an uproar]? I ·should [or will] ·put my hope in [wait for] God and ·keep praising [or will again praise] him, my ·Savior [Victor] and my God.

1.verse: A Prayer for Help - For the director of music. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. God, we have heard ·about you [with our ears; 78:3]. Our ·ancestors [fathers] ·told [recited to] us what you did in their days, in days long ago.

2.verse: With your ·power [hand] you ·forced [dispossessed] the nations out of the land and ·placed [planted] our ancestors here. You ·destroyed [troubled] ·those other nations [the peoples], but you ·made our ancestors grow strong [set them free].

3.verse: It wasn’t their swords that ·took [possessed] the land. It wasn’t their ·power [arm] that gave them victory. But it was your ·great power [arm] and ·strength [right hand]. ·You were with them […and the light of your face] because you ·loved [delighted in] them.

4.verse: My God, you are my King. ·Your commands led Jacob’s people to victory [or You command victory for Jacob; Jacob is another name for Israel].

5.verse: With your help we pushed ·back [down] our enemies. In your name we trampled those who ·came [rose up] against us.

6.verse: I don’t trust my bow to help me, and my sword can’t ·save me [give me victory].

7.verse: You ·saved us from [gave us victory over] our foes, and you made ·our enemies [those who hate us] ashamed.

8.verse: We will praise God every day; we will ·praise [give thanks to] your name forever. ·Selah [Interlude]

9.verse: But you have rejected us and ·shamed [humiliated] us. You don’t ·march [go out] with our armies anymore [Ex. 15:3; 2 Chr. 20:20–21].

10.verse: You let our enemies push us back, and those who hate us have ·taken our wealth [plundered us].

11.verse: You ·gave us away [made us] like sheep ·to be eaten [for slaughter] and have scattered us among the nations.

12.verse: You sold your people for nothing and made no profit on the sale.

13.verse: You made us a ·joke [reproach] to our neighbors; those around us ·laugh [ridicule] and make fun of us.

14.verse: You made us a ·joke [byword; proverb] to the other nations; people shake their heads.

15.verse: I am always in disgrace, and ·I am [my face is] covered with shame.

16.verse: My enemy is getting ·even [revenge] with ·insults [taunts] and curses.

17.verse: All these things have happened to us, but we have not forgotten you or ·failed to keep [been false to; betrayed] our ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with you [perhaps a reference to the covenant with Moses; Ex. 19–24].

18.verse: Our hearts haven’t turned ·away [back] from you, and ·we haven’t stopped following you [our steps have not departed from your way].

19.verse: But you crushed us in this place where ·wild dogs [jackals] live [desolate areas], and you covered us with ·deep darkness [or the shadow of death; Nah. 1:8].

20.verse: If we had forgotten the name of our God or ·lifted [spread] our hands in prayer to ·foreign [strange] gods,

21.verse: ·God would have known [Would not God discover this…?], because he knows ·what is in [the secrets of] our hearts.

22.verse: But for you we are ·in danger of death [killed] all the time. People think we are worth no more than sheep to be ·killed [slaughtered; Is. 53:7].

23.verse: Wake up, Lord! Why are you sleeping? Get up! Don’t reject us forever [Lam. 5:22].

24.verse: Why do you hide your face from us? Have you forgotten our ·pain [affliction] and ·troubles [oppression]?

25.verse: We have ·been pushed down [sunk down] into the ·dirt [dust]; ·we are flat on the ground [our stomachs cleave to the earth].

26.verse: ·Get [Rise] up and help us. Because of your ·love [loyalty], ·save [redeem; ransom] us.

1.verse: A Song for the King’s Wedding - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation]. A love song of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. ·Beautiful words fill my mind [My heart is stirred with a good word]. I ·am speaking of royal things [or address my work to the king]. My tongue is like the pen of a skilled writer [Ezra 7:6].

2.verse: You are more ·handsome [or excellent] than anyone, and ·you are an excellent speaker [grace flows from your lips; Prov. 22:11], so God has blessed you forever.

3.verse: Put on your sword ·at your side [on your thigh], powerful warrior. Show your ·glory [splendor] and majesty.

4.verse: In your majesty ·win [ride forth for] the victory for what is ·true [faithful] and ·right [righteous]. Your ·power [right hand] ·will do [teaches you] amazing things.

5.verse: Your sharp arrows will ·enter [pierce] the hearts of the king’s enemies. ·Nations [Peoples] will ·be defeated before [fall beneath] you.

6.verse: ·God, your throne will last [or Your throne is a throne of God] forever and ever. ·You will rule your kingdom with fairness [A scepter of virtue will be the scepter of your kingdom].

7.verse: You love ·right [righteousness] and hate ·evil [wickedness], so God has ·chosen [anointed] you from among your ·friends [companions]; ·he has set you apart with much joy […with the oil of joy; kings were anointed with oil at their coronation; 1 Sam. 10:1; 16:13; Heb. 1:8–9].

8.verse: Your clothes smell like myrrh, aloes, and cassia. From palaces of ivory ·music [stringed instruments] comes to make you happy.

9.verse: Kings’ daughters are among your honored women. Your ·bride [queen; consort] stands at your right side wearing gold from Ophir [perhaps a region in southern Arabia].

10.verse: Listen to me, daughter; look and ·pay attention [incline your ear]. Forget your people and your father’s ·family [house; Gen. 2:24].

11.verse: The king ·loves [desires; longs for] your beauty. Because he is your ·master [lord], you should ·obey [bow yourself before] him.

12.verse: ·People from the city [The daughter] of Tyre have brought ·a gift [tribute]. Wealthy people ·will want to meet you [seek your favor].

13.verse: The ·princess [daughter of the king] is ·very beautiful [all glorious within]. Her gown is woven with gold.

14.verse: In her ·beautiful [embroidered] clothes she is brought to the king. ·Her bridesmaids [Virgins] follow behind her, and ·they are also brought to him [her friends follow].

15.verse: They come with happiness and joy; they enter the king’s palace.

16.verse: You will have sons to replace your fathers [addressed to the king]. You will make them ·rulers [princes] through all the land.

17.verse: I will make your name famous from now on, so people will praise you forever and ever.

1.verse: God Protects His People - For the director of music. By ·alamoth [maidens; young women; perhaps for soprano voices]. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. God is our ·protection [refuge] and our strength. He ·always helps [is an ever present/timely help] in times of ·trouble [distress].

2.verse: So we will not be afraid even if the earth ·shakes [quakes], or the mountains ·fall [reel; totter] into the heart of the sea,

3.verse: even if the ·oceans [waters] roar and foam, or the mountains ·shake [tremble] at ·the raging sea [its surging]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: There is a river ·that [whose channels/streams] brings joy to the city of God, the holy place where God Most High lives.

5.verse: God is in that city, and so it will not ·be shaken [reel; totter]. God will help her at dawn.

6.verse: Nations ·tremble [roar] and kingdoms ·shake [reel; totter]. God ·shouts [gives forth his voice] and the earth ·crumbles [melts].

7.verse: The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] is with us; the God of Jacob is our ·defender [refuge; fortress]. ·Selah [Interlude]

8.verse: Come and see what the LORD has done, ·the amazing things he has done [or the desolations he has brought] on the earth.

9.verse: He stops wars ·everywhere on [to the ends of] the earth. He breaks all bows and shatters spears and burns up the ·chariots [or shields] with fire.

10.verse: God says, “Be still and know that I am God. I will be ·praised [exalted] in all the nations; I will be ·praised [exalted] throughout the earth.”

11.verse: The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] is with us; the God of Jacob is our ·defender [refuge; fortress]. ·Selah [Interlude]

1.verse: God, the King of the World - For the director of music. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. Clap your hands, all you people. Shout to God with ·joy [jubilant shouts/cries/sound].

2.verse: The LORD Most High is ·wonderful [awesome]. He is the great King over all the earth!

3.verse: He ·defeated [subdues] ·nations [or armies] ·for [under] us and ·put them under our control [peoples under our feet].

4.verse: He chose ·the land we would inherit [for us our heritage/inheritance]. We are the ·children [pride] of Jacob, whom he loved. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: God has risen with a shout of joy; the LORD has risen ·as the trumpets sounded [with the sound of the ram’s horn].

6.verse: Sing praises to God. Sing praises. Sing praises to our King. Sing praises.

7.verse: God is King of all the earth, so sing a ·song of praise [psalm; a skillful psalm; meditation; maskil] to him.

8.verse: God is King over the nations. God sits on his holy throne.

9.verse: The ·leaders [princes] of the ·nations [or armies] ·meet [gather together] with the ·people [or army] of the God of Abraham, because the ·leaders [shields; military leaders] of the earth belong to God. He is ·supreme [highly exalted].

1.verse: Jerusalem, the City of God - A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. The LORD is great; ·he should [and greatly to] be praised in the city of our God, on his holy mountain [Mount Zion, the location of the Temple].

2.verse: It is ·high and beautiful [beautiful in elevation] ·and brings joy to [the joy of] the whole world [Lam. 2:15]. Mount Zion ·is like the high mountains [on the sides] of ·the north [or Zaphon; comparing Yahweh’s mountain with the mountain of Baal]; it is the city of the Great King.

4.verse: Kings joined together and came ·to attack the city [on together; 2:1].

5.verse: But when they saw it, they were ·amazed [astonished]. They ran away in ·fear [panic].

6.verse: ·Fear [Trembling] ·took hold of [seized] them; they ·hurt [were in pain] like a woman ·having a baby [in labor].

7.verse: You ·destroyed [broke up] the ·large trading ships [ships of Tarshish; large trading vessels capable of going to distant ports; Tarshish may have been in Spain (Tartessus) or an island in the eastern Mediterranean; Is. 2:16; Jon. 1:3] with an east wind.

8.verse: First we heard and now we have seen that God ·will always keep his city safe [establishes forever]. It is the city of the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], the city of our God. ·Selah [Interlude]

9.verse: God, we come into your Temple to ·think [ponder; meditate] about your ·love [loyalty].

10.verse: God, your name is known everywhere; ·all over the earth people [the ends of the earth] praise you. Your right hand is full of ·goodness [righteousness; or victory].

11.verse: Mount Zion is happy and ·all the towns [the daughters] of Judah rejoice, because ·your decisions are fair [or of your judgments].

12.verse: Walk around Jerusalem and count its towers.

13.verse: ·Notice how strong they are [Set your heart on its ramparts]. Look at the ·palaces [citadels]. Then you can ·tell [recount it to] ·your children about them [a later generation].

14.verse: This God is our God forever and ever. He will guide us from now on.

1.verse: Trusting Money Is Foolish - For the director of music. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as Temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. Listen to this, all you ·nations [peoples]; ·listen [give ear], all you who live on earth.

2.verse: Listen, both ·great [high] and ·small [low], rich and poor together.

3.verse: ·What I say is wise [My mouth speaks wisdom], and ·my heart speaks with [the meditation of my heart is] understanding.

4.verse: I will ·pay attention [extend my ear] to a ·wise saying [proverb]; I will ·explain [solve] my riddle on the ·harp [lyre].

5.verse: Why should I ·be afraid of [fear] ·bad [evil] days? ·Why should I fear when evil people […when the guilt of deceivers/the treacherous] surround me?

6.verse: They ·trust [find refuge] in their ·money [wealth] and ·brag [boast] about their riches.

7.verse: No one can ·buy back [ransom; redeem] the life of ·another [or a brother]. No one can ·pay [give a ransom to] God for his own life,

8.verse: because the ·price [ransom; redemption] of a life is ·high [precious]. No payment is ever enough.

9.verse: Do people live forever? Don’t they all ·face death [see the Pit; 16:10]?

10.verse: See, even wise people die. Fools and stupid people also ·die [perish; Eccl. 2:12–16] and ·leave [abandon; forsake] their wealth to others.

11.verse: Their graves will ·always [forever] be their homes. ·They will live there from now on […their dwelling to all generations], even though they named places after themselves.

12.verse: Even rich people do not ·live forever [abide]; like the animals, people ·die [perish; Eccl. 3:19].

13.verse: This is ·what will happen to [the way/path for] those who trust in themselves and ·to their followers [or the end of those; after them] who ·believe them [are pleased with their mouth]. ·Selah [Interlude]

14.verse: Like sheep, they ·must die [head to Sheol; the grave or the underworld], and death will be their shepherd. ·Honest [Virtuous; Upright] people will ·rule [have dominion] over them in the morning, and their bodies will ·rot in a grave [waste away in Sheol] far from ·home [their grand homes].

15.verse: But God will ·save [ransom; redeem] my life and will take me from ·the grave [or the underworld; Sheol; v. 14]. ·Selah [Interlude]

16.verse: Don’t be afraid of ·rich [wealthy] people because their houses are more ·beautiful [or substantial].

17.verse: They don’t take anything ·to the grave [when they die]; their ·wealth [substance] won’t go down with them.

18.verse: Even though they were ·praised [blessed] when they were alive— and people may praise you when you ·succeed [do well]—

19.verse: they will go to where their ancestors are [the grave]. They will never see light again.

20.verse: Rich people with no understanding are just like animals that ·die [perish].

1.verse: God Wants True Worship - A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. The God of gods, the LORD, speaks. He ·calls [proclaims to; summons] the earth from the rising to the setting sun.

2.verse: God shines from ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple], ·whose beauty is perfect [the perfection of beauty; 48:2; Lam. 2:15].

3.verse: Our God comes, and he will not be silent. A fire ·burns [consumes] in front of him [Heb. 12:29], and a ·powerful storm [whirlwind; tempest] surrounds him [Is. 66:15].

4.verse: He ·calls to [summons] the ·sky [heavens] above and to the earth that he might judge his people.

5.verse: He says, “Gather around, you ·who worship me [holy ones; saints], who have made an ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with me, using a sacrifice [Ex. 24:5–8].”

6.verse: God is the judge, and even the ·skies say he is right [heavens proclaim his righteousness]. ·Selah [Interlude]

7.verse: God says, “My people, listen to me; Israel, I will ·testify [witness] against you. I am God, your God.

8.verse: I do not ·scold [reprimand; rebuke] you for your sacrifices. You always bring me your burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17].

9.verse: But I do not ·need [or accept] bulls from your ·stalls [house] or goats from your ·pens [folds],

10.verse: because every animal of the forest is already mine. The cattle on a thousand hills are mine.

11.verse: I know every bird on the mountains, and every living thing in the fields is mine.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell you, because the earth and ·everything in it [its fullness] are mine.

13.verse: ·I don’t [Do I…?] eat the meat of bulls or drink the blood of goats.

14.verse: Give an ·offering to show thanks [thank offering] to God [Lev. 7:12; 22:29; Heb. 13:15]. Give God Most High what you have ·promised [vowed].

15.verse: Call to me in times of ·trouble [distress]. I will ·save [rescue; deliver] you, and you will ·honor [glorify] me.”

16.verse: But God says to the wicked, “Why do you ·talk about [recount] my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements]? Why do you ·mention [lift up on your mouth] my ·agreement [covenant; treaty]?

17.verse: You hate my ·teachings [instruction; discipline; Prov. 1:7] and turn your back on what I say.

18.verse: When you see a thief, you ·join [delight in; or run with] him. ·You take part in adultery [Your lot/portion is with adulterers].

19.verse: You ·don’t stop your mouth from speaking evil [send your mouth into evil], and your tongue ·makes up lies [is yoked to deception].

20.verse: You sit around and speak against your brother and ·lie [give a stain/fault] about your mother’s son.

21.verse: I have kept quiet while you did these things, so you thought I was just like you. But I will ·scold [reprimand; reprove] you and ·accuse [indict] you ·to your face [before your eyes].

22.verse: “·Think about [Understand] this, you who forget God. Otherwise, I will tear you apart, and no one will ·save [protect] you.

23.verse: Those people ·honor [glorify] me who bring me ·offerings to show thanks [thank offerings; v. 14]. And I, God, will save those who ·do that [go on my way/path].”

1.verse: A Prayer for Forgiveness - For the director of music. A psalm of David when the prophet Nathan came to David after ·David’s sin with Bathsheba [he committed adultery with/had gone to Bathsheba; 2 Sam. 11:1—12:25]. God, be ·merciful [gracious] to me ·because you are loving [according to your love/loyalty]. ·Because you are always ready to be merciful [According to your abundant compassion], ·wipe [blot] out all my ·wrongs [transgressions].

2.verse: Wash ·away [me thoroughly from] all my guilt and make me clean ·again [from my sin].

3.verse: I know about my ·wrongs [transgressions], and ·I can’t forget my sin [my sin is continually before me].

4.verse: You ·are the only one [alone] I have sinned against; I have done ·what you say is wrong [evil in your eyes]. You are ·right [vindicated] when you speak and ·fair [pure; blameless] when you judge.

5.verse: I was ·brought into this world [born] in ·sin [guilt]. In sin my mother ·gave birth to [conceived] me [Rom. 3:9–20; 7:18].

6.verse: You ·want me to be completely truthful [desire truth/faithfulness in my inward parts], ·so teach me wisdom [and secretly you make me know wisdom].

7.verse: ·Take away my sin [Remove my sin with hyssop; Ex. 12:22; a plant used in purification rituals; Lev. 14:4, 6, 49–51; Num. 19:18], and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow [Is. 1:18].

10.verse: Create in me a ·pure [clean] heart, God, and ·make my spirit right again [renew a right/steadfast spirit in me].

11.verse: Do not send me away from you or take your ·Holy Spirit [or holy spirit] away from me.

12.verse: ·Give me back [Restore to me] the joy of your ·salvation [rescue]. ·Keep me strong by giving [Sustain in] me a willing spirit.

13.verse: Then I will teach your ways to ·those who do wrong [transgressors], and sinners will turn back to you.

14.verse: God, save me from ·the guilt of murder [bloodshed], God of my ·salvation [rescue], and ·I will sing about your goodness [let my tongue sing for joy of your righteousness].

15.verse: Lord, let ·me speak [my lips open] so ·I may praise you [my mouth may speak your praise].

16.verse: You are not pleased by sacrifices, or I would give them. You don’t want burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17].

17.verse: The sacrifice God wants is a broken spirit. God, you will not ·reject [despise] a heart that is broken and ·sorry for sin [contrite; Is. 57:15; 66:2; Mic. 6:6–8].

18.verse: Do whatever good you wish for ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple]. Rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

19.verse: Then you will be pleased with right sacrifices and whole burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17], and bulls will be offered on your altar.

1.verse: God Will Punish the Proud - For the director of music. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of David. When Doeg the Edomite came to Saul and ·said [reported] to him, “David ·is in [has come to/entered] Ahimelech’s house [1 Sam. 21:7; 22:7–23].” Mighty warrior, why do you ·brag [boast] about the evil you do? God’s ·love [loyalty] will continue ·forever [everyday; all day].

2.verse: You think up ·evil plans [destruction]. Your tongue is like a sharp razor [Prov. 18:21], making up ·lies [deception].

3.verse: You love ·wrong [evil] more than ·right [good] and ·lies [falsehood] more than speaking the truth. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: You love words that ·bite [destroy; swallow up] and ·tongues that lie [deceptive tongues; James 3:1–12].

5.verse: But God will ·ruin you [break you down] forever. He will grab you and ·throw [tear] you out of your tent; he will ·tear you away [uproot you] from the land of the living. ·Selah [Interlude]

6.verse: Those who ·do right [are righteous] will see this and ·fear God [fear; Prov. 1:7]. They will laugh at you and say,

7.verse: “·Look what happened to [Behold] the man who did not ·depend on God [make God his refuge] but ·depended on [trusted/put his confidence in] ·his money [the abundance of his wealth]. He grew strong by his ·evil [destructive] plans.”

8.verse: But I am like ·an olive tree growing [a green olive tree] in God’s ·Temple [house; 1:3; 92:12–13; Jer. 11:16]. I ·trust [have confidence in] God’s ·love [loyalty] forever and ever.

9.verse: God, I will ·thank [praise] you forever for what you have done. With ·those who worship you [his loyal ones/saints], I will ·trust [put my confidence in] you because you are good.

1.verse: The Unbelieving Fool - For the director of music. By mahalath [perhaps “sickness”]. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of David. Fools say ·to themselves [in their hearts], “There is no God [Psalm 14 largely parallels this psalm].” ·Fools are evil [They are corrupt] and do ·terrible [detestable] things [Deut. 32:5]; none of them does anything good.

3.verse: But all have ·turned [wandered] away. Together, everyone has become ·evil [perverse]; none of them does anything good. Not a single person [Rom. 3:10–12].

4.verse: Don’t ·the wicked [those who do evil] ·understand [know]? They ·destroy [consume; eat] my people as if they were ·eating [consuming] bread. They do not ·ask God for help [call on God].

5.verse: The wicked are ·filled [terrified] with terror where there ·had been nothing to [was no] fear. God will scatter the bones of ·your enemies [the godless]. You will ·defeat [shame; humiliate] them, because God has rejected them.

6.verse: I pray that ·victory [salvation] will come to Israel from Mount Zion [the location of the Temple, the house of God]! May God ·bring them back [restore the fortunes of his people; perhaps at the end of the exile]. Then the people of Jacob will rejoice, and the people of Israel will be glad.

1.verse: A Prayer for Help - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of David when the Ziphites went to Saul and said, “·We think David is [Is not David…?] hiding among ·our people [us; 1 Sam. 23:13–29; 26:1].” God, ·save [give victory to] me ·because of who you are [by your name]. By your ·strength [name] ·show that I am innocent [contend for me].

2.verse: Hear my prayer, God; ·listen [give ear] to ·what I say [the speech of my mouth].

3.verse: Strangers ·turn [rise up] against me, and ·cruel people want to kill me [violent people seek my life]. They do not ·care about God [think about God; set God before them]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: ·See [Behold], God ·will help me [is my helper]; the Lord ·will support me [is with/or among those who uphold me].

5.verse: Let ·my enemies be punished with their own evil [evil return to my enemies]. ·Destroy [Put an end to] them because ·you are loyal to me [of your faithfulness].

6.verse: I will ·offer a sacrifice as a special gift [sacrifice a freewill offering] to you. I will ·thank [praise] ·you [your name], LORD, because you are good.

7.verse: You have ·saved [rescued] me from all my ·troubles [distress], and ·I have seen my enemies defeated [my eyes have looked on my enemies].

1.verse: A Prayer About a False Friend - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of David. God, ·listen [give ear] to my prayer and do not ·ignore [hide from] my ·cry for help [supplication].

2.verse: Pay attention to me and answer me. ·I am troubled and [My cares give me no peace and I am] upset

3.verse: by ·what the enemy says [the voice/sound of my enemy] and ·how the wicked look at me [before the stares/or because of the afflictions of my enemy]. They bring troubles down on me, and in anger they ·attack [persecute; or hate] me.

4.verse: ·I am frightened inside [My heart writhes inside me]; the terror of death has ·attacked [fallen on] me.

5.verse: ·I am scared and shaking [Fear and trembling come on me], and ·terror [shuddering] ·grips [overwhelms] me.

6.verse: I said, “·I wish [O that] I had wings like a dove. Then I would fly away and rest.

7.verse: I would ·wander [flee] far away and stay in the ·desert [wilderness]. ·Selah [Interlude]

8.verse: I would hurry to my place of escape, far away from the raging wind and ·storm [tempest].”

9.verse: Lord, ·destroy [or frustrate; or check; or confuse; swallow] and ·confuse [confound; divide] their ·words [speech; or plans; tongues; Gen. 11:1–9], because I see violence and ·fighting [strife; contention; accusation] in the city.

10.verse: Day and night they are all around its walls, and evil and trouble are everywhere inside.

11.verse: Destruction is ·everywhere in the city [in its midst]; ·trouble [oppression] and ·lying [deception] never leave its ·streets [public square].

12.verse: It was not an enemy ·insulting [scorning; reproaching] me. I could ·stand [bear] that. It was not someone who hated me who insulted me. I could hide from him.

13.verse: But it is you, a person like me, my companion and good friend.

14.verse: We had ·a good friendship [sweet fellowship together] and walked ·together [or noisily; or quietly; or with the crowd] to God’s ·Temple [house].

15.verse: Let death ·take away [rise up on] ·my enemies [them]. Let them ·die while they are still young [go down to the grave/underworld/Sheol while they are living] because evil ·lives with them [is their home within them].

16.verse: But I will call to God for help, and the LORD will ·save me [give me victory].

17.verse: Morning, noon, and ·night [evening] I ·am troubled and upset [sigh and moan], but he will listen to ·me [my voice].

18.verse: Many are against me, but he ·keeps me safe [redeems/ransoms me whole/in peace] in battle.

19.verse: God who ·lives forever [or is enthroned from of old] will hear me and ·punish [humble] them. ·Selah [Interlude] But they will not change; they do not fear God [Prov. 1:7].

20.verse: ·The one who was my friend attacks his friends [He sends his hand against his friend] and ·breaks [violates; profanes] his ·promises [covenant; treaty].

21.verse: His words are ·slippery like [smoother than] butter, but war is in his heart. His words are ·smoother [softer] than oil, but they cut like ·knives [unsheathed swords; Prov. 5:3–4].

22.verse: ·Give [Cast; Throw] your ·worries [burden; that which he has given you] to the LORD, and he will ·take care of [sustain] you. He will never let ·good [righteous] people ·down [be moved].

23.verse: But, God, you will bring down the wicked to the ·grave [deepest pit; pit of corruption]. Murderers and ·liars [deceivers] will ·live only half a lifetime [not live half their days]. But I will ·trust [have confidence] in you.

1.verse: Trusting God for Help - For the director of music. To the tune of “The Dove in the Distant Oak.” A miktam [perhaps “inscription”] of David when the Philistines ·captured [seized] him in Gath [referring to the episode in 1 Sam. 21:10–15 or to an unrecorded event]. God, be ·merciful [gracious] to me because people are ·chasing [trampling; hounding; snapping at] me; the battle has ·pressed [harrassed] me all day long.

2.verse: My enemies have ·chased [trampled on; hounded; snapped at] me all day; there are many proud people fighting me.

3.verse: When I am afraid, I will ·trust [have confidence in] you.

4.verse: I praise God for his word. I ·trust [have confidence in] God, so I am not afraid. What can ·human beings [flesh] do to me?

5.verse: All day long they ·twist [find fault with] my words; all their evil ·plans [or thoughts] are against me.

6.verse: They ·wait [or attack; or strive]. They hide. They watch my ·steps [heels], hoping to kill me.

7.verse: God, do not let them escape; ·punish [bring down] the ·foreign nations [peoples] in your anger.

8.verse: You have ·recorded [recounted] my ·troubles [wanderings]. You have ·kept a list of my tears [put my tears in your bottle]. Aren’t they in your records?

9.verse: On the day I call for help, my enemies will ·be defeated [turn back]. I know that God is on my side.

10.verse: I praise God for his word to me; I praise the LORD for his word.

11.verse: I ·trust [have confidence] in God. I will not be afraid. What can people do to me?

12.verse: God, I must keep my ·promises [vows] to you. I will give you my ·offerings to thank you [thank offerings],

13.verse: because you have ·saved [protected] me from death. You have kept ·me from being defeated [my feet from falling]. So I will walk ·with [in the presence of] God in light ·among [of] the living.

1.verse: A Prayer in Troubled Times - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A miktam [perhaps “inscription”] of David when he ·escaped [fled] from Saul in the cave [likely a reference to 1 Sam. 22:1–5, but possibly 1 Sam. 24]. Be ·merciful [gracious] to me, God; be ·merciful [gracious] to me because I ·come to you for protection [seek refuge]. Let me ·hide [be protected; seek refuge] under the shadow of your wings [Ruth 2:12; Matt. 23:37] until the ·trouble [destruction] has passed.

2.verse: I cry out to God Most High, to the God who ·does everything for [fulfills his purpose for; or avenges] me.

3.verse: He sends help from heaven and ·saves me [gives me victory]. He ·punishes [reproaches; scorns] those who ·chase [trample on; hound; snap at] me. ·Selah [Interlude] God sends me his ·love [loyalty] and ·truth [faithfulness].

4.verse: I lie down among lions [his enemies]; who are aflame for human prey. Their teeth are like spears and arrows, their tongues as sharp as swords.

5.verse: God is ·supreme [exalted] over the ·skies [heavens]; his ·majesty [glory; his manifest presence] ·covers [is over] the earth.

6.verse: They set a ·trap [net] for ·me [my feet]. I am ·very worried [bowed down]. They dug a pit ·in my path [before me], but they fell into it themselves. ·Selah [Interlude]

7.verse: My heart is ·steady [steadfast; ready], God; my heart is ·steady [steadfast; ready]. I will sing and ·praise [play a psalm for] you.

8.verse: Wake up, my ·soul [or glory]. Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn.

9.verse: Lord, I will ·praise [thank] you among the ·nations [peoples]; I will ·sing songs of praise about [play a psalm for] you to all the nations.

10.verse: Your ·love [loyalty] ·reaches to [is greater than] the ·skies [heavens], your ·truth [faithfulness] to the clouds.

11.verse: God, you are ·supreme [exalted] above the ·skies [heavens]. Let your glory [manifest presence] be over all the earth.

1.verse: Unfair Judges - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A miktam [perhaps “inscription”] of David. Do you ·rulers [or silent ones; or gods; sometimes spiritual beings such as angels are called “gods” in the OT; 82:1] really say what is ·right [righteous]? Do you judge people ·fairly [with integrity]?

2.verse: No, in your heart you plan evil; you ·think up [dispense] ·violent crimes [violence] in the land.

3.verse: From ·birth [the womb], evil people ·turn away [go astray] from God; they wander off and tell lies ·as soon as they are born [from the belly; another word for the womb; 51:5].

4.verse: They ·are [have poison/venom] like ·poisonous [venomous] snakes, like deaf cobras that ·stop [plug] up their ears

5.verse: so they cannot hear the music of the snake charmer no matter how ·well he plays [wisely/skillfully he enchants].

6.verse: God, break the teeth in their mouths! ·Tear out [Uproot] the fangs of those lions, LORD!

7.verse: Let them ·disappear [vanish] like water that flows away. Let them ·be cut short like a broken arrow [draw their arrows like they are cut off].

8.verse: Let them be like ·snails [slugs] that ·melt [dissolve] as they move [snails leave a slime as they move]. Let them be like a ·child born dead [stillborn] who never saw the sun.

9.verse: His anger will blow them away alive faster than burning thorns can heat a pot [likely a reference to quick retribution].

10.verse: ·Good [Righteous] people will be glad when they see ·him get even [vengeance]. They will wash their feet in the blood of the wicked [Is. 63:1–6; Rev. 14:19–20; 19:13–14].

11.verse: Then people will say, “There really are ·rewards [fruits] for ·doing what is right [the righteous]. There really is a God who judges the ·world [earth; land].”

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A miktam [perhaps “inscription”] of David when Saul sent men to ·watch David’s house [the house] to kill him [1 Sam. 19:11–17]. God, ·save [protect] me from my enemies. ·Protect me [Give me refuge] from those who ·come [rise] against me.

2.verse: ·Save [Protect] me from those who do evil and ·save me from [give me victory over] ·murderers [the bloodthirsty].

3.verse: Look, they are waiting to ambush ·me [my life; Prov. 1:11]. ·Cruel [Defiant; Strong] people attack me, but I have not sinned or ·done wrong [transgressed], LORD.

4.verse: I have done nothing wrong, but they ·are ready to attack me [run and get ready]. Wake up to ·help [meet] me, and look.

5.verse: You are the LORD God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], the God of Israel. ·Arise [Awake] and ·punish [visit] ·those people [all the nations]. Do not give those traitors any ·mercy [grace]. ·Selah [Interlude]

6.verse: They come back at ·night [evening]. Like dogs they ·growl [make a commotion] and ·roam around [surround] the city.

7.verse: Notice what ·comes [bubbles up] from their mouths. ·Insults [Swords] come from their lips, because they say, “Who’s listening?”

8.verse: But, LORD, you laugh at them [2:4]; you ·make fun of [ridicule] all ·of them [the nations].

9.verse: God, my strength, I ·am looking to [keep watch for] you, because God is my ·defender [refuge].

10.verse: My God ·loves [is loyal to] me, and he goes in front of me. He will help me ·defeat [look on] my enemies.

11.verse: Lord, our ·protector [shield], do not kill them, or my people will forget. With your power ·scatter them [make them wander] and ·defeat them [bring them down].

12.verse: They sin by what they say; they sin with their ·words [lips]. They curse and tell lies, so let their pride ·trap [capture] them.

13.verse: ·Destroy [Annihilate] them in your anger; ·destroy [annihilate] them ·completely [so they will be no more]! Then they will know that God rules over ·Israel [Jacob] and to the ends of the earth. ·Selah [Interlude]

14.verse: They come back at ·night [evening]. Like dogs they ·growl [make a commotion] and ·roam around [surround] the city.

15.verse: They wander about looking for food, and they ·howl [grumble] if they ·do not find enough [are not satisfied].

16.verse: But I will sing about your strength. In the morning I will sing about your ·love [loyalty]. You are my ·defender [refuge], my place of safety in ·times of trouble [the day of distress].

17.verse: God, my strength, I will sing ·praises [a psalm] to you. God, my ·defender [refuge], you are the God who ·loves [is loyal to] me.

1.verse: A Prayer After a Defeat - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lily of the ·Agreement [Testimony].” A miktam [perhaps “inscription”] of David. For teaching. When David fought the Arameans of ·northwest Mesopotamia [Naharaim; the Two Rivers] and Zobah, and when Joab returned and ·defeated [struck] twelve thousand ·Edomites at the Valley of Salt [2 Sam. 8; 1 Chr. 18]. God, you have rejected us and ·scattered us [broken us down; burst forth on us]. You have been angry, but please ·come back to [restore] us.

2.verse: You made the earth shake and ·crack [split open]. Heal its ·breaks [cracks; fractures] because it ·is shaking [totters].

3.verse: You have ·given your people [made your people see] ·trouble [hardship]. You made us ·unable to walk straight, like people drunk with wine [drink wine that makes us reel; the cup of God’s wrath; Jer. 25:15–29; Nah. 3:11; Matt. 26:39].

4.verse: You have raised a banner to gather those who fear you. Now they can ·stand up against the enemy [escape/flee from the bow]. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: Answer us and ·save us [give us victory] by your ·power [hand] so ·the people you love [your beloved] will be rescued.

6.verse: God has said ·from his Temple [from his Holy Place; or in his holiness], “·When I win [or With joy], I will ·divide [parcel up] Shechem and measure off the Valley of Succoth [Gen. 33:17–20].

7.verse: Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is like my helmet. Judah holds my royal scepter [Gen. 49:10; they are agents of God’s power].

8.verse: Moab is like my washbowl. I throw my sandals at Edom [showing contempt]. I shout [in triumph] at Philistia [enemies of Israel].”

10.verse: God, ·surely you have rejected [have you not rejected…?] us; you do not go out with our armies.

11.verse: ·Help us fight the enemy [Give us help against the foe]. Human ·help [deliverance] is useless,

12.verse: but we can ·win [fight bravely] with God’s help. He will ·defeat [tread on] our ·enemies [foes].

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. Of David. God, hear my cry; ·listen [pay attention] to my prayer.

2.verse: I call to you from the ends of the earth [far from the Temple] when ·I am afraid [my heart grows faint]. ·Carry [Lead] me away to ·a high mountain [the rock that is higher than I am; a place of refuge, perhaps referring to God as the rock; 18:2, 46; 19:14; 62:2].

3.verse: You have been my ·protection [refuge], like a strong tower against my enemies.

4.verse: Let me ·live [sojourn] in your ·Holy Tent [tent; the sanctuary] forever. Let me find ·safety [refuge] in the shelter of your wings [an image of compassion, or perhaps referring to the cherubim whose wings cover the Ark of the Covenant; Ex. 25:20]. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: God, you have heard my ·promises [vows]. You have given me what belongs to those who fear ·you [your name].

6.verse: ·Give the king a long life [Add days to the days of the king]; let ·him live many years [his years be forever and ever].

7.verse: Let him ·rule [reign] in the presence of God forever. Protect him with your ·love [loyalty] and ·truth [faithfulness].

8.verse: Then I will ·praise [sing a psalm to] your name forever, and every day I will ·keep my promises [fulfill my vows].

1.verse: Trust Only in God - For the director of music. For Jeduthun [a Levitical musician; 1 Chr. 16:41–42; 25:1, 6; 2 Chr. 5:12]. A psalm of David. I ·find rest [wait quietly] in God; only he can ·save me [give me victory].

2.verse: He is my rock [61:2] and my ·salvation [victory]. He is my ·defender [fortress]; I will not be ·defeated [shaken].

3.verse: How long will you ·attack [assault] someone? Will all of you ·kill [murder] that person? Who is like a leaning wall, like a fence ·ready to fall [that totters; the wicked take advantage of the weak]?

4.verse: They are planning to make that person ·fall [totter]. They enjoy telling lies. With their mouths they bless, but in their ·hearts [innards] they curse. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: I ·find rest [wait quietly] in God; ·only he gives me hope [for my hope is in him].

6.verse: He is my rock [61:2] and my ·salvation [victory]. He is my ·defender [fortress]; I will not be ·defeated [shaken].

7.verse: My ·honor [glory] and ·salvation [victory] come from God. He is my ·mighty [strong] rock and my ·protection [refuge].

8.verse: People, ·trust [have confidence in] God all the time. ·Tell him all your problems [Pour out your heart before him], because God is our ·protection [refuge]. ·Selah [Interlude]

9.verse: The least of people are only a ·breath [vapor; bubble; vanity], and even the greatest are just a ·lie [delusion]. On the scales, they ·weigh nothing [go up]; together they are only a ·breath [vapor; bubble; vanity].

10.verse: Do not ·trust [have confidence] in ·force [oppression; extortion]. Stealing is ·of no use [meaningless]. Even if you gain more riches, don’t ·put your trust in [set your heart on] them.

11.verse: God has said this once, and I have heard it ·over and over [twice]: God is strong.

12.verse: The Lord is ·loving [loyal]. You ·reward [repay] people for what they have done [1 Pet. 1:17; Rev. 20:12–13; 22:12].

1.verse: Wishing to Be Near God - A psalm of David when he was in the ·desert [wilderness] of Judah [fleeing from a jealous Saul; 1 Sam. 21–31]. God, you are my God. I ·search for [am intent on] you. I thirst for you [42:1–2] ·like someone [or my flesh yearns for you] in a dry, ·empty [exhausted; weary] land where there is no water.

2.verse: I have seen you in ·the Temple [the Holy Place; or holiness] and have seen your strength and glory.

3.verse: Because your ·love [loyalty] is better than life, ·I [My lips] will praise you.

4.verse: I will ·praise [bless] you ·as long as I live [with my life]. I will lift up my hands in your name [in prayer].

5.verse: I will be ·content as if I had eaten the best foods [satisfied as with fat and fatness]. My lips will sing, and my mouth will praise you.

6.verse: I remember you while I’m lying in bed; I ·think about [meditate on] you through the watches of the night [the night was divided into four watches of three hours each].

7.verse: You are my help. ·Because of your protection [In the shadow of your wings; an image of compassion or perhaps a reference to the cherubim whose wings covered the Ark of the Covenant; Ex. 25:20], I sing.

8.verse: I ·stay close [cling] to you; ·you support me with your right hand [your right hand sustains me].

9.verse: ·Some people are trying to kill me [They seek my life for ruin], but they will go down to the ·grave [underbelly of the earth].

10.verse: They will be ·killed with swords [handed over to the sword] and ·eaten by wild dogs [be the prey of jackals].

11.verse: But the king will rejoice in his God. All who ·make promises in his name [swear by him] will praise him, but the mouths of liars will be shut.

1.verse: A Prayer Against Enemies - For the director of music. A psalm of David. God, listen to my complaint. ·I am afraid of my enemies; protect my life from them [Protect my life from the dread of my enemies].

2.verse: Hide me from ·those who plan wicked things [the secret plans/conspiracy of the wicked], from that ·gang [mob; restless group] who does evil [Prov. 1:8–19].

3.verse: They sharpen their tongues like swords and ·shoot [aim] bitter words like arrows.

4.verse: From their hiding places they shoot at ·innocent [blameless] people; they shoot suddenly and are not afraid.

5.verse: They encourage each other to do wrong. They talk about setting traps, ·thinking [or saying] ·no one will [who can…?] see them.

6.verse: They plan wicked things and say, “We have a perfect plan.” The ·mind [insides and the heart/mind] of human beings is ·hard to understand [deep].

7.verse: But God will shoot them with arrows; they will suddenly be struck down.

8.verse: Their own ·words [tongues] will ·be used against them [make them stumble]. All who see them will shake their heads [in amazement at their downfall].

9.verse: Then everyone will fear God [Prov. 1:7]. They will tell what God has done, and they will ·learn from [reflect on] what he has done.

10.verse: ·Good [Righteous] people will be happy in the LORD and will find ·protection [refuge] in him. Let everyone who is ·honest [virtuous in heart] praise the LORD.

1.verse: A Hymn of Thanksgiving - For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song. God, ·you will be praised in Jerusalem [praise is due/proper/ fitting to you in Zion; the location of the Temple]. We will ·keep our promises [fulfill our vows] to you.

2.verse: You ·hear [or answer] our prayers. All ·people [flesh] will come to you.

3.verse: Our guilt ·overwhelms [overpowers] us, but you ·forgive [wipe/blot out; make atonement for] our ·sins [transgressions].

4.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are the people you choose and ·invite [bring near] to stay in your court. We are ·filled [satisfied] with good things in your house, your holy Temple.

5.verse: You answer us in amazing ways with ·vindication [victory; righteousness], God our ·Savior [Victor]. People ·everywhere on [of all the ends of] the earth and ·beyond the sea [the farthest seas] ·trust [have confidence in] you.

6.verse: You ·made [established] the mountains by your strength; you are ·dressed [girded; armed] in power.

7.verse: You ·stopped [silence; calm] the roaring seas, the roaring waves [representing chaos], and the ·uproar [tumult] of the ·nations [peoples].

8.verse: Even those people at the ends of the earth fear your ·miracles [signs]. You are praised from ·where the sun rises [the east; the gateways of the morning] to ·where it sets [the west; evening].

9.verse: You ·take care of [visit] the land and water it; you make it very ·fertile [rich]. The ·rivers [channels] of God are full of water. Grain grows because you make it grow.

10.verse: You send rain to the plowed fields; you ·fill the rows with water [level its ridges]. You soften the ground with rain, and then you bless ·it with crops [its growth].

11.verse: You ·give [crown] the year ·a good harvest [with your goodness/bounty], and ·you load the wagons with many crops [your wagon tracks/ruts drip with plenty].

12.verse: The ·desert [wilderness] ·is covered [drips] with ·grass [pasturage] and the hills with happiness.

13.verse: The ·pastures [meadows] are ·full of [clothed with] flocks, and the valleys are ·covered [wrapped] with grain. Everything shouts and sings for joy.

1.verse: Praise God for What He Has Done - For the director of music. A song. A psalm. Everything on earth, shout with joy to God!

2.verse: ·Sing [Make a psalm] about ·his glory [the glory of his name]! Make his praise glorious!

3.verse: Say to God, “Your works are ·amazing [majestic]! Because your power is great, your enemies ·fall [cringe; cower] before you.

4.verse: All the earth ·worships [bows down to] you and ·sings praises to [makes a psalm for] you. They ·sing praises to [make a psalm for] your name [Phil. 2:10–12].” ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: Come and see what God has done, the ·amazing [majestic] things he has done for people.

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land [Ex. 14–15]. The people crossed the river on foot [Josh. 3]. So let us rejoice because of what he did.

7.verse: He rules forever with his power. ·He keeps his eye [His eyes keep watch] on the nations, so ·people should not turn [the rebellious might not rise] against him. ·Selah [Interlude]

8.verse: You people, ·praise [bless] our God; ·loudly sing his praise [let the sound of his praise be heard].

9.verse: He ·protects our lives [sets our lives among the living] and does not let ·us be defeated [our feet be moved].

10.verse: God, you have ·tested [examined] us; you have ·purified [refined] us like silver [removing the dross].

11.verse: You ·let us be trapped [brought us into the net] and put ·a heavy load on us [misery on our backs].

12.verse: You let our enemies ·walk on [ride over] our heads. We went through fire and ·flood [water], but you brought us to a place with ·good things [abundance].

13.verse: I will come to your ·Temple [house] with burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17]. I will ·give you what I promised [repay my vows],

14.verse: ·things I promised when I was in trouble [which my lips poured out and my mouth said when I was in distress].

15.verse: I will bring you burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17] of fat animals, and ·I will offer sheep, bulls, and goats [with the smoke of rams, I will offer bulls and goats]. ·Selah [Interlude]

16.verse: All of you who fear God [Prov. 1:7], come and listen, and I will tell you what he has done for me.

17.verse: I ·cried out [called] to him with my mouth and ·praised [exalted] him with my tongue.

18.verse: If I had ·known of [seen] any sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened to me.

19.verse: But God has listened; he has ·heard [paid attention to the sound of] my prayer.

20.verse: ·Praise [Blessed be] God, who did not ·ignore [turn aside from] my prayer or hold back his ·love [loyalty] from me.

1.verse: Everyone Should Praise God - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm. A song. God, ·have mercy on [be gracious to] us and bless us and ·show us your kindness [make your face shine on us; Num. 6:24–26] ·Selah [Interlude]

2.verse: so the world will ·learn [know] your ways, and all nations ·will learn that you can save [your salvation/victory].

3.verse: God, the people should ·praise [thank] you; all people should ·praise [thank] you.

4.verse: The ·nations [peoples] should be glad and sing because you judge people fairly. You ·guide [lead] all the ·nations [peoples] on earth. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: God, the people should ·praise [thank] you; all people should ·praise [thank] you.

6.verse: The land has given its ·crops [bounty]. God, our God, blesses us.

7.verse: God blesses us so people all over the earth will fear him [Prov. 1:7].

1.verse: Praise God Who Saved the Nation - For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song. Let God rise up and scatter his enemies; let those who hate him ·run away [flee] from him.

2.verse: Blow them away as smoke is ·driven [blown] away by the wind [Hos. 13:3]. As wax melts before a fire, let the wicked ·be destroyed [perish] before God [Mic. 1:4].

3.verse: But ·those who do right [the righteous] should be glad and should rejoice before God; they should be happy and glad.

4.verse: Sing to God; ·sing praises [make a psalm] to his name. Prepare the way for him who rides ·through the desert [on the clouds; as on a chariot; 18:10–19; 104:3; Is. 19:1; Dan. 7:13–14; Luke 21:27; Rev. 1:7], whose name is the LORD. Rejoice before him.

5.verse: God is in his holy ·Temple [abode]. He is a father to orphans [10:14; 146:9], and he defends the widows [146:9].

6.verse: God gives the lonely a home. He leads prisoners out ·with joy [with singing; or to prosperity], but ·those who turn against God [the rebellious] will live in a dry land.

7.verse: God, you led your people out when you marched through the ·desert [wasteland; wilderness]. ·Selah [Interlude]

8.verse: The ·ground [earth; land] shook and the ·sky [heavens] poured down rain before God, the God of Mount Sinai [Ex. 19], before God, the God of Israel.

9.verse: God, you sent much rain; you ·refreshed [restored] your ·tired [withering] ·land [inheritance].

10.verse: Your people settled there. God, in your goodness you took care of the poor.

11.verse: The Lord gave the command, and a great ·army [or company of women] told the news:

12.verse: “Kings and their ·armies [hosts] ·run away [flee]. ·In camp they [The abode of the house; may indicate the women] divide the ·wealth taken in war [plunder].

13.verse: Those who stayed ·by the campfires [between the saddlebags/or sheepfolds] will share the ·riches taken in battle [wings of a dove covered with silver and its feathers with green gold; specific precious items among the plunder].”

14.verse: The Almighty scattered kings like snow on Mount Zalmon [perhaps near Shechem; Judg. 9:48].

15.verse: The mountains of Bashan [in the Golan heights, east of the Sea of Galilee] are ·high [mighty]; the mountains of Bashan have many peaks.

16.verse: Why do you mountains with many peaks look with ·envy [or hostility] on the mountain that God ·chose [desired] for his home [Zion, the location of the Temple]? The LORD will live there forever.

17.verse: God comes with ·millions [twice ten thousand, thousands of thousands] of chariots; the Lord ·comes from Mount Sinai to his holy place [is among them Sinai in holiness].

18.verse: When you went up to the heights, you led a parade of captives. You received gifts from the people, even from those who ·turned [rebelled] against you [2 Cor. 2:14; Eph. 4:8]. And the LORD God will live there.

19.verse: ·Praise [Blessed be] the Lord, God our ·Savior [Victor], who ·helps us [bears our burdens] every day. ·Selah [Interlude]

20.verse: Our God is a God who ·saves us [gives us victory]; the LORD God ·saves us [brings us out] from death.

21.verse: God will ·crush [shatter] his enemies’ heads, the hairy ·skulls [pates; tops of their heads] of those who continue to ·sin [walk in their guilt].

22.verse: The Lord said, “I will bring ·the enemy [them] back from Bashan [v. 15]; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea [representing chaos].

23.verse: Then you can ·stick [bathe; or shatter] your feet in their blood, and ·your dogs can lick [the tongues of your dogs can have] their share.”

24.verse: God, people have seen your victory ·march [procession]; God my King marched into the holy place [the Tabernacle].

25.verse: The singers are in front and the ·instruments [musicians] are behind. In the middle are the girls with the tambourines.

26.verse: ·Praise [Bless] God in the ·meeting place [assembly]; ·praise [bless] the LORD ·in the gathering [or the fountain] of Israel.

27.verse: There is the smallest tribe, Benjamin, ·leading them [bringing them down]. And there are the ·leaders [princes] of Judah with their group. There also are the ·leaders [princes] of Zebulun and of Naphtali.

28.verse: God, ·order up [command] your power; show the mighty power you have used for us before.

29.verse: Kings will bring their ·wealth [presents; gifts] to you, ·to [or because of] your Temple in Jerusalem.

30.verse: ·Punish [Reprimand; Rebuke] the beast in the ·tall grass along the river [reed; crocodile or hippopotamus representing Egypt]. ·Punish [Reprimand; Rebuke] ·those bulls among the cows [the herd of bulls among the calves of the peoples; leaders of other nations]. ·Defeated [Trampled], they will bring you their silver. Scatter those ·nations [peoples] that ·love [delight in] war.

31.verse: Messengers will come from Egypt; the people of ·Cush [Ethiopia] will ·pray [stretch their hands] to God.

32.verse: Kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; ·sing praises [make a psalm] to the Lord. ·Selah [Interlude]

33.verse: Sing to the one who rides through the ·skies [heavens], ·which are from long ago [the ancient heavens; v. 4]. He ·speaks with a thundering voice [puts forth his voice, his strong voice].

34.verse: ·Announce [Ascribe] that God is ·powerful [strong]. ·He rules [His majesty is] over Israel, and his power is in the ·skies [clouds].

35.verse: God, you are ·wonderful [awesome] in your ·Temple [sanctuary; Holy Place]. The God of Israel gives his people strength and power. ·Praise [Bless] God!

1.verse: A Cry for Help - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” A psalm of David. God, ·save me [give me victory], because the water has risen to my neck [the waters of chaos].

2.verse: I’m sinking down into the ·mud [mire], and there is nothing to stand on. I ·am in deep water [have come into the depths of the waters], and the flood ·covers [overwhelms] me.

3.verse: I am ·tired [exhausted] from calling for help; my throat is ·sore [dry]. My eyes are ·tired [worn out] from ·waiting [hoping] for God to help me.

4.verse: There are more people who hate me for no reason than hairs on my head; ·powerful [or many] enemies want to destroy me for no reason. They make me ·pay back [return] what I did not steal.

5.verse: God, you know ·what I have done wrong [my foolishness]; I cannot hide my guilt from you.

6.verse: Lord GOD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], do not let those who ·hope in [wait for] you be ashamed because of me. God of Israel, do not let ·your worshipers [those who seek you] be disgraced because of me.

7.verse: For you, I carry this ·shame [reproach; scorn], and my face is covered with disgrace.

8.verse: I am like a stranger to my closest relatives and a foreigner to my mother’s children.

9.verse: My ·strong love [jealousy; passion; zeal] for your ·Temple [house] ·completely controls [consumes] me [John 2:17]. ·When people insult you, it hurts me [The reproaches/scorn of those who reproach/scorn you fall on me; Rom. 15:3].

10.verse: When I ·cry [weep] and fast, they ·make fun of [reproach; scorn] me.

11.verse: When I wear ·rough cloth [sackcloth; burlap; a sign of grief], ·they joke about me [I am a byword/proverb/joke to them].

12.verse: ·They make fun of me in public places [Those who sit in the gate complain about me], and the drunkards make up songs about me.

13.verse: But I pray to you, LORD, ·for favor [or at an appropriate time]. God, because of your great ·love [loyalty], answer me. You are ·truly able [faithful] to ·save [give victory].

14.verse: ·Pull [Protect] me from the ·mud [mire], and do not let me sink. ·Save [Protect] me from those who hate me and from the deep water.

15.verse: Do not let the flood ·drown [overwhelm] me or the deep water swallow me or the ·grave [pit] close its mouth over me.

16.verse: LORD, answer me because your ·love [loyalty] is so good. Because of your ·great kindness [abundant compassion], turn to me.

17.verse: Do not hide your face from me, your servant. I am in ·trouble [distress]. Hurry to ·help [answer] me!

18.verse: Come near and ·save [ransom] me; ·rescue [redeem] me from my enemies.

19.verse: You ·see [know] my ·shame [reproach; scorn] and disgrace. ·You know all my enemies and what they have said [The humiliation of all my foes is before you].

20.verse: ·Insults [Reproach; Scorn] have broken my heart and ·left me weak [I am depressed]. I ·looked [hoped; waited] for ·sympathy [pity; consolation], but there was none; I found no one to comfort me.

21.verse: They ·put [gave me] poison in my food and gave me vinegar to drink for my thirst [Matt. 27:48; Mark 15:23, 36; Luke 23:36; John 19:29].

22.verse: Let their ·own feasts cause their ruin [table be a snare before them]; ·let their feasts trap them and pay them back [or a trap for their friends].

23.verse: Let their eyes be ·closed [darkened] so they cannot see and their ·backs [loins] ·be forever weak from troubles [tremble all the time].

24.verse: Pour your ·anger [wrath] out on them; let your anger ·catch up with [overtake] them.

25.verse: May their ·place [camp] be ·empty [desolate]; leave no one to live in their tents.

26.verse: They ·chase after [persecute; pursue] those you have ·hurt [struck], and they talk about the pain of those you have wounded.

27.verse: Charge them with ·crime after crime [guilt on guilt], and do not ·let them have anything good [vindicate them].

28.verse: ·Wipe [Blot] their names from the book of life [kill them], and do not ·list them [write them down] with those who ·do what is right [are righteous].

29.verse: I am ·sad [afflicted] and ·hurting [in pain]. God, ·save me [give me victory] and ·protect me [give me refuge].

30.verse: I will praise ·God [the name of God] in a song and will ·honor [magnify] him by giving thanks.

31.verse: That will please the LORD more than ·offering him cattle [an ox], more than sacrificing a bull with horns and hoofs.

32.verse: Poor people will see this and be glad [offering an ox or bull is expensive]. ·Be encouraged, you who worship God [The hearts of those who seek God will be enlivened].

33.verse: The LORD listens to those in need and does not ·look down on [despise] ·captives [prisoners].

34.verse: Heaven and earth should praise him, the seas and ·everything in them [all that swarms in them].

35.verse: God will ·save Jerusalem [give Zion victory; the location of the Temple] and rebuild the cities of Judah. Then people will live there and own the land.

36.verse: The ·descendants [seed] of his servants will inherit that land, and those who love ·him [his name] will live there.

1.verse: A Cry for God to Help Quickly - For the director of music. A psalm of David. ·To help people remember [For remembrance; or For a memorial offering]. God, ·come quickly and save [protect] me. LORD, hurry to help me.

2.verse: Let those who are ·trying to kill me [seeking my life] be ashamed and ·disgraced [scorned; reproached]. Let those who want to hurt me ·run away [turn back] in disgrace.

3.verse: Let those who ·make fun of me [say, “Aha, Aha!”] ·stop [withdraw] because of their shame.

4.verse: But let all those who ·worship [seek] you rejoice and be glad. Let those who love your ·salvation [victory] always say, “·Praise the greatness of [Magnify] God.”

5.verse: I am poor and ·helpless [needy]; God, hurry to me. You ·help me and save me [are my helper and my rescuer]. LORD, do not ·wait [delay].

1.verse: An Old Person’s Prayer - In you, LORD, ·is my protection [I find refuge]. Never let me be ashamed.

2.verse: Because you ·do what is right [are righteous], ·save [protect] and rescue me; ·listen [extend your ear] to me and ·save me [give me victory].

3.verse: Be my ·place of safety [rock of refuge] where I can always come. Give the command to ·save me [give me victory], because you are my rock and my ·strong, walled city [fortress].
