4.verse: My God, ·save [rescue] me from the ·power [hand] of the wicked and from the ·hold [grasp; palm] of evil and cruel people.

5.verse: LORD, you are my hope. LORD, I have ·trusted [had confidence in] you since I was young.

6.verse: I have ·depended [leaned] on you ·since I was born [from the belly; the womb]; you ·helped me even on the day of my birth [brought me forth/cut off my umbilical cord from my mother’s innards]. I will always praise you.

7.verse: I am an ·example [portent] to many people, because you are my strong ·protection [refuge].

8.verse: ·I am always praising you [My mouth is filled with your praise]; all day long I ·honor [glorify] you.

9.verse: Do not ·reject me [cast me off] when I am old; do not ·leave [abandon; forsake] me when my strength is ·gone [exhausted].

10.verse: My enemies ·make plans [speak] against me, and they ·meet [take counsel] together to kill me.

11.verse: They say, “God has ·left [abandoned; forsaken] him. ·Go after [Pursue; Persecute] him and ·take [capture] him, because no one will ·save [protect] him.”

12.verse: God, don’t be far off. My God, hurry to help me.

13.verse: Let those who accuse me be ashamed and ·destroyed [annihilated]. Let those who are ·trying [seeking] to hurt me be covered with shame and disgrace.

14.verse: But I will always have hope and will praise you more and more.

15.verse: ·I will tell how you do what is right [My mouth will recount your righteousness]. I will tell about your ·salvation [victory] all day long, even though ·it is more than I can tell [I do not know the number].

16.verse: I will come and tell about your powerful works, Lord GOD. I will remind people ·that only you do what is right [that you alone are righteous].

17.verse: God, you have taught me since I was young. To this day I tell ·about the miracles you do [of your wonderful works].

18.verse: Even though I am old and gray, do not ·leave [abandon; forsake] me, God. I will tell ·the children [a generation, to all that come] about your ·power [arm]; I will tell of your might.

19.verse: God, your ·justice [righteousness] reaches to the ·skies [high heavens]. You have done great things; God, there is no one like you.

20.verse: You have ·given [shown] me ·many troubles [much distress] and bad times, but you will give me life again. ·When I am almost dead [From the depths of the earth], you ·will keep me alive [again bring me up].

21.verse: You will make me greater than ever, and you will comfort me again.

22.verse: I will ·praise [thank] you with the harp. ·I trust you […for your faithfulness], my God. I will ·sing to [make a psalm for] you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.

23.verse: ·I will [My lips] shout for joy when I ·sing praises to [make a psalm for] you. You have ·saved [redeemed] me.

24.verse: ·I [My tongue] will tell about your ·justice [righteousness] all day long. And those who ·want [seek] to hurt me will be ·ashamed [scorned and reproached] and disgraced.

1.verse: A Prayer for the King - Of Solomon. God, give the king your good judgment and the king’s son your ·goodness [righteousness].

2.verse: Help him judge your people ·fairly [rightly] and decide what is ·right [just] for the poor.

3.verse: Let there be ·peace [or prosperity] on the mountains and ·goodness [righteousness] on the hills for the people.

4.verse: Help him be ·fair [just] to the poor and ·save [give victory to] the ·needy [or children of the needy] and ·punish [crush] those who ·hurt [oppress; exploit] them.

5.verse: May they ·respect [fear] you as long as the sun and as long as the moon, throughout the generations.

6.verse: Let him ·be [come down] like rain on the mown grass, like showers that water the earth.

7.verse: Let ·goodness [righteousness] ·be plentiful [bloom forth] while he lives. Let ·peace [or prosperity] continue ·as long as there is a [until there is no] moon.

8.verse: ·Let his kingdom go [May he have dominion/rule] from sea to sea, and from the ·Euphrates River [river] to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: Let the people of the ·desert [wilderness] ·bow down to [cringe/cower before] him, and make his enemies lick the dust.

10.verse: Let the kings of Tarshish [48:7] and the ·faraway lands [islands] bring him ·gifts [tribute]. Let the kings of Sheba [an unknown location, perhaps present-day Yemen, Eritrea, or Ethiopia; see 1 Kin. 10:1–13] and Seba [either in southern Egypt or further south; Gen. 10:7; Is. 43:3; 45:14] bring their ·presents [tribute] to him.

11.verse: Let all kings ·bow down [bend the knee] to him and all nations serve him [Ps. 2].

12.verse: He will ·help [protect] the poor when they cry out and the needy when no one else will help.

13.verse: He will ·be kind to [take pity on] the poor and the needy, and he will ·save their lives [give victory to the needy].

14.verse: He will ·save [redeem] them from ·cruel people who try to hurt them [violence and oppression], because their ·lives [blood] are precious to ·him [his eyes].

15.verse: Long live the king! Let him receive gold from Sheba [v. 10]. Let people always pray for him and ·bless [praise] him all day long.

16.verse: Let ·the fields grow plenty of grain [there be much grain in the land/earth] and ·the hills be covered with crops [let there be abundance on the top of the mountains; or let it wave on the top of the mountains]. ·Let the land be as fertile as Lebanon [May its fruit be like that of Lebanon], and let the cities grow like the grass in a field.

17.verse: Let ·the king be famous [his name/fame be] forever; let ·him be remembered as long as the sun shines [his name/fame continue as long as the sun]. Let the nations be ·blessed [praised] because of him, and may they all ·bless [praise] him [Gen. 12:3].

18.verse: ·Praise [Blessed be] the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does such ·miracles [wonderful things].

19.verse: Praise his glorious name forever. Let his glory [manifest presence] fill the whole world. Amen and amen.

20.verse: This ends the prayers of David son of Jesse [at one time it did, but see other Davidic psalms at Ps. 101, 103, 108–110, and others].

1.verse: Book 3: Psalms 73–89 Should the Wicked Be Rich? - A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. ·God is truly [Surely God is] good to ·Israel [or those with integrity/virtue], to those who have pure hearts.

2.verse: But ·I had almost stopped believing [as for me, my feet almost stumbled]; ·I had almost lost my faith [my steps almost slipped]

3.verse: because I was ·jealous [envious] of ·proud people [braggers; boasters]. I saw wicked people ·doing well [prospering].

4.verse: They are not ·suffering [struggling; in pain]; ·they [their bodies] are ·healthy [perfect] and strong.

5.verse: They don’t have ·troubles [toils] like the rest of us; they ·don’t have problems [are not plagued] like other people [Gen. 3:17–19].

6.verse: They wear pride like a necklace and ·put on violence as their clothing [adorn themselves with garments of violence].

7.verse: ·They are looking for profits [Their eyes bulge with fat] and ·do not control their selfish desires [cunning overflows from their hearts/minds].

8.verse: They ·make fun of others [scoff] and speak ·evil [harm]; ·proudly [from high] they speak of ·hurting [oppressing; exploiting] others.

9.verse: They ·brag to the sky [set their mouth against heaven]. ·They say that they own [Their tongue wanders] the earth.

10.verse: So their people turn to them and ·give them whatever they want [they drink up water in abundance].

11.verse: They say, “How can God know? What does God Most High know?”

12.verse: These people are wicked, always ·at ease [carefree], and getting richer.

13.verse: ·So why have I kept my heart pure [In vain, I kept my heart pure…]? ·Why have I kept my hands from doing wrong […and washed my hands in innocence; Matt. 27:24]?

14.verse: I ·have suffered [am plagued] all day long; I have been ·punished [corrected] every morning.

15.verse: God, if I had ·decided to talk like this [said, “I will recount this,”], I would have ·let your people down [betrayed the generation/race of your children].

16.verse: I ·tried [thought how] to understand all this, but it was too ·hard [wearisome] ·for me to see [in my eyes]

17.verse: until I went to the ·Temple [sanctuary; Holy Place] of God. Then I understood ·what will happen to them [their fate/end].

18.verse: You have put them in ·danger [slippery places]; you cause them to ·be destroyed [fall into disaster].

19.verse: They are destroyed in a moment; they are swept away by terrors.

20.verse: It will be like waking from a dream. Lord, when you ·rise up [awake; arouse yourself], ·they will disappear [you despise their shadows].

21.verse: When my heart was ·sad [bitter] and ·I was angry [my innards felt stabbed],

22.verse: I was senseless and stupid. I acted like an ·animal [brute beast] toward you.

23.verse: But I am always with you [in covenant relationship]; you have held my ·hand [right hand; guiding him].

24.verse: You guide me with your advice, and later you will receive me in ·honor [glory; perhaps in the afterlife].

25.verse: ·I have no one [Whom do I have…?] in heaven but you; I ·want [desire] nothing on earth besides you.

26.verse: My body and my ·mind [heart] may become weak, but God is ·my strength [the rock of my heart]. He is ·mine [my portion] forever.

27.verse: Those who are far from ·God [you] will ·die [perish]; you ·destroy [bring to an end] those who ·are unfaithful [prostitute themselves spiritually].

28.verse: But I am close to God, and that is good. The Lord GOD ·is [I have made] my ·protection [refuge]. I will ·tell [recount] all that you have done.

1.verse: A Nation in Trouble Prays - A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. God, why have you rejected us ·for so long [forever]? Why ·are you angry with us, [does your anger smoke against] the sheep of your pasture [100:3]?

2.verse: Remember the ·people [assembly; congregation] you ·bought [acquired] long ago. You ·saved [redeemed] us, and we are ·your very own [the tribe of your inheritance]. After all, you live on Mount Zion.

3.verse: ·Make your way [Direct your steps] through ·these old [or the utter] ruins; the enemy ·wrecked [destroyed] everything in the ·Temple [sanctuary; Holy Place; perhaps a reference to the Babylonian destruction of the Temple; 2 Kin. 25:8–21; 2 Chr. 36:17–21; Lam. 2:6].

4.verse: Those who were against you ·shouted [roared] in your meeting place and ·raised their flags [set their signs as signs] there.

5.verse: ·They came with axes raised [or They hacked at the upper entrances] as if to cut down a forest of trees.

6.verse: They ·smashed [beat to pieces] the ·carved [engraved] panels with their axes and ·hatchets [crowbars].

7.verse: They ·burned your Temple to the ground [set your sanctuary/Holy Place on fire]; they have made the ·place where you live [residence of your name] ·unclean [profane].

8.verse: They ·thought [said in their hearts], “We will completely crush them!” They burned ·every place where God was worshiped [all the meeting places of God] in the land.

9.verse: We do not see any signs. There are no more prophets [who can tell them what will happen], and no one knows how long this will last.

10.verse: God, how much longer will the enemy ·make fun of [scorn] you? Will they ·insult [revile] ·you [your name] forever?

11.verse: Why do you ·hold back your power [return your hand]? ·Bring your power out in the open [Take your right hand out of your bosom] and ·destroy [annihilate] them!

12.verse: God, you have been our king ·for a long time [of old; Ex. 15:18]. You bring ·salvation [victory] to the earth.

13.verse: You split open the sea by your power and broke the heads of the sea monster [an ancient Near Eastern symbol of chaos].

14.verse: You ·smashed [crushed in pieces] the heads of the monster Leviathan [a sea monster and symbol of chaos; 104:26; Job 3:8; 41:1; Is. 27:1] and gave it to the ·desert [wilderness] creatures as food.

15.verse: You ·opened up [split] the springs and ·streams [wadis] and made the flowing rivers run dry.

16.verse: Both the day and the night are yours; you made the sun and the moon [Gen. 1:14–18].

17.verse: You set all the ·limits [borders] on the earth; you ·created [formed] summer and winter [104:19–23; Gen. 8:22].

18.verse: LORD, remember how the enemy ·insulted [scorned] you. Remember how those foolish people ·made fun of you [reviled your name].

19.verse: Do not give us, your doves, to those wild animals. Never forget your poor people.

20.verse: ·Remember [Regard] the ·agreement [covenant] you made with us, because violence fills every dark corner of this land.

21.verse: Do not let your ·suffering [crushed] people be ·disgraced [humiliated]. Let the poor and ·helpless [needy] praise ·you [your name].

22.verse: God, arise and ·defend [contend for] yourself. Remember the ·insults [scorn] that come from those foolish people all day long.

23.verse: Don’t forget what your enemies said; don’t forget their roar as they rise against you always.

1.verse: God the Judge - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. A song. God, we ·thank [praise] you; we ·thank [praise] you because ·you [your name] are near. We tell about the ·miracles [wonders] you do.

2.verse: You say, “I set ·the time for trial [an appointed time], and I will judge ·fairly [with integrity].

3.verse: The earth with all its people may ·shake [totter], but I ·am the one who holds it steady [set/establish its pillars; the idea was that the earth was supported by pillars]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: I say to those who ·are proud [brag; boast], ‘Don’t ·be proud [brag; boast],’ and to the wicked, ‘Don’t ·show your power [exalt your horn; a horn is a symbol of strength].

5.verse: Don’t ·try to use your power [exalt your horn] against ·heaven [the heights; or on high]. Don’t ·be stubborn [speak with an insolent neck].’”

6.verse: No one from the east or the west or the ·desert [wilderness] ·can judge you [comes exalting].

7.verse: God is the judge; he ·judges one person as guilty [puts one down] and ·another as innocent [raises another up].

8.verse: The LORD holds a cup in his hand; it is ·full of wine mixed with [foaming wine full of] spices [the cup of God’s wrath; 60:3; Jer. 25:15–29; Nah. 3:11; Matt. 26:39]. He pours it out ·even to the last drop [until its dregs drain out], and the wicked drink it all.

9.verse: I will tell about this forever; I will ·sing praise [make a psalm] to the God of Jacob.

10.verse: ·He will take all power away from [I will cut off all the horns of] the wicked [v. 4], but the ·power [horn] of ·good [righteous] people will ·grow [be exalted].

1.verse: The God Who Always Wins - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. A song. ·People in Judah know God [God is known in Judah]; his ·fame [name] is great in Israel.

2.verse: His Tent is in ·Jerusalem [Salem; shortened name of Jerusalem]; his ·home [abode] is on Mount Zion [Ps. 48].

3.verse: There God broke the flaming arrows, the shields, the swords, and the weapons of war. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: God, how ·wonderful [glorious; awesome; or radiant] you are! You are more ·splendid [majestic] than the ·hills full of animals [hills full of prey; or everlasting mountains].

5.verse: The ·brave soldiers [strong of heart] were ·stripped [plundered] as they ·lay asleep in death [sleep their last sleep]. Not one ·warrior [valiant person] ·had the strength to stop it [could lift their hand].

6.verse: God of Jacob, ·when you spoke strongly [at your rebuke/reprimand], horses and riders ·fell dead [were in deep sleep; or lay stupefied].

7.verse: You are ·feared [awesome]; ·no one [who…?] can stand against you when you are angry.

8.verse: From heaven you ·gave the decision [made your judgment heard], and the earth was afraid and silent.

9.verse: God, you ·stood [rose] up to judge and to ·save [give victory to] the needy people of the earth. ·Selah [Interlude]

10.verse: ·People praise you for your anger against evil [or Human anger praises you]. ·Those who live through your anger are stopped from doing more evil [Those who survive your wrath are restrained; You gird the remains of wrath on you].

11.verse: Make and keep your ·promises [vows] to the LORD your God. From all around, gifts should come to the God ·we worship [who is awesome].

12.verse: God ·breaks [cuts off] the spirits of ·great leaders [princes]; the kings on earth fear him.

1.verse: Remembering God’s Help - For the director of music. For Jeduthun [a Levitical musician; 1 Chr. 16:41–42; 25:1, 6; 2 Chr. 5:12]. A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. I cry out to God; I call to God, and he ·will hear [or heard] me.

2.verse: I ·look [sought] for the Lord on the day of ·trouble [my distress]. All night long I ·reach out my untiring hands [flow forth my hand and it does not grow weak], but I ·cannot [refuse to] be comforted.

3.verse: When I remember God, I ·become upset [moan]; when I ·think [reflect; meditate], ·I become afraid [my soul faints]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: You ·keep my eyes from closing [grab the eyelids of my eyes]. I am too ·upset [disturbed] to say anything.

5.verse: I keep thinking about the old days, the years of long ago [when things were going well].

6.verse: At night I remember my songs. I ·think [meditate] and ·I ask myself [my spirit inquires]:

7.verse: “Will the Lord reject us forever? Will he never be ·kind [favorable] to us again?

8.verse: Is his ·love [loyalty] gone forever? Has he stopped speaking for all time [he questions God’s commitment to the covenant]?

9.verse: Has God forgotten ·mercy [compassion]? Is he too angry to ·pity [have mercy on] us?” ·Selah [Interlude]

10.verse: Then I say, “This is what makes me sad: ·For years the power of God Most High was with us [The right hand of the God Most High has changed].”

11.verse: I remember what the LORD did; I remember the ·miracles [wonderful acts] you did long ago.

12.verse: I ·think [mused] about all the things you did and ·consider [meditated on] your deeds.

13.verse: God, your ways are holy. ·No god [What god…?] is as great as our God.

14.verse: You are the God who does ·miracles [wonders]; you have ·shown [made known to] people your power.

15.verse: By your ·power [arm] you have ·saved [redeemed] your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. ·Selah [Interlude]

16.verse: God, the waters saw you; they saw you and ·became afraid [writhed]; the deep waters shook with fear.

17.verse: The clouds poured down their rain. The ·sky [clouds] ·thundered [gave forth a sound]. Your lightning flashed back and forth like arrows.

18.verse: Your thunder sounded in the whirlwind. Lightning lit up the world. The earth trembled and ·shook [quaked].

19.verse: You made a way through the sea and paths through the ·deep [many] waters, but your footprints were not ·seen [revealed].

20.verse: You led your people like a flock by ·using [the hand of] Moses and Aaron [Ex. 14–15].

1.verse: God Saved Israel from Egypt - A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. My people, ·listen [give ear] to my ·teaching [instruction; law]; ·listen [incline your ear] to ·what I say [the words of my mouth].

2.verse: I will ·speak [open my mouth] ·using stories [with a proverb/parable]; I will ·tell [expound] ·secret things [riddles] from long ago [the past contains lessons for the present generation].

3.verse: We have heard them and known them by what our ·ancestors [fathers] have ·told [recounted to] us.

4.verse: We will not ·keep [hide] them from our children; we will ·tell [recount them to] ·those who come later [a later generation] about the praises of the LORD. We will tell about his power and the ·miracles [wonderful acts] he has done.

5.verse: The LORD ·made an agreement [established a decree/testimony] with Jacob and gave the ·teachings [instructions; laws] to Israel [Ex. 19–24], which he commanded our ·ancestors [fathers] to ·teach [make known] to their children [Deut. 6:6–9, 20–22].

6.verse: Then ·their children [the later generation] would know them, even their children not yet born. And they would ·tell [rise up and recount them to] their children.

7.verse: So they would ·all trust [place their trust/confidence in] God and would not forget what he had done but would ·obey [protect] his commands.

8.verse: They would not be like their ·ancestors [fathers] who were ·stubborn and disobedient [a stubborn and rebellious generation]. Their hearts were not ·loyal [steadfast; set] to God, and they were not ·true [faithful] to him [Deut. 9:6–7, 13, 24; 31:27; 32:5; Acts 2:40].

9.verse: The men of Ephraim ·had bows for weapons [were armed for shooting the bow], but they ·ran away [turned back] on the day of battle [perhaps 1 Sam. 4:1–4 or 1 Sam. 28–31].

10.verse: They didn’t ·keep [observe; guard] their ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with God and refused to ·live [walk] by his ·teachings [instructions; laws].

11.verse: They forgot what he had done and the ·miracles [wonderful acts] he had shown them.

12.verse: He did ·miracles [wonderful acts] while their ·ancestors [fathers] watched, in the fields of Zoan [a city in the Nile Delta also known as Tanis] in Egypt [the plagues; Ex. 7–12].

13.verse: He divided the ·Red Sea [Sea; probably a lake north of the Gulf of Suez] and led them through [Ex. 14–15]. He made the water stand up like a ·wall [or heap; Ex. 15:8].

14.verse: He led them with a cloud by day and by the light of a fire by night [105:39; Ex. 13:21; Num. 10:34].

15.verse: He split the rocks in the ·desert [wilderness] and gave them more ·than enough water, as if from the deep ocean [water, as much as the deeps].

16.verse: He brought streams out of the rock and caused water to flow down like rivers [Ex. 17:6; Num. 20:8; 1 Cor. 10:4].

17.verse: But the people continued to sin against him; in the ·desert [wasteland; wilderness] they ·turned [rebelled] against God Most High.

18.verse: They ·decided to test God [tested God in their hearts] by asking for the food ·they wanted [for their appetite].

19.verse: Then they spoke against God, saying, “Can God prepare ·food [a table] in the ·desert [wilderness]?

20.verse: When he ·hit [struck] the rock, water ·poured out [gushed] and rivers flowed down. But can he give us bread also? Will he provide his people with meat [Ex. 16]?”

21.verse: When the LORD heard them, he was very angry. ·His anger was like fire to the people of [A fire was ignited against] Jacob; his anger ·grew against the people of [rose up against] Israel [Num. 11].

22.verse: They had not ·believed [trusted; been faithful to] God and had not ·trusted [put confidence in] him to ·save them [give them victory].

23.verse: But he gave a command to the clouds above and opened the doors of heaven.

24.verse: He rained manna down on them to eat; he gave them grain from heaven.

25.verse: So they ate the bread of ·angels [strong ones]. He sent them all the food they could eat.

26.verse: He sent the east wind from heaven and ·led [guided] the south wind by his power.

27.verse: He rained meat on them like dust. The birds were as many as the sand of the sea.

28.verse: He made the birds fall inside the camp, all around the ·tents [residences].

29.verse: So the people ate and became very ·full [satisfied; satiated]. God had given them what they ·wanted [desired].

30.verse: While ·they were still eating [their desire had not turned aside], and while the food was still in their mouths,

31.verse: ·God became angry with them [the anger of God came up on them]. He killed some of the ·healthiest [most robust; sturdiest] of them; he ·struck down [laid low] the best young men of Israel.

32.verse: But they kept on sinning; they did not believe even with the ·miracles [wonderful acts].

33.verse: So he ended their days without ·meaning [purpose; Eccl. 1:2] and their years in terror.

34.verse: Anytime he killed them, they would ·look to him for help [seek him]; they would ·come back to God [repent] and ·follow [be intent on] him.

35.verse: They would remember that God was their Rock [the one who protected them], that God Most High had ·saved [redeemed] them.

36.verse: But ·their words were false [they deceived/or flattered him with their mouths], and with their tongues they lied to him.

37.verse: Their hearts were not really ·loyal to [steadfast toward] God; they ·did not keep [were not faithful to] his ·agreement [covenant].

38.verse: Still God was ·merciful [compassionate]. He ·forgave their sins [made atonement for their guilt] and did not destroy them. Many times he held back his anger and did not stir up all his ·anger [wrath].

39.verse: He remembered that they were ·only human [flesh; 38:3; 56:4; 103:14–15; Gen. 6:3; Is. 2:22], like a wind that blows and does not come back.

40.verse: They ·turned [rebelled] against God so often in the ·desert [wilderness] and grieved him ·there [in the wasteland].

41.verse: Again and again they tested God and ·brought pain to [provoked] the Holy One of Israel.

42.verse: They did not remember his ·power [hand] or the ·time [day] he ·saved [ransomed] them from the ·enemy [foe].

43.verse: They forgot the signs he did in Egypt and his wonders in the fields of Zoan [v. 12].

44.verse: He turned their rivers to blood so no one could drink ·the water [from their streams; 105:29; Ex. 7:17–20; Rev. 16:4].

45.verse: He sent flies that ·bit [consumed] the people [Ex. 8:20–32]. He sent frogs that destroyed them [Ex. 7:25—8:15].

46.verse: He gave their crops to grasshoppers and ·what they worked for [their labor] to locusts [Ex. 10:1–20].

47.verse: He ·destroyed [killed] their vines with hail and their ·sycamore [or fig] trees with ·sleet [or frost; or floods; Ex. 9:13–35].

48.verse: He ·killed their animals with [handed over their beasts to the] hail and their cattle with lightning [Ex. 9:1–7].

49.verse: He ·showed [sent against] them his hot anger. He sent his strong anger against them, his ·destroying angels [or messengers of evil/harm].

50.verse: He ·found a way to show [made a path for] his anger. He did not ·keep them from dying [hold back their lives from death] but ·let them die by a terrible disease [handed their lives over to plague].

51.verse: God ·killed [struck] all the firstborn sons in Egypt [Ex. 12], the ·oldest son of each family [first of their virility in the tents] of Ham [the ancestor of the Egyptians; Gen. 10:6].

52.verse: But God led his people out like sheep and he guided them like a flock through the ·desert [wilderness].

53.verse: He led them to safety so they had nothing to fear, but ·their enemies drowned in the sea [the sea covered their enemies].

54.verse: So God brought them to his holy ·land [boundary], to the mountain country ·he took with his own power [his hand acquired].

55.verse: He ·forced out [dispossessed before them] the other nations, and he ·had his people inherit the land [alloted the land as an inheritance]. He let the tribes of Israel settle there in tents.

56.verse: But they tested God and ·turned [rebelled] against God Most High; they did not ·keep [observe; guard] his ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

57.verse: They ·turned away [recoiled] and were disloyal just like their ·ancestors [fathers]. They ·were like [turned into] a ·crooked bow that does not shoot straight [slack bow; unreliable and ineffective].

58.verse: They made God angry ·by building places to worship gods [with their high places; worship sites associated with pagan worship or inappropriate worship of God; Deut. 12:2–3]; they made him jealous with their idols.

59.verse: When God heard them, he became very angry and rejected the people of Israel completely.

60.verse: He ·left [cast off] his dwelling at Shiloh, the Tent where he lived among the people.

61.verse: He let his ·Power [Strength; the Ark] be captured; he let his ·glory [beauty; the Ark] be taken by ·enemies [the hand of the foe; 1 Sam. 4–5].

62.verse: He ·let his people be killed [handed his people over to the sword]; he was very angry with his ·children [inheritance].

63.verse: The young men ·died [were consumed] by fire, and the young women ·had no one to marry [had no wedding songs; or could not sing a lament for them].

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword [1 Sam. 4:12–22], but their widows were not allowed to cry.

65.verse: Then the Lord ·got up [awoke] as if he had been asleep; ·he awoke like a man [like a soldier] who had been ·drunk with [shouting/singing because of] wine.

66.verse: He struck ·down [back] his enemies and ·disgraced them forever [placed on them eternal scorn/reproach].

67.verse: But God rejected the ·family [tent] of Joseph [the tribe of Ephraim]; he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim [the most important northern tribe, here representing the house of Saul].

68.verse: Instead, he chose the tribe of Judah and Mount Zion [the location of the Temple], which he loves.

69.verse: And he built his ·Temple [sanctuary; Holy Place] ·high like the mountains [or like the high heavens]. Like the earth, ·he built it to last [its foundations are] forever.

70.verse: He chose David to be his servant and took him from the sheep pens.

71.verse: He brought him from tending the ·sheep [ewes] so he could ·lead the flock, [shepherd] the people of Jacob, his ·own people [inheritance], the people of Israel.

72.verse: And David ·led [shepherded] them with an ·innocent [blameless] heart and guided them with skillful hands.

1.verse: The Nation Cries for Jerusalem - A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. God, nations have come against your ·chosen people [inheritance]. They have ·ruined [profaned] your holy Temple. They have turned Jerusalem into ·ruins [a dump; 2 Kin. 25:9–10].

2.verse: They have given the bodies of your servants as food to the ·wild birds [birds of the sky/heavens]. They have given the ·bodies [flesh] of ·those who worship you [your faithful ones; saints] to the wild animals [Jer. 34:20].

3.verse: They have spilled blood like water all around Jerusalem. No one was left to bury the dead.

4.verse: We are a ·joke [reproach; scorn] to the ·other nations [residents]; ·they [the people around us] ·laugh [ridicule] and make fun of us.

5.verse: LORD, how long? Will you be angry forever? How long will your jealousy burn like a fire?

6.verse: ·Be angry with [Pour out your wrath on] the nations that do not know you and ·with [or on] the kingdoms that do not ·honor you [call on your name].

7.verse: They have ·gobbled up [devoured] the people of Jacob and ·destroyed [desolated] their ·land [pasturage].

8.verse: Don’t ·punish us for our past sins [remember our former guilt]. Show your ·mercy [compassion] to us soon, because we are ·helpless [very low]!

9.verse: God our ·Savior [Victor], help us ·so people will praise you [for the glory of your name]. ·Save [Protect] us and ·forgive [atone for] our sins ·so people will honor you [for your name].

10.verse: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” ·Tell [Inform] the other nations ·in our presence [before our eyes] that you ·punish [avenge] ·those who kill your servants [the blood of your servants that has been poured out].

11.verse: ·Hear the moans of the prisoners [Let the groans of the prisoner come before you]. Use your great ·power [arm] to save those ·sentenced [doomed] to die.

12.verse: Repay ·those around [into the bosom of those around] us seven times over for their ·insults to [reproach/scorn of] you, Lord.

13.verse: We are your people, the sheep of your ·flock [pasture]. We will ·thank [praise] you always; ·forever and ever [from generation to generation] we ·will praise you [recount your praise].

1.verse: A Prayer to Bring Israel Back - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies of the Agreement.” A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. Shepherd of Israel, ·listen to us [give ear]. You ·lead [guide] the people of Joseph [the northern empire of Israel] like a flock. You sit on your throne between the ·gold creatures with wings [cherubim; Ex. 25:18–22; 1 Kin. 8:7]. ·Show your greatness [Shine forth]

2.verse: to the people of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh. ·Use [Arouse] your strength, and come to ·save us [give us victory].

3.verse: God, ·take us back [restore us]. ·Show us your kindness [Make your face shine on us; 31:16; 67:1; Num. 6:24–26] so we can ·be saved [have victory].

4.verse: LORD God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], how long will you ·be angry [smoke/fume at us] at the prayers of your people?

5.verse: You have fed your people ·with tears [the bread/food of tears]; you have made them drink ·many tears [tears by measure/the third].

6.verse: You made ·those around us fight over us [us the strife of our neighbors], and our enemies ·make fun of [ridicule] us.

7.verse: God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], ·take us back [restore us]. ·Show us your kindness [Make your face shine on us; 31:16; 67:1; Num. 6:24–26] so we can ·be saved [have victory].

8.verse: You brought ·us out of Egypt as if we were a vine [a vine out of Egypt; Gen. 49:22; Is. 5:1–7; 27:2–6; Jer. 2:21; 12:10; Ezek. 15:1–8; 19:10–14; Hos. 10:1]. You ·forced out [dispossessed] other nations and planted us in the land.

9.verse: You cleared the ground for us. We took root and filled the land.

10.verse: We covered the mountains with our shade. We had branches like the mighty cedar tree.

11.verse: Our branches reached the Mediterranean Sea, and our shoots went to the Euphrates River.

12.verse: So why did you ·pull [break] down our walls? Now everyone who passes by ·steals from us [picks our fruit].

13.verse: Like ·wild pigs [boars of the forest] they ·walk over us [ravage us; gobble us up]; like ·wild animals [creatures of the field] they feed on us.

14.verse: God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], ·come back [restore us]. Look down from heaven and see. Take care of us, your vine.

15.verse: You planted this ·shoot [root] with your own hands and strengthened this child [the king].

16.verse: Now it is cut down and burned with fire; you destroyed us by ·your angry looks [the rebuke of your face].

17.verse: ·With your hand, strengthen the one you have chosen for yourself [Let your hand be on the man of your right hand; the king].

18.verse: Then we will not ·turn away from [deviate from; be disloyal to] you. Give us life again, and we will call ·to you for help [on your name].

19.verse: LORD God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], ·take us back [restore us]. ·Show us your kindness [Make your face shine on us; 31:16; 67:1; Num. 6:24–26] so we can ·be saved [have victory].

1.verse: A Song for a Holiday - For the director of music. By the gittith [perhaps a musical term or instrument]. A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. Sing for joy to God, our strength; shout out loud to the God of Jacob [another name for Israel].

2.verse: ·Begin the music [Lift up a psalm]. ·Play [Sound; Give] the tambourines [68:25; 149:3; 150:4; Ex. 15:20]. ·Play pleasant music on the harps […the pleasant/sweet harps] and lyres.

3.verse: Blow the ·trumpet [ram’s horn] at ·the time of the New Moon [the month; a monthly religious festival], when the moon is full, when our feast begins.

4.verse: This is the ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] for Israel; it is the ·command [judgment] of the God of Jacob [v. 1].

5.verse: He ·gave [set] this ·rule [decree; testimony] to the people of Joseph [reference to the northern tribes] when they went out of the land of Egypt [the exodus; Ex. 12–15]. I heard a ·language [tongue] I did not know, saying [God now speaks]:

6.verse: “I ·took the load off [removed the burden from] their shoulders; ·I let them put down their baskets [Their hands were removed from the baskets].

7.verse: When you were in ·trouble [distress], you called, and I ·saved [rescued] you. I answered you ·with thunder [in the secret place of thunder; Ex. 19:18–19]. I tested you at the waters of Meribah [95:8; 106:32; Ex. 17:1–17; Num. 20:1–13]. ·Selah [Interlude]

8.verse: My people, listen. I ·am warning [bear testimony/witness against] you. Israel, please listen to me!

9.verse: You must not have ·foreign [strange] gods; you must not worship any ·false [foreign] god.

10.verse: I, the LORD, am your God, who brought you out of Egypt. ·Open [Widen] your mouth and I will feed you [Deut. 29:6; 32:10–14].

11.verse: “But my people did not listen to ·me [my voice]; Israel did not ·want [accept] me.

12.verse: So I ·let them go their stubborn way [threw them away because of their stubborn hearts] and ·follow [walk according to] their own advice.

13.verse: I wish my people would listen to me; I wish Israel would ·live [walk on] my way.

14.verse: Then I would quickly ·defeat [subdue; quell] their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.

15.verse: Those who hate the LORD would ·bow [cringe; cower] before him. Their ·punishment [doom] would continue forever.

16.verse: But I would give you the finest wheat [Deut. 32:14] and fill you with honey from the rocks [Deut. 32:13].”

1.verse: A Cry for Justice - A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. God ·is in charge of the great meeting [takes his place/presides in the great assembly/or the assembly of the gods/divine council; the angels (powers and authorities; Eph. 6:12) are here called “gods”]; he judges among the “gods” [John 10:35–36].

2.verse: He says, “How long will you ·defend evil people [or judge unfairly]? How long will you show ·greater kindness [favor; preference] to the wicked? ·Selah [Interlude]

3.verse: ·Defend [Judge] the ·weak [or poor] and the orphans; ·defend the rights of [vindicate] the poor and ·suffering [needy].

4.verse: ·Save [Rescue] the ·weak [or poor] and helpless; ·free [protect] them from the ·power [hand] of the wicked.

5.verse: “You know nothing. You don’t understand. You walk in the dark, while the ·world is falling apart [foundations of the earth are tottering].

6.verse: I said, ‘You are “gods.” You are all sons of God Most High.’

7.verse: But you will die like any other person; you will fall like all the ·leaders [princes; God will punish these evil angels].”

8.verse: God, ·come [rise up] and judge the earth, because you ·own [inherit] all the nations.

1.verse: A Prayer Against the Enemies - A song. A psalm of Asaph [a Levitical musician, a descendant of Gershon, at the time of David; 1 Chr. 6:39; 15:17; 2 Chr. 5:12]. God, do not keep quiet; God, do not be silent or still.

2.verse: Your enemies are ·making noises [in tumult]; those who hate you ·are getting ready to attack [raise up their head; 2:1].

3.verse: They are making secret ·plans [plots] against your people; they plot against those you ·love [cherish; treasure].

4.verse: They say, “Come, let’s ·destroy them [wipe them out] as a nation. Then no one will ever remember the name ‘Israel.’”

5.verse: They ·are united in their plan [plot with one mind/heart]. These have ·made an agreement [cut a covenant/treaty] against you:

6.verse: the ·families [tents] of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,

7.verse: the people of Byblos, Ammon, Amalek, Philistia, and inhabitants of Tyre.

8.verse: Even Assyria has joined them to ·help Ammon and Moab, the [be the arm of the] descendants of Lot [a list of traditional enemies of Israel]. ·Selah [Interlude]

9.verse: God, do to them what you did to Midian, what you did to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon ·River [Wadi; Judg. 4–5].

10.verse: They ·died [were destroyed] at Endor, ·and their bodies rotted [like dung/manure] on the ground.

11.verse: Do to their ·important leaders [princes; nobles] what you did to Oreb and Zeeb [Judg. 7:25]. Do to their princes what you did to Zebah and Zalmunna [Judg. 8:21].

12.verse: They said, “Let’s take for ourselves the pasturelands that belong to God.”

13.verse: My God, make them like tumbleweed, like chaff blown ·away by [before] the wind [rootless and landless; 1:4].

14.verse: Be like a fire that burns a forest or like flames that blaze through the ·hills [mountains].

15.verse: ·Chase [Pursue] them with your ·storm [tempest], and ·frighten [terrify] them with your ·wind [hurricane].

16.verse: ·Cover [Fill] them with shame. Then people will ·look for you [seek your name], LORD.

17.verse: Make them afraid and ashamed forever. ·Disgrace [Humiliate] them and destroy them.

18.verse: Then they will know that ·you are the LORD [the LORD is your name], that only you are God Most High over all the earth.

1.verse: Wishing to Be in the Temple - For the director of music. On the gittith [perhaps a musical term or instrument]. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], how lovely is your ·Temple [residence; dwelling place]!

2.verse: I ·want more than anything to be in [long, even faint for] the courtyards of the ·LORD’s Temple [LORD]. My ·whole being wants to be with [heart/mind and flesh sing for joy to] the living God.

3.verse: The sparrows have found a home, and the swallows have nests. They raise their young near your altars, LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], my King and my God.

4.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are the people who live at your ·Temple [house]; they are always praising you. ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are those whose strength comes from you, ·who want to travel to Jerusalem [in whose hearts are highways; they want to make pilgrimage to Jerusalem to celebrate religious festivals].

6.verse: As they pass through the Valley of Baca [“weeping,” location unknown], they make it ·like [a place with] a spring. The ·autumn [early] rains ·fill [wrap; cover] it with ·pools of water [or blessings].

7.verse: The people ·get stronger as they go [go from strength to strength], and everyone ·meets with [sees] ·God [the God of gods] in ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple].

8.verse: LORD God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], hear my prayer; God of Jacob [another name for Israel], ·listen to me [give ear]. ·Selah [Interlude]

9.verse: God, look at our shield [the king]; be kind to your ·appointed king [anointed; Messiah; the king, ultimately Jesus; Acts 4:25–28].

10.verse: One day in your courtyards is better than a thousand days anywhere else. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the Temple of my God than live in the ·homes [tents] of the wicked.

11.verse: The LORD God is like a sun and shield; the LORD gives us ·kindness [mercy; grace] and ·honor [glory]. He does not hold back anything good from those ·whose lives are innocent [who walk in innocence/blamelessness].

12.verse: LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], ·happy [blessed] are the people who ·trust [have confidence in] you!

1.verse: A Prayer for the Nation - For the director of music. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. LORD, you ·have been kind to [delight in] your land; you ·brought back [restored the fortunes of; perhaps at the end of the exile] the people of Jacob [another name for Israel].

2.verse: You forgave the guilt of the people and covered all their sins. ·Selah [Interlude]

3.verse: You ·stopped [drew back from] all your anger; you turned back from your ·strong [burning] anger.

4.verse: God our Savior, ·bring us back again [restore us again]. Stop being angry with us.

5.verse: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you ·stay angry [draw out your anger against us] from now on?

6.verse: Won’t you give us life again? Your people would rejoice in you.

7.verse: LORD, show us your ·love [loyalty], and ·save us [give to us your salvation/victory].

8.verse: I will listen to what God the LORD says. He has ·ordered [spoken; promised] ·peace [prosperity] for ·those who worship him [his people, his saints/loyal ones]. Don’t let them go back to foolishness.

9.verse: ·God will soon save those who respect him [His salvation/victory is near to those who fear him; Prov. 1:7], and his glory will ·be seen [dwell] in our land.

10.verse: ·Love [Loyalty] and ·truth [faithfulness] ·belong to God’s people [meet]; ·goodness [righteousness] and ·peace [prosperity] ·will be theirs [kiss].

11.verse: ·On earth people will be loyal to God [Faithfulness sprouts/blooms from the earth/land], and ·God’s goodness [righteousness] will ·shine [look] down from heaven.

12.verse: The LORD will give his ·goodness [or good gifts], and the land will give its crops.

13.verse: ·Goodness [Righteousness] will go before ·God [him] and prepare the way for ·him [his steps].

1.verse: A Cry for Help - A prayer of David. LORD, ·listen to me [incline your ear] and answer me. I am poor and ·helpless [needy].

2.verse: ·Protect [Guard] me, because I ·worship you [am loyal/holy/a saint]. My God, ·save me [give me victory], your servant who ·trusts [has confidence] in you.

3.verse: Lord, ·have mercy on [be gracious to] me, because I have called to you all day.

4.verse: Give ·happiness [joy] to me, your servant, because I ·give [lift up] my life to you, Lord.

5.verse: Lord, you are ·kind [good] and forgiving and have great ·love [loyalty] for those who call to you [Ex. 34:7].

6.verse: LORD, ·hear [give ear to] my prayer, and ·listen [pay attention] ·when I ask for mercy [to the sound of my supplication].

7.verse: I call to you in ·times of trouble [the day of my distress], because you will answer me.

8.verse: Lord, there is ·no god like you [none like you among the gods; Ex. 15:11; 20:3] and no works like yours.

9.verse: Lord, all the nations you have made will come and ·worship [bow down before] you. They will ·honor you [glorify your name].

10.verse: You are great and you do ·miracles [wonderful acts]. Only you are God.

11.verse: LORD, teach me ·what you want me to do [your way], and I will ·live [walk] ·by your truth [in your faithfulness]. ·Teach me to respect you completely [Give me an undivided heart to fear your name].

12.verse: Lord, my God, I will ·praise [thank] you with all my heart, and I will ·honor [glorify] your name forever.

13.verse: You have great ·love [loyalty] for me. You have ·saved [delivered] me from ·death [Sheol down below; the grave or the underworld].

14.verse: God, ·proud [arrogant] people ·are attacking [rise up against] me; a ·gang [assembly] of ·cruel [violent] people ·is trying to kill me [seek my life]. They do not ·respect you [set you before them].

15.verse: But, Lord, you are a God who shows ·mercy [compassion] and is ·kind [merciful; compassionate]. You ·don’t become angry quickly [are patient/longsuffering]. You have great ·love [loyalty] and ·faithfulness [truth; Ex. 34:6–7].

16.verse: Turn to me and ·have mercy [be gracious]. Give me, your servant, strength. ·Save [Give victory to] me, the son of your female servant.

17.verse: ·Show [Give] me a sign of your goodness. When my enemies look, they will be ashamed. You, LORD, have helped me and comforted me.

1.verse: God Loves Jerusalem - A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. ·The LORD built Jerusalem [Its foundations are] on the holy mountain [Zion, the location of the Temple].

2.verse: ·He [The LORD] loves ·its gates [the gates of Zion] more than any other place in ·Israel [Jacob].

3.verse: City of God, ·wonderful [glorious] things are said about you [46; 48; Is. 2:2–4; 26:1–2; 60:15–22; 61:1–7]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: God says, “I will ·put Egypt and Babylonia on the list of nations that know me [mention Rahab and Babylonia as those who know me]. People from Philistia, Tyre, and Cush [Ethiopia] will be born there.”

5.verse: They will say about ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple], “This one and that one were born there. God Most High will ·strengthen [establish] her.”

6.verse: The LORD will keep a list of the nations. He will note, “This person was born there.” ·Selah [Interlude]

7.verse: They will dance and sing, “All ·good things come from Jerusalem [my fountains are in you; 46:4; Jer. 2:13; Ezek. 47; Rev. 22:1–5].”

1.verse: A Sad Complaint - A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah [descendants of Kohath, son of Levi, who served as temple musicians; 1 Chr. 6:22]. For the director of music. By the ·mahalath [perhaps “sickness”; Ps. 53] ·leannoth [perhaps related to a word for “affliction” or a word for “chant”]. A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of Heman the Ezrahite [perhaps a wise man (1 Kin. 4:31) or a Levitical singer (1 Chr. 6:16, 33, 39, 43–44; 15:17, 19)]. LORD, you are the God who ·saves me [gives me victory]. I cry out to you day and night.

2.verse: Receive my prayer, and ·listen [extend your ear] to my cry.

3.verse: My life is full of ·troubles [hurt; harm], and ·I am nearly dead [my life approaches/touches Sheol; the grave or the underworld].

4.verse: They think I am ·on the way to my grave [like someone who goes down into the Pit]. I am like a man with no strength.

5.verse: I have been ·left as dead [freed among the dead], like a ·body [corpse] lying in a grave whom you don’t remember anymore, cut off from your ·care [hand].

6.verse: You have ·brought me close to death [set me in a Pit below]; ·I am almost in the dark place of the dead […in the deepest darkness].

7.verse: You have ·been very angry with [put your wrath on] me; ·all your waves crush me [you have afflicted me with all your breakers]. ·Selah [Interlude]

8.verse: You have ·taken [moved] my friends away from me and have made ·them hate me [me an abomination to them]. I am ·trapped [imprisoned] and cannot ·escape [get out].

9.verse: My eyes ·are weak [waste away] from ·crying [affliction]. LORD, I have ·prayed [called] to you every day; I have ·lifted [spread out] my hands to you [in prayer].

10.verse: Do you ·show [do] your ·miracles [wonderful acts] for the dead? Do their ·spirits [shades; departed] rise up and ·praise [thank] you? ·Selah [Interlude]

11.verse: Will your ·love [loyalty] be ·told [recounted] in the grave? Will your ·loyalty [faithfulness] be told in ·the place of death [Abaddon/Destruction]?

12.verse: Will your ·miracles [wonderful acts] be known in the ·dark grave [darkness]? Will your ·goodness [righteousness] be known in the land of forgetfulness?

13.verse: But, LORD, I have called out to you for help; every morning ·I pray to you [my prayer comes before you].

14.verse: LORD, why do you reject me? Why do you hide your face from me?

15.verse: I have been ·weak [afflicted] and dying since I was young. I suffer from your terrors, and I am ·helpless [or depressed].

16.verse: ·You have been angry with me [Your wrath has passed over me], and your terrors have ·destroyed [or silenced] me.

17.verse: They surround me daily like ·a flood [water; representing chaos]; they ·are [go] all around me.

18.verse: You have ·taken away [removed me from] my loved ones and friends. Darkness is my only friend.

1.verse: A Song About God’s Loyalty - A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of Ethan the Ezrahite [a wise man; 1 Kin. 4:31]. I will always sing about the LORD’s ·love [loyalty]; I will ·tell of [make known with my mouth] his ·loyalty [faithfulness] ·from now on [for generations].

2.verse: I will say, “Your ·love [loyalty] ·continues [is built] forever; your ·loyalty [faithfulness] ·goes on and on [is established] like the ·sky [heavens].”

3.verse: You said, “I ·made an agreement [cut a covenant/treaty] with the man of my choice; I made a promise to my servant David.

4.verse: I told him, ‘I will ·make your family continue [establish your seed] forever. ·Your kingdom will go on and on [I will build your throne for generations; 2; 72; 78:70–72; 2 Sam. 7:11–16; 1 Chr. 17:10–14].’” ·Selah [Interlude]

5.verse: LORD, the heavens praise you for your ·miracles [wonderful acts] and for your ·loyalty [faithfulness] in the ·meeting [assembly] of your holy ones.

6.verse: Who in ·heaven [the skies] ·is equal to [ranks with] the LORD? None of the ·angels [gods; divine council/assembly; sons of God; 82:1] is like the LORD.

7.verse: When the ·holy ones [council of holy ones] meet, it is God they fear. He is more ·frightening [awesome] than all who surround him.

8.verse: LORD God ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], who is like you? LORD, you are powerful and completely ·trustworthy [faithful].

9.verse: You rule the ·mighty [raging; surging] sea and ·calm [still] the ·stormy [rising] waves.

10.verse: You crushed the Rahab [a sea monster, representing chaos (Job 26:12; Is. 51:9) and in some contexts Egypt defeated at the Sea (87:4; Is. 30:7; Ezek. 29:3; 32:3)] like a corpse; by your ·power [strong arm] you scattered your enemies.

11.verse: The ·skies [heavens] and the earth belong to you. You ·made [founded] the world and ·everything in it [its fullness].

12.verse: You created the north and the south. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon [majestic mountains] sing for joy at your name.

13.verse: Your arm has great power. Your hand is strong; your right hand is lifted up.

14.verse: Your ·kingdom [throne] is ·built [established] on ·what is right and fair [righteousness and judgment/justice]. ·Love [Loyalty] and ·truth [faithfulness] are ·in all you do [before your face].

15.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are the people who know how to ·praise [shout to] you. LORD, let them ·live [walk] in the light of your ·presence [face].

16.verse: In your name they rejoice and continually ·praise [exalt] your ·goodness [righteousness].

17.verse: You are their ·glorious [beautiful] strength, and in your ·kindness [favor] you ·honor our king [lift up our horn; symbol of power and here of the king].

18.verse: Our shield [the king] belongs to the LORD, our king to the Holy One of Israel.

19.verse: ·Once [Then], in a vision [2 Sam. 7:4], you spoke to ·those who worship you [your faithful ones/saints]. You said, “I have ·given strength to [set help on] a warrior; I have raised up a ·young man [chosen one] from my people [1 Sam. 13:14; Acts 13:22].

20.verse: I have found my servant David; I ·appointed him by pouring [have anointed him with] holy oil on him [1 Sam. 16:1–13].

21.verse: I will steady him with my hand and strengthen him with my arm.

22.verse: No enemy will ·make him give forced payments [make him pay tribute; or prevail over/or outwit him], and wicked people will not ·defeat [afflict; humble] him.

23.verse: I will ·crush [pound] his enemies in front of him; I will ·defeat [strike down] those who hate him.

24.verse: My ·loyalty [faithfulness] and ·love [loyalty] will be with him. Through ·me [my name] ·he will be strong [his horn will be raised up; v. 17].

25.verse: I will ·give him power [set his hand] over the sea ·and control [his right hand] over the rivers [the waters represent chaos].

26.verse: He will ·say [proclaim] to me, ‘You are my father, my God, the Rock, my ·Savior [Victor].’

27.verse: I will make him my firstborn son, the ·greatest [highest] king on earth [2:7; 2 Sam. 7:14].

28.verse: My ·love [loyalty] will ·watch over [keep; guard] him forever, and my ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with him will ·never end [be faithful].

29.verse: I will ·make his family continue [set his seed forever], and his ·kingdom [throne] ·will last as long as the skies [like the days of the skies/heavens].

30.verse: “If his descendants ·reject [leave; abandon] my ·teachings [instructions; laws] and do not ·follow [walk in] my ·laws [judgments],

31.verse: if they ·ignore [profane] my ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·disobey [do not keep/guard] my commands,

32.verse: then I will punish their ·sins [transgressions] with a rod and their ·wrongs [guilt] with ·a whip [lashes].

33.verse: But I will not ·hold back [break; invalidate] my ·love [loyalty] from ·David [him], nor will I ·stop being loyal [deal falsely with my faithfulness].

34.verse: I will not ·break [profane; violate] my ·agreement [covenant; treaty] nor ·change [alter] what ·I have said [came out of my lips].

35.verse: Once and for all I have ·promised [sworn] by my holiness, I will not lie to David.

36.verse: His ·family [seed] will go on forever. His ·kingdom [throne] will last before me like the sun.

37.verse: It will ·continue [be established] forever, like the moon, like a ·dependable [reliable; faithful] witness in the sky.” ·Selah [Interlude]

38.verse: But now you have ·refused [spurned] and rejected him. You have been angry with your ·appointed king [anointed; v. 20].

39.verse: You have ·abandoned [disavowed] the ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with your servant and ·thrown [profaned; defiled] his crown ·to [or in] the ground [Jer. 13:18–19].

40.verse: You have ·torn down [broken up] all his city walls; you have turned his strong cities into ruins.

41.verse: Everyone who passes by ·steals from [plunders] him. ·His neighbors insult him [He is scorned by/a reproach to his neighbors].

42.verse: You have ·given strength of [exalted the right hand of] his ·enemies [foes] and have made ·them all [all his enemies] happy.

43.verse: You have ·made his sword useless [turned back the blade/rock of his sword]; you did not help him stand in battle.

44.verse: You have ·kept him from winning [or put aside his purity] and have thrown his throne to the ground.

45.verse: You have cut ·his life [the days of his youth] short and ·covered [wrapped] him with shame. ·Selah [Interlude]

46.verse: LORD, how long will this go on? Will you ·ignore [hide from] us forever? How long will your anger burn like a fire?

47.verse: Remember how ·short [fleeting] my life is. Why did you create us? For ·nothing [futility; vanity; no purpose]?

48.verse: What person alive will not ·die [see death]? Who can escape ·the grave [from the hand/power of Sheol; the grave or the underworld]? ·Selah [Interlude]

49.verse: Lord, where is your ·love [loyalty] from times past, which in your ·loyalty [faithfulness] you ·promised [swore] to David [2 Sam. 7:11–14]?

50.verse: Lord, remember ·how they insulted [the reproach/scorn of] your servant; remember how I ·have suffered the insults of the nations [carry in my bosom all of the many peoples].

51.verse: LORD, remember how your enemies ·insulted [reproached; scorned] you and how they ·insulted [reproached; scorned] ·your appointed king wherever he went [the footsteps of your anointed; v. 20].

52.verse: ·Praise [Blessed be] the LORD forever! Amen and amen.

1.verse: Book 4: Psalms 90–106 God Is Eternal, and We Are Not - A prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, you have been our ·home [dwelling place; Deut. 33:27] ·since the beginning [from all generations].

2.verse: Before the mountains were born and before you ·created [brought forth] the earth and the world, you are God [Prov. 8:22–31]. You have always been, and you will always be.

3.verse: You turn people back into ·dust [what is crushed; Gen. 2:7; 3:19; Eccl. 12:7]. You say, “·Go back into dust [Return; Turn back], human beings.”

4.verse: ·To you [In your eyes], a thousand years is like the passing of a day [2 Pet. 3:8], or ·like a few hours [a watch; the night was divided into four watches of three hours each] in the night.

5.verse: While people sleep, you ·take [put an end to] their lives. They are like grass that ·grows up [is new] in the morning.

6.verse: In the morning they ·are fresh and new [blossom and are renewed], but by evening they ·dry up [fade] and ·die [wither].

7.verse: We are ·destroyed [annihilated] by your anger; we are terrified by your hot anger.

8.verse: You have ·put [set] ·the evil we have done [our guilt/iniquity] right in front of you; ·you clearly see our secret sins [our hidden/secret sins in the light of your face].

9.verse: All our days pass while you are angry. Our years end with a ·moan [sigh].

10.verse: ·Our lifetime is [The days of our years are] seventy years or, if we are strong, eighty years. But ·the years are full of [their pride are] ·hard work [toil] and ·pain [trouble; Eccl. 1:2]. They pass quickly, and then we ·are gone [fly away].

11.verse: Who knows the ·full power [strength] of your anger? Your anger is as great as our fear of you should be.

12.verse: ·Teach us [Make us know] ·how short our lives really are [to count our days] so that we ·may be wise [gain a wise heart].

13.verse: LORD, how long before you ·return [turn] and show ·kindness [compassion] to your servants?

14.verse: ·Fill [Satisfy] us with your ·love [loyalty] every morning. Then we will sing and rejoice all our ·lives [days].

15.verse: We have seen years of ·trouble [harm; hurt]. Now give us as ·much [many days of] joy as you gave us ·sorrow [affliction].

16.verse: Show your servants ·the wonderful things you do [your miracles]; ·show your greatness [your splendor/beauty] to their children.

17.verse: Lord our God, ·treat us well [favor us]. ·Give us success in what we do [Establish the work of our hands for us]; ·yes, give us success in what we do [establish the work of our hands].

1.verse: Safe in the Lord - Those who ·go to God Most High for safety [dwell/sit in the shelter of God Most High] will ·be protected by [lodge in the shade/shadow of] the Almighty.

2.verse: I will say to the LORD, “You are my ·place of safety [refuge] and ·protection [fortress]. You are my God and I ·trust [have confidence in] you.”

3.verse: God will ·save [protect] you from ·hidden traps [the snare of the fowler] and from deadly ·diseases [pestilence].

4.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you ·can hide [will find refuge; Deut. 32:11; Is. 31:5; Matt. 23:37; Luke 13:34]. His ·truth [faithfulness] will be your shield and ·protection [buckler; a small shield].

5.verse: You will not fear any ·danger by [terror at] night or an arrow that flies during the day.

6.verse: ·You will not be afraid of diseases […or the pestilence] that ·come [walks; stalks] in the dark or ·sickness [stings] that ·strikes [devastates; overpowers] at noon.

7.verse: At your side one thousand people may ·die [fall], or even ten thousand ·right beside you [at your right hand], but ·you will not be hurt [it will not touch you].

8.verse: You will only ·watch [look with your eyes] and see the wicked ·punished [recompensed].

9.verse: ·The LORD is your protection [For you, LORD, are my refuge]; you have made God Most High your ·place of safety [dwelling place].

10.verse: Nothing ·bad [evil; harmful] will ·happen to [befall] you; no ·disaster [blow; or plague] will ·come to [approach] your ·home [tent].

11.verse: He has ·put his angels in charge of [commanded his angels/messengers concerning] you to ·watch over [keep; guard] ·you wherever you go [all your ways].

12.verse: They will ·catch you [lift you up] in their hands so that you will not hit your foot on a rock [Matt. 4:6; Luke 4:10–11].

13.verse: You will ·walk [tread] on lions and cobras; you will ·step on [trample] strong lions and snakes.

14.verse: The LORD says, “Whoever ·loves [desires] me, I will ·save [rescue]. I will ·protect [lift to safety] those who know ·me [my name].

15.verse: They will call to me, and I will answer them. I will be with them in ·trouble [distress]; I will rescue them and ·honor [glorify] them.

16.verse: I will ·give them a long, full life [satisfy them with length of days], and ·they will see how I can save [show them my salvation/victory].”

1.verse: Thanksgiving for God’s Goodness - A psalm. A song for the Sabbath day [Ex. 20:8–11; Deut. 5:12–15]. It is good to ·praise [thank] you, LORD, to ·sing praises to [make a psalm to the name of] God Most High.

2.verse: It is good to ·tell of [proclaim] your ·love [loyalty] in the morning and of your ·loyalty [faithfulness] at night.

3.verse: It is good to praise you with the ten-stringed lyre and ·with the soft-sounding [melody of the] harp.

4.verse: LORD, you have made me ·happy [rejoice] by what you have done; I will ·sing [shout] for joy about ·what your hands have done [the works of your hand].

5.verse: LORD, ·you have done such great things [how great are your works]! How deep are your thoughts [Is. 55:8; Rom. 11:33–34]!

6.verse: ·Stupid [Senseless; Dull-witted] people don’t know these things, and fools don’t understand.

7.verse: Wicked people ·grow [may sprout] like the grass. Evil people ·seem to do well [may blossom/flourish], but they will be ·destroyed [doomed] forever.

8.verse: But, LORD, you will be ·honored [exalted] forever.

9.verse: LORD, surely your enemies, surely your enemies will ·be destroyed [perish], and all who do evil will be scattered.

10.verse: But you have ·made me as strong as [exalted my horn like; symbol of strength] an ox. You have poured ·fine [rich; fresh] oils on me [a gesture of hospitality].

11.verse: When ·I [my eyes] looked, I saw my enemies; I heard the cries of those who ·are against me [rose against me with evil; he sees and hears the defeat of his enemies].

12.verse: But ·good [righteous] people will ·grow [sprout] like palm trees [1:3; 52:8]; they will ·be tall [grow great] like the cedars of Lebanon [trees that are strong, majestic, and long-lived].

13.verse: Like trees planted in the ·Temple [house] of the LORD, they will ·grow strong [sprout] in the courtyards of our God.

14.verse: When they are old, they will still produce fruit; they will be healthy and ·fresh [green; verdant].

15.verse: They will ·say [proclaim] that the LORD is ·good [virtuous; full of integrity; upright]. He is my Rock [28:1; 42:9; 62:2; Deut. 32:4], and there is no wrong in him.

1.verse: The Majesty of the Lord - The LORD ·is king [reigns; 47:2; 96:10; 97:1; 98:6; 99:1; Rev. 19:6]. He is ·clothed [robed] in majesty. The LORD is ·clothed [robed] in majesty and ·armed [girded] with strength. The world is ·set [established], and it ·cannot be moved [will not totter].

2.verse: LORD, your ·kingdom [throne] was ·set up [established] long ago; you are everlasting.

3.verse: LORD, the ·seas [rivers; perhaps referring to currents within the sea] raise, the ·seas [rivers] raise their voice. The ·seas [rivers] raise up their pounding waves [representing chaos].

4.verse: The sound of the water is loud; the ·ocean waves [breakers of the sea] are ·powerful [majestic], but the LORD above is much ·greater [more powerful/majestic; God is in control of chaos].

5.verse: LORD, your ·laws [decrees; testimonies] ·will stand forever [are very faithful/true]. ·Your Temple will be holy forevermore [At your house holiness is fitting/appropriate and will be for length of days].

1.verse: God Will Pay Back His Enemies - The LORD is a God ·who punishes [of vengeance; Deut. 32:35; Is. 34:8; Ezek. 24:8; 25:14–17; Nah. 1:2; Rom. 12:19; 1 Thess. 4:6]. ·God, show your greatness and punish [God of vengeance, shine forth]!

2.verse: Rise up, Judge of the earth, and give the ·proud [arrogant] ·what they deserve [their due].

3.verse: How long will the wicked be ·happy [joyful]? How long, LORD?

4.verse: They ·are full of [bubble forth, speaking] ·proud [insolent] words; those who do evil ·brag about what they have done [talk a lot].

5.verse: LORD, they crush your people and ·make your children suffer [afflict your inheritance].

6.verse: They kill widows and ·foreigners [sojourners; wanderers] and murder orphans [Ex. 22:21–24].

7.verse: They say, “The LORD doesn’t see; the God of Jacob [another name for Israel] doesn’t ·notice [understand].”

8.verse: You ·stupid [senseless; dull witted] ones among the people, ·pay attention [understand]. You fools, when will you ·understand [get insight]?

9.verse: Can’t the ·creator [planter] of ears hear? Can’t the ·maker [former; shaper] of eyes see?

10.verse: Won’t the one who ·corrects [instructs; disciplines] nations ·punish [reprimand; reprove] you? Doesn’t the teacher of people know everything?

11.verse: The LORD knows ·what people think [the thoughts of humans]. He knows their thoughts are ·just a puff of wind [a bubble/vapor/meaningless/futile; Eccl. 1:2].

12.verse: LORD, those you ·correct [instruct; discipline] are ·happy [blessed]; you teach them from your ·law [instruction; teaching].

13.verse: You give them ·rest [peace; quiet] from ·times [days] of ·trouble [harm; evil] until a pit is dug for the wicked [Prov. 26:7; Eccl. 10:8].

14.verse: The LORD won’t ·leave [abandon; cast off] his people nor ·give up [abandon; forsake] his ·children [inheritance].

15.verse: Judgment will again be ·fair [just; righteous], and all who are ·honest [upright/virtuous of heart] will follow it.

16.verse: Who will ·help me fight [rise up with me] against the wicked? Who will stand with me against those who do evil?

17.verse: If the LORD had not helped me, I would have ·died in a minute [quickly dwelled in silence].

18.verse: I said, “·I am about to fall [My feet totter],” but, LORD, your ·love [loyalty] ·kept me safe [steadied/supported me].

19.verse: ·I was very worried [In my many disquieting thoughts in my insides], but you comforted me and ·made me happy [cheered me up].

20.verse: ·Crooked leaders [Ruinous thrones] cannot be your ·friends [allies]. They use the ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] to cause ·suffering [distress].

21.verse: They ·join forces [band together] against ·people who do right [righteous people] and ·sentence [condemn] to death the innocent.

22.verse: But the LORD is my ·defender [stronghold; fortress]; my God is the rock [28:1; 42:9; 62:2; Deut. 32:4] of my ·protection [refuge].

23.verse: God will pay them back for their ·sins [guilt; iniquity] and will destroy them for their evil. The LORD our God will destroy them.

1.verse: A Call to Praise and Obedience - Come, let’s sing for joy to the LORD. Let’s shout praises to the Rock [28:1; 42:9; 62:2; Deut. 32:4] who ·saves us [gives us victory].

2.verse: Let’s ·come [present ourselves] to him with ·thanksgiving [praise]. Let’s ·sing songs [shout psalms] to him,

3.verse: because the LORD is the great God, the great King over all gods [Ex. 15:11].

4.verse: The deepest places on earth are ·his [in his hand], and the ·highest [peaks of the] mountains belong to him.

5.verse: The sea is his because he made it, and he created the ·land [dry ground] with his own hands.

6.verse: Come, let’s ·worship him [bow down] and ·bow down [bend the knee]. Let’s kneel before the LORD who made us,

7.verse: because he is our God and we are the people ·he takes care of [of his pasture], the sheep ·that he tends [of his hand; 74:1; 79:13; 100:3; John 10:11–14]. Today listen to ·what he says [his voice]:

8.verse: “Do not ·be stubborn [harden your heart], as at Meribah [“contending”; 81:7; 106:32; Ex. 17:1–17; Num. 20:1–13], as that day at Massah [“testing”] in the ·desert [wilderness; Heb. 4:7].

9.verse: There your ·ancestors [fathers] tested me and tried me even though they saw what I did.

10.verse: I ·was angry with [felt disgust for] ·those people [that generation] for forty years. I said, ‘They are ·not loyal to me [a people whose hearts wander/go astray] and have not understood my ways.’

11.verse: I was angry and made a promise, ‘They will never enter my rest.’”

1.verse: Praise for the Lord’s Glory - Sing to the LORD a new song [celebrating victory; 33:3; 40:3; 98:1; 144:9; 149:1; Is. 42:10; Rev. 5:9; 14:3]; sing to the LORD, all the earth.

2.verse: Sing to the LORD and ·praise [bless] his name; every day ·tell [announce the good news] ·how he saves us [of his salvation/victory].

3.verse: Tell the nations of his glory [his manifest presence]; tell all peoples the ·miracles [wonderful acts] he does,

4.verse: because the LORD is great; he should be praised ·at all times [or with vigor]. He ·should be honored [is awesome; should be feared] more than all the gods,

5.verse: because all the gods of the nations are ·only idols [or worthless], but the LORD made the heavens [Gen. 1].

6.verse: The LORD has ·glory [splendor] and majesty; he has power and beauty in his ·Temple [sanctuary; Holy Place].

7.verse: ·Praise [Ascribe to] the LORD, all ·nations on earth [families of peoples]; ·praise the LORD’s [ascribe to the LORD] glory and power.

8.verse: ·Praise the glory of the LORD’s [Ascribe to the LORD the glory of his] name. Bring an ·offering [grain/gift/tribute sacrifice; Lev. 2:1] and come into his Temple courtyards.

9.verse: ·Worship [Bow down to] the LORD ·because he is holy [in the splendor of his holiness]. Tremble before him, everyone on earth.

10.verse: Tell the nations, “The LORD ·is king [reigns; 47:2; 93:1; 97:1; 98:6; 99:1; Rev. 19:6].” The earth is ·set [established], and it cannot be moved. He will judge the people fairly.

11.verse: Let the ·skies [heavens] rejoice and the earth be glad; let the sea and everything in it ·shout [thunder; roar].

12.verse: Let the fields and everything in them rejoice. Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy

13.verse: before the LORD, because he is coming. He is coming to judge the world; he will judge the world with ·fairness [righteousness] and the peoples with ·truth [faithfulness; 98:9].

1.verse: A Hymn About the Lord’s Power - The LORD ·is king [reigns; 47:2; 93:1; 96:10; 98:6; 99:1; Rev. 19:6]. Let the earth rejoice; ·faraway lands [or islands; or coastlands] should be glad.

2.verse: Thick, dark clouds surround him. His ·kingdom [throne] is ·built [established] on ·what is right [righteousness] and ·fair [justice].

3.verse: A fire goes before him and ·burns up [flames] his enemies all around.

4.verse: His lightning ·lights up [illuminates] the world; when the ·people [earth] see it, they ·tremble [writhe].

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, before the Lord of all the earth.

6.verse: The heavens ·tell about [declare] his ·goodness [righteousness], and all the people see his glory [his manifest presence].

7.verse: Those who ·worship [serve] idols should be ·ashamed [embarrassed; Is. 42:17; 45:16]; they brag about their ·gods [worthless things]. All the gods should ·worship [bow down to] the LORD.

8.verse: When ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple] hears this, she is glad, and the ·towns [daughters] of Judah rejoice. They are happy because of your judgments, LORD.

9.verse: You are the LORD Most High over all the earth; you are ·supreme [exalted] over all gods.

10.verse: People who love the LORD hate evil. The LORD ·watches over [keeps; guards] ·those who follow him [his loyal ones/saints] and ·frees [rescues] them from the ·power [hand] of the wicked.

11.verse: Light ·shines [is sown] on ·those who do right [the righteous]; joy belongs to those who are ·honest [virtuous/upright in heart].

12.verse: Rejoice in the LORD, you who ·do right [are righteous]. Praise his ·holy name [or unforgettable holiness].

1.verse: The Lord of Power and Justice - A psalm. Sing to the LORD a new song [celebrating victory; 33:3; 40:3; 96:1; 144:9; 149:1; Is. 42:10; Rev. 5:9; 14:3], because he has done ·miracles [wonderful acts]. By his right hand and holy arm he has won the victory.

2.verse: The LORD has made known his ·power to save [salvation; victory]; he has ·shown [revealed to] ·the other [before the eyes of the] nations his ·victory for his people [righteousness].

3.verse: He has remembered his ·love [loyalty] and his ·loyalty [faithfulness] to the ·people [house] of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen God’s ·power to save [salvation; victory].

4.verse: Shout with joy to the LORD, all the earth; ·burst into songs [break forth and sing for joy] and make ·music [a psalm].

5.verse: Make music to the LORD with harps, with harps and the sound of singing.

6.verse: Blow the trumpets and the ·sheep’s [ram’s] horns; shout for joy to the LORD the King [47:2; 93:1; 96:10; 97:1; 99:1; Rev. 19:6].

7.verse: Let the sea and ·everything in it [its fullness] ·shout [thunder]; let the world and everyone in it sing.

8.verse: Let the rivers clap their hands; let the mountains sing together for joy.

9.verse: Let them sing before the LORD, because he is coming to judge the world. He will judge the world ·fairly [with righteousness]; he will judge the peoples with fairness [96:13].

1.verse: The Lord, the Fair and Holy King - The LORD ·is king [reigns; 47:2; 93:1; 96:10; 97:1; 98:6; Rev. 19:6]. Let the peoples ·shake [tremble; with fear]. He sits between the ·gold creatures with wings [cherubim; above the Ark of the Covenant; Ex. 25:17–22; 1 Kin. 8:7]. Let the earth shake.

2.verse: The LORD in ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple] is great; he is ·supreme [exalted] over all the peoples.

3.verse: Let them ·praise [thank] your name; it is great, holy and ·to be feared [awesome].

4.verse: The King is ·powerful [strong] and loves justice. LORD, you ·made [established] things fair; you have done what is ·fair [righteous] and ·right [just] for the people of Jacob [another name for Israel].

5.verse: ·Praise [Exalt] the LORD our God, and ·worship [bow down] at the footstool of his feet [the Ark located in the Temple]. He is holy.

6.verse: Moses and Aaron were among his priests, and Samuel was among ·his worshipers [those who called on his name]. They called to the LORD, and he answered them [Ex. 32:11–13, 30–32; Num. 12:13; 14:13–19; 1 Sam. 7:5, 8–9; 12:16–18; Jer. 15:1].

7.verse: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud [Ex. 13:21]. They ·kept [observed; guarded] the ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·laws [decrees; testimonies] he gave them.

8.verse: LORD our God, you answered them. You showed them that you are a forgiving God, but you ·punished them [are an avenger] for their wrongs [Deut. 32:35; Is. 34:8; Ezek. 24:8; 25:14–17; Nah. 1:2; Rom. 12:19; 1 Thess. 4:6].

9.verse: ·Praise [Exalt] the LORD our God, and ·worship [bow down] at his holy mountain, because the LORD our God is holy.

1.verse: A Call to Praise the Lord - A psalm of thanks. Shout to the LORD, all the earth.

2.verse: Serve the LORD with joy; come before him with singing.

3.verse: Know that the LORD is God. He made us [Gen. 1–2], and ·we belong to him [or not ourselves]; we are his people, the sheep ·he tends [of his pasture; 74:1; 79:13; John 10:11–14].

4.verse: Come into his ·city [gates] with songs of thanksgiving and into his courtyards with songs of praise. ·Thank [Praise] him and ·praise [bless] his name.

5.verse: The LORD is good. His ·love [loyalty] is forever, and his ·loyalty [faithfulness] ·goes on and on [for all generations].

1.verse: A Promise to Rule Well - A psalm of David. I will sing of your ·love [loyalty] and ·fairness [justice; judgment]; LORD, I will ·sing praises [make a psalm] to you.

2.verse: I will ·be careful to live [lead; or study] ·an innocent life [the way that is blameless]. When will ·you [or it; the “way that is blameless”] come to me? I will ·live [go; walk] ·an innocent life [in the blamelessness of my heart] in my house.
