3.verse: I will not ·look at [set before my eyes] anything ·wicked [vile]. I hate those who ·turn against you [are crooked/transgressors]; they will not ·be found near [cling to] me.

4.verse: Let those who ·want to do wrong [have a perverse heart] stay away from me; I ·will have nothing to do with [do not know] evil.

5.verse: If anyone secretly ·says things against [slanders] his neighbor, I will ·stop [destroy; silence] him. I will not allow people to ·be proud [have broad hearts] and ·look down on others [haughty eyes; 131:1].

6.verse: ·I will look for trustworthy people [My eyes are on the faithful of the land] so ·I can live with them [they may dwell with me]. Only those who ·live innocent lives [walk in the way of blamelessness] will ·be my servants [serve me].

7.verse: No one who ·is dishonest [deceives] will live in my house; no ·liars [one who speaks falsehoods] will ·stay around me [be established before my eyes].

8.verse: Every morning I will ·destroy [silence] all the wicked in the land. I will ·rid [cut off] the LORD’s city [Jerusalem; 46:4] of people who do evil.

1.verse: A Cry for Help - A prayer of a person who is suffering when he is ·discouraged [faint; disturbed] and ·tells the LORD his complaints [pours out his concerns before the LORD]. LORD, listen to my prayer; let my cry for help come to you.

2.verse: Do not hide your ·presence [face] from me in my time of ·trouble [distress]. ·Pay attention [Extend your ear] to me. ·When I cry for help [On the day I call], answer me quickly.

3.verse: My ·life [days] is ·passing away [vanishing] like smoke, and my bones are burned up ·with fire [like a furnace/oven/or glowing embers].

4.verse: My heart is like grass that has been ·cut [stricken] and dried. I forget to eat my ·food [or bread].

5.verse: Because of ·my grief [the sounds of my groans], my ·skin hangs on my bones [bones cling to my flesh].

6.verse: I am like a ·desert [wilderness] owl, like an owl living among the ·ruins [wastelands; Is. 34:10–15; Zeph. 2:13–15].

7.verse: I ·lie awake [or keep watch]. I am like a lonely bird on a ·housetop [roof].

8.verse: All day long enemies ·insult [scorn; reproach] me; those who ·make fun of [mock] me use my name as a curse.

9.verse: I eat ashes for ·food [or bread], and my tears ·fall into [mingle with] my drinks.

10.verse: Because of your ·great anger [wrath and indignation], you have picked me up and thrown me away.

11.verse: My days are like a passing shadow; I am like dried grass.

12.verse: But, LORD, you ·rule [are enthroned] forever, and your ·fame [memory] ·goes on and on [throughout the generations].

13.verse: You will ·come [rise up] and have ·mercy [compassion] on ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple], because the time has now come to be ·kind [gracious] to her; the ·right [appointed] time has come.

14.verse: Your servants ·love even [are pleased/delighted with] her stones; they even ·care about [have pity/compassion for] her dust.

15.verse: Nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings on earth ·will honor you [your glory; God’s manifest presence].

16.verse: The LORD will rebuild ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple]; there his glory [manifest presence] will be seen.

17.verse: He will answer the prayers of the ·needy [lowly; naked]; he will not ·reject [despise] their prayers.

18.verse: Write these things for ·the future [a future generation] so that people who are not yet ·born [created] will praise the LORD.

19.verse: The LORD looked down from his holy place above; from heaven he ·looked [gazed] down at the earth.

20.verse: He heard the ·moans [groans] of the prisoners, and he ·freed [released] those sentenced to die.

21.verse: The name of the LORD will be ·heard [recounted] in ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple]; his praise ·will be heard there [in Jerusalem].

22.verse: People will ·come [gather] together, and kingdoms will serve the LORD.

23.verse: ·God has made me tired of living [He broke my strength in midcourse/the way]; he has cut short my ·life [days].

24.verse: So I said, “My God, do not take me in the middle of my ·life [days]. Your years ·go on and on [endure for generations].

25.verse: In the beginning you ·made [founded] the earth, and ·your hands made the skies [the heavens are the work of your hands; Gen. 1].

26.verse: They will be destroyed, but you will ·remain [endure]. They will all wear out like ·clothes [garments]. And, like clothes, you will change them and throw them away.

27.verse: But you ·never change [are the same/he], and your ·life [years] will never end.

28.verse: ·Our children [The children of your servants] will live in your presence, and their ·children [offspring; seed] will remain with you.”

1.verse: Praise to the Lord of Love - Of David. ·All that I am [O my soul], ·praise [bless] the LORD; ·everything in me [all my inward parts], ·praise [bless] his holy name.

2.verse: ·My whole being [O my soul], ·praise [bless] the LORD and do not forget all his ·kindnesses [gifts; benefits].

3.verse: He forgives all ·my [or your] ·sins [iniquity] and heals all ·my [or your] ·diseases [ills].

4.verse: He ·saves [redeems] ·my [or your] life from the ·grave [pit] and ·loads [or crowns] ·me [or you] with ·love [loyalty] and ·mercy [compassion].

5.verse: He satisfies ·me [or you] with good things [as long as you live; or according to your desires] and ·makes me young again [renews your youth], like the eagle [Is. 40:31].

6.verse: The LORD does what is ·right [righteous] and ·fair [just] for all who are ·wronged by others [oppressed; exploited].

7.verse: He ·showed [revealed] his ways to Moses [Ex. 34:5–7] and his deeds to the ·people [sons] of Israel.

8.verse: The LORD shows ·mercy [compassion] and ·is kind [grace]. He ·does not become angry quickly [is slow to anger], and he has great ·love [loyalty; 86:15; 145:8–9; Ex. 34:6–7; Neh. 9:17. 31; Joel 2:13; Jon. 4:2].

9.verse: He will not always ·accuse [charge; contend with] us, and he will not ·be angry forever [keep watch forever].

10.verse: He ·has not punished us as our sins should be punished [does not act toward us according to our sins]; he has not repaid us ·for the evil we have done [according to our iniquity].

11.verse: As high as the ·sky [heaven] is above the earth, so great is his ·love [loyalty] for those who ·respect [fear] him [Prov. 1:7].

12.verse: He has taken our ·sins [transgressions] away from us as far as the east is from west.

13.verse: The LORD has ·mercy [compassion] on those who ·respect [fear] him [Prov. 1:7], as a father has ·mercy [compassion] on his children.

14.verse: He knows how we were ·made [formed]; he remembers that we are dust [Gen. 2:7; 3:19; Job 4:19; 10:9; 34:15; Eccl. 3:20; 12:7].

15.verse: Human ·life [days] is like grass [90:5–6; Is. 51:12]; we ·grow [sprout; flourish] like a flower in the field [Job 14:2; Is. 40:6–7].

16.verse: After the wind ·blows [passes by], ·the flower [it] is gone, and ·there is no sign of where it was [no one can recognize its place].

17.verse: But the LORD’s ·love [loyalty] for those who ·respect [fear] him [Prov. 1:7] continues forever and ever, and his ·goodness [righteousness] continues to their ·grandchildren [children’s children]

18.verse: and to those who ·keep [observe; guard] his ·agreement [covenant; treaty; Ex. 19–24] and who remember to ·obey [do] his ·orders [precepts].

19.verse: The LORD has ·set [established] his throne in heaven, and his kingdom rules over everything [93:1; 96:10; 99:1].

20.verse: You who are his ·angels [or messengers], ·praise [bless] the LORD. You are the mighty warriors who do what he says and who ·obey [listen to] his voice.

21.verse: You, his ·armies [hosts; perhaps the angelic army], ·praise [bless] the LORD; you are his ·servants [ministers] who do what he ·wants [desires].

22.verse: Everything the LORD has made should ·praise [bless] him in all the places he rules. ·My whole being [O my soul], ·praise [bless] the LORD.

1.verse: Praise to God Who Made the World - ·My whole being [O my soul], ·praise [bless] the LORD. LORD my God, you are very great. You are clothed with ·glory [splendor] and ·majesty [beauty];

2.verse: you ·wear [wrap yourself in] light like a robe [Hab. 3:4; 1 John 1:5]. You stretch out the ·skies [heavens] like a tent [Is. 40:22].

3.verse: You ·build your room above the clouds [set the beams of your upper room on the waters]. You make the clouds your chariot [18:10–19; 68:4; Is. 19:1; Dan. 7:13–14; Luke 21:27; Rev. 1:7], and you ride on the wings of the wind.

4.verse: You make the winds your messengers, and flames of fire are your ·servants [ministers; Heb. 1:7].

5.verse: You ·built [founded] the earth on its foundations so it can never be moved.

6.verse: You covered the earth with ·oceans [the deeps]; the water ·was above [stood over] the mountains.

7.verse: But at your ·command [reprimand; rebuke], the water ·rushed away [fled]. ·When you thundered your orders [At the sound of your thunder], it hurried away.

8.verse: The mountains rose; the valleys sank. The water went to the places you ·made [founded] for it.

9.verse: You set borders for the seas that they cannot ·cross [pass], so water will never cover the earth again [as before the third day creation or during the Flood; Gen. 1:9–10; 9:9–17; Job 38:8–11; Prov. 8:29].

10.verse: You make springs pour into the ·ravines [wadis]; they flow between the mountains.

11.verse: They water all the ·wild animals [creatures of the field]; the wild donkeys ·come there to drink [quench their thirst].

12.verse: ·Wild birds [Birds of the sky/heavens] ·make nests by the water [dwell by them]; they ·sing [give voice] among the tree branches.

13.verse: You water the mountains from ·above [your high dwelling]. The earth is ·full of [or satisfied by] ·the things you made [the fruit of your works].

14.verse: You make the grass grow for cattle and ·vegetables [plants] for the people to ·use [cultivate]. You make ·food [or bread] ·grow [come out] from the earth.

15.verse: You give us wine that ·makes happy hearts [rejoices the hearts of people; John 2:1–12] and olive oil that makes our faces shine [soothing skin in a dry climate; Luke 7:46]. You give us bread that gives us ·strength [sustenance].

16.verse: The LORD’s trees ·have plenty of water [flourish]; they are the cedars of Lebanon [the most majestic trees known], which he planted.

17.verse: The birds make their nests there; the stork’s home is in the fir trees.

18.verse: The high mountains belong to the wild goats. The rocks are ·hiding places [refuge] for the badgers.

19.verse: You made the moon ·to mark the seasons [for appointed times; Gen. 1:14; Lev. 23:2, 4, 37, 44], and the sun always knows when to set.

20.verse: You make it dark, and it becomes night. Then all the ·wild animals [creatures of the forest] ·creep [swarm] around.

21.verse: The lions roar ·as they attack [for prey]. They ·look to [seek] God for food.

22.verse: When the sun rises, they leave and go back to their dens to lie down.

23.verse: Then people go to work and ·work [labor] until evening.

24.verse: LORD, ·you have made many things; with your wisdom you made them all [Prov. 8:22–31]. The earth is full of your ·riches [or creatures].

25.verse: Look at the sea, so big and wide, with creatures large and small, ·creeping [swarming] things that cannot be counted.

26.verse: Ships travel over the ocean, and there is Leviathan [a sea monster and symbol of chaos; 74:14; Job 3:8; 41:1; Is. 27:1], which you made to play there.

27.verse: All these things ·depend [hope; wait] on you to give them their food at the right time.

28.verse: When you give it to them, they gather it up. When you open your hand, they are ·filled [satisfied] with good food.

29.verse: When you ·turn away [hide your face] from them, they ·become frightened [are terrified]. When you take away their breath, they ·die [expire] and turn to dust [Gen. 2:7; Eccl. 12:7].

30.verse: When you ·breathe [send your breath/or Spirit] on them, they are created [Gen. 2:7], and you make the land new again.

31.verse: May the glory of the LORD [his manifest presence] be forever. May the LORD ·enjoy [rejoice in] what he has made.

32.verse: He just looks at the earth, and it ·shakes [trembles]. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.

33.verse: I will sing to the LORD all my life; I will ·sing praises [make a psalm] to my God as long as I live.

34.verse: May my ·thoughts [meditations] please him; I ·am happy [will rejoice] in the LORD.

35.verse: Let sinners be ·destroyed [obliterated] from the earth, and let the wicked live no longer. ·My whole being [O my soul], ·praise [bless] the LORD. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: God’s Love for Israel - Give thanks to the LORD and ·pray to him [call on his name]. ·Tell [Make known among] the nations what he has done.

2.verse: Sing to him; ·sing praises [make a psalm] to him. Tell about all his ·miracles [wonderful acts].

3.verse: ·Be glad that you are his [Exult/Glory in his holy name]; let ·those [the heart of those] who seek the LORD ·be happy [rejoice].

4.verse: ·Depend on [Seek] the LORD and his strength; always ·go to him for help [seek his face].

5.verse: Remember the ·miracles [wonderful acts] he has done; remember his ·wonders [signs] and ·his decisions [the judgments of his mouth].

6.verse: You are ·descendants [seed] of his servant Abraham [Gen. 12:1–3], the children of Jacob, his chosen people.

7.verse: He is the LORD our God. His ·laws [justice; judgments] are for all the world.

8.verse: He will ·keep [remember] his ·agreement [covenant; treaty] forever; ·he will keep his promises always [the word which he commanded, for a thousand generations].

9.verse: He will keep the ·agreement [covenant; treaty] he ·made [cut] with Abraham [Gen. 12:1–3; 17:23] and the ·promise [oath] he made to Isaac [Gen. 26:3–5].

10.verse: He made it a ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] for the people of Jacob; he made it an ·agreement [covenant; agreement] with Israel to last forever.

11.verse: The LORD said, “I will give you the land of Canaan [Gen. 15:18], ·and it will belong to you [as a portion of your inheritance].”

12.verse: Then ·God’s people [they] were few in number. They were ·strangers [sojourners; wanderers; resident aliens] in the land.

13.verse: They went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another.

14.verse: But the LORD did not let anyone ·hurt [exploit; oppress] them; he warned kings ·not to harm them [concerning them].

15.verse: He said, “Don’t touch my ·chosen [anointed] people, and don’t harm my prophets.”

16.verse: ·God [He] ·ordered [proclaimed] a ·time of hunger [famine] in the land, and he ·destroyed all the food [broke every staff of bread; Gen. 41:54].

17.verse: Then he sent a man ahead of them— Joseph, who was sold as a slave [Gen. 37; 45:5; 50:20].

18.verse: They ·put chains around his feet [afflicted his feet with chain] and an iron ·ring [collar] around his neck.

19.verse: ·Then the time he had spoken of came, and the LORD’s words proved that Joseph was right [or Until the time he had spoken of came, the words of the LORD kept testing him].

20.verse: The king [of Egypt] sent for Joseph and ·freed [released] him; the ruler of the people set him free [Gen. 41:14, 40].

21.verse: He made him the ·master [lord] of his house; Joseph was in charge of his riches [Acts 7:10].

22.verse: He could ·order [bind] the princes as he wished. He taught the older men to be wise.

23.verse: Then Israel [another name for Jacob, Joseph’s father] came to Egypt; Jacob lived in the land of Ham [Egypt; Gen. 46:1–7].

24.verse: The LORD made his people ·grow in number [fruitful; Ex. 1:7], and he ·made them stronger than [strengthened them against] their ·enemies [foes].

25.verse: He ·caused the Egyptians [turned their hearts] to hate his people and to ·make plans [act deceptively] against his servants [Ex. 1:8].

26.verse: Then he sent his servant Moses, and Aaron, whom he had chosen [Ex. 3:1—4:17].

27.verse: They did many signs among the Egyptians and worked ·wonders [miracles; the plagues; Ex. 7–12] in the land of Ham [Egypt; Gen. 46:1–7].

28.verse: The LORD sent darkness and made the land dark, but the Egyptians ·turned against what he said [rebelled against his word; Ex. 10:21–29].

29.verse: He changed their water into blood and made their fish die [Ex. 7:14–25].

30.verse: Then their country ·was filled [swarmed] with frogs, even in the bedrooms of their ·rulers [kings; Ex. 8:1–17].

31.verse: The LORD spoke and flies came [Ex. 8:20–32], and gnats were everywhere in the country [Ex. 8:16–19].

32.verse: He made hail fall like rain and sent lightning through their land.

33.verse: He struck down their grapevines and fig trees, and he ·destroyed [shattered] every tree in the country [Ex. 9:13–35].

34.verse: He spoke and ·grasshoppers [locusts] came; the ·locusts [young locusts] ·were too many to count [without number].

35.verse: They ate all the ·plants [vegetation] in the land and ·everything the earth produced [the fruit of the ground; Ex. 10:1–20].

36.verse: ·The LORD [He] also ·killed [struck] all the firstborn sons in the land, the oldest son of each family [the first of their virility; Ex. 11:1—12:30].

37.verse: Then he brought them out with silver and gold [Ex. 12:35–36]. ·Not one of his people stumbled [There was no stumbling among the tribe].

38.verse: The Egyptians ·were glad [rejoiced] when they left, because ·the Egyptians were afraid of them [dread of them fell on them; because of the plagues].

39.verse: ·The LORD covered them with a cloud [He spread out a cloud as a covering] and ·lit up the night with fire [a fire to illuminate the night; Ex. 13:21–22].

40.verse: When they asked, he brought them quail and filled them with bread from heaven [Ex. 16].

41.verse: God ·split [opened] the rock, and water flowed out; it ran like a river through the ·desert [wasteland; Ex. 17:1–7].

42.verse: He remembered his holy ·promise [word] to his servant Abraham [Gen. 12:1–3].

43.verse: So God brought his people out with joy, his chosen ones with singing.

44.verse: He gave them lands of other nations, so they received ·what others had worked for [the labors of peoples].

45.verse: This was so they would ·keep [observe; guard] his ·orders [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·obey [protect] his ·teachings [instructions; laws]. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Israel’s Failure to Trust God - Praise the LORD! Thank the LORD because he is good. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

2.verse: ·No one [Who…?] can tell all the mighty things the LORD has done; ·no one [who…?] can ·speak [declare] all his praise.

3.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are those who ·do [keep; observe; guard] ·right [justice], who do what is ·fair [righteous] at all times.

4.verse: LORD, remember me when you ·are kind [show favor] to your people; ·help [come to] me when you ·save them [give them victory].

5.verse: Let me see the ·good things you do for [prosperity of] your chosen people. Let me ·be happy [rejoice] along with your ·happy [rejoicing] nation; let me join your ·own people [inheritance] in praising you.

6.verse: We have sinned just as our ·ancestors [fathers] did. We have done wrong; we have done evil.

7.verse: Our ·ancestors [fathers] in Egypt did not ·learn [grow in wisdom] from your ·miracles [wonderful acts]. They did not remember all your ·kindnesses [loyalty], so they ·turned [rebelled] against you at the ·Red [or Reed] Sea [78:13; Ex. 14–15].

8.verse: But the LORD ·saved them [gave them victory] ·for his own sake [because of his name], to ·show [reveal] his great power.

9.verse: He ·commanded [reprimanded; rebuked] the ·Red [or Reed] Sea [v. 7], and it dried up. He led them through the deep sea as if it were a ·desert [wilderness].

10.verse: He ·saved them [gave them victory over] from those who hated them. He ·saved [redeemed] them from the ·power [hand] of their enemies,

11.verse: and the water covered their foes. Not one of them ·escaped [was left].

12.verse: Then the people ·believed what the LORD said [had faith in his word], and they sang praises to him.

13.verse: But they quickly forgot what he had done; they did not wait for his ·advice [counsel].

14.verse: They ·became greedy for food [developed deep cravings] in the ·desert [wilderness; Num. 11], and they tested God ·there [in desolate places; Ex. 17:7].

15.verse: So he gave them what they ·wanted [asked for], but he also sent ·a terrible disease [a wasting sickness; emaciation] among them [Num. 11:33–35].

16.verse: The people in the camp were jealous of Moses and of Aaron, the holy ·priest [one] of the LORD.

17.verse: Then the ground opened up and swallowed Dathan and closed over Abiram’s ·group [assembly].

18.verse: A fire burned among their ·followers [congregation], and flames burned up the wicked [Num. 16].

19.verse: The people made a gold calf at ·Mount Sinai [Horeb; another name for Sinai] and ·worshiped [bowed down to] a metal statue [Ex. 32; Deut. 9:7–17].

20.verse: They exchanged their ·glorious God [glory; God’s manifest presence] for ·a statue [the image] of a bull that eats grass.

21.verse: They forgot the God who ·saved them [had given them victory], who had done great things in Egypt,

22.verse: who had done miracles in the land of Ham [Egypt] and amazing things by the ·Red [or Reed] Sea [v. 7].

23.verse: So God said he would destroy them. But Moses, his chosen one, stood ·before him [in the breech before him] and ·stopped God’s anger from destroying them [calmed his destructive wrath; Ex. 32:30—33:23; Deut. 9:18–21].

24.verse: Then they refused to go into the ·beautiful land of Canaan [desired/coveted land]; they did not ·believe what God promised [trust his word; Num. 14:1–12].

25.verse: They ·grumbled [complained] in their tents [Deut. 1:27; 1 Cor. 10:10] and did not ·obey [listen to] the LORD.

26.verse: So he ·swore [lifted his hand; an oath-taking gesture] to them that ·they would die [he would make them fall] in the ·desert [wilderness].

27.verse: He ·said their children would be killed by [would make their seed fall to] other nations and that they would be scattered among other countries [as happened in the exile; Num. 14:27–35].

28.verse: They ·joined in worshiping [yoked themselves to] Baal at Peor and ate ·meat that had been sacrificed to lifeless statues [sacrifices to the dead; Num. 25].

29.verse: They ·made the LORD angry [provoked him] by what they did, so ·many people became sick with a terrible disease [plague broke out among them].

30.verse: But Phinehas ·prayed to the LORD [stood and prayed], and the ·disease [plague] ·stopped [was restrained; Num. 25:6–9].

31.verse: ·Phinehas did what was right [It was counted/credited to him as righteousness], ·and it will be remembered from now on [throughout the generations, forever; Num. 25:10–13; Mal. 2:4–6].

32.verse: The people also made the LORD angry at Meribah [81:7; 95:8], and Moses was in trouble because of them.

33.verse: The people ·turned [rebelled] against ·the Spirit of God [his Spirit/spirit], so Moses ·spoke without stopping to think [chattered with his lips; Num. 20:10–11].

34.verse: The people did not destroy the other nations as the LORD had told them to do [Deut. 7:16; 20:17–18].

35.verse: Instead, they mixed with the other nations and learned their ·customs [deeds; Judg. 3:5–6].

36.verse: They ·worshiped [served] other nations’ idols [Judg. 2:19] and were ·trapped by them [a snare to them].

37.verse: They even killed their sons and daughters as sacrifices to demons [Lev. 18:21; Deut. 12:31; 2 Kin. 16:1; 21:6; 23:10; Jer. 7:31; Ezek. 16:20–21; 20:31; 1 Cor. 10:20].

38.verse: They ·killed [spilled the blood of] innocent people, their own sons and daughters, as sacrifices to the idols of Canaan [Jer. 19:4]. So the land was ·made unholy [polluted] by their blood.

39.verse: The people became ·unholy [unclean; ritually] by their ·sins [acts]; they ·were unfaithful to God in [prostituted themselves by] what they did.

40.verse: So the LORD became angry with his people and ·hated [was disgusted with] his own ·children [inheritance].

41.verse: He ·handed them over to [gave them over to the hand/power of] other nations and let ·their enemies [those who hated them] ·rule over [dominate] them.

42.verse: Their enemies ·were cruel to [oppressed] them and ·kept them [they were brought into subjection] under their ·power [hand].

43.verse: The LORD ·saved [rescued] his people many times, but they continued to ·turn [rebel] against him. So they ·became even more wicked [were brought low by their iniquity].

44.verse: But God saw their ·misery [distress] when he heard their cry.

45.verse: He remembered his ·agreement [treaty; covenant] with them, and he felt ·sorry [compassion] for them because of his great ·love [loyalty].

46.verse: He caused them to be ·pitied [shown mercy/compassion] by those who held them captive.

47.verse: LORD our God, ·save us [give us victory] and ·bring us back [gather us] from other nations [perhaps from the exile]. Then we will ·thank [praise] ·you [your holy name] and will ·gladly praise you [glory in your praise].

48.verse: ·Praise [Bless] the LORD, the God of Israel. He ·always was and always will be [is from everlasting to everlasting]. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Book 5: Psalms 107–150 God Saves from Many Dangers - Thank the LORD because he is good. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

2.verse: That is what those whom the LORD has ·saved [redeemed] should say. He has ·saved [redeemed] them from the ·enemy [foe]

3.verse: and has gathered them from other lands, from east and west, north and south [Is. 51:11; perhaps after the Babylonian exile].

4.verse: Some people had wandered in the ·desert lands [wilderness, wasteland]. They found no way to a city in which to live.

5.verse: They were hungry and thirsty, and they were ·discouraged [faint].

6.verse: In their ·misery [distress] they cried out to the LORD, and he ·saved [rescued; protected] them from their troubles [vv. 13, 19, 28].

7.verse: He led them on a straight road to a city where they could live.

8.verse: Let them ·give thanks to [praise] the LORD for his ·love [loyalty] and for the ·miracles [wonderful works] he does for people [vv. 15, 21, 31].

9.verse: He satisfies the thirsty and fills ·up [with good things] the hungry [Is. 58:10–11; Jer. 31:25; Luke 1:53].

10.verse: Some sat in ·gloom [darkness] and ·darkness [deep darkness]; they were prisoners ·suffering [afflicted] in ·chains [irons].

11.verse: They had ·turned [rebelled] against the words of God and had ·refused [rejected] the advice of God Most High.

12.verse: So he ·broke their pride by [made their hearts cower with] hard work. They stumbled, and no one helped.

13.verse: In their ·misery [distress] they cried out to the LORD, and he ·saved them from [gave them victory over] their troubles [vv. 6, 19, 28].

14.verse: He brought them out of their ·gloom [darkness] and ·darkness [deep darkness] and ·broke [burst] their chains.

15.verse: Let them ·give thanks to [praise] the LORD for his ·love [loyalty] and for the ·miracles [wonderful works] he does for people [vv. 8, 21, 31].

16.verse: He ·breaks down [shatters] bronze gates and cuts apart iron bars.

17.verse: Some ·fools turned against God [became fools in the way of transgression] and ·suffered [were afflicted] ·for the evil they did [because of their guilt].

18.verse: ·They refused to eat anything [Their appetite loathed any food], so they ·almost died [approached the gates of death].

19.verse: In their ·misery [distress] they cried out to the LORD, and he ·saved them [gave them victory] from their troubles [vv. 6, 13, 28].

20.verse: God ·gave the command [sent forth his word] and healed them, so they were ·saved [rescued] from ·dying [destruction; or their pits].

21.verse: Let them ·give thanks to [praise] the LORD for his ·love [loyalty] and for the ·miracles [wonderful works] he does for people [vv. 8, 15, 31].

22.verse: Let them offer ·sacrifices to thank him [thanksgiving offerings]. With joy they should ·tell [recount] what he has done.

23.verse: Others went out to sea in ships and did ·business [work] on the ·great oceans [many waters].

24.verse: They saw what the LORD could do, the ·miracles [worderful works] he did in the deep oceans.

25.verse: He spoke, and a ·storm [stormy wind] ·came [stood] up, which ·blew [raised] up high waves.

26.verse: ·The ships [They] ·were tossed as high as [went up to] the ·sky [heavens] and fell low to the depths. ·The storm was so bad that they lost their courage [Their life/soul melted in evil/trouble].

27.verse: They ·stumbled [reeled; leapt] and ·fell [tottered; staggered] like people who were drunk. ·They did not know what to do [All their wisdom was confused].

28.verse: In their ·misery [distress] they cried out to the LORD, and he ·saved [brought them out] them from their troubles [vv. 6, 13, 19].

29.verse: He ·stilled [quieted] the storm and ·calmed [hushed] the waves.

30.verse: They were happy that it was quiet, and God guided them to the ·port [harbor] they wanted.

31.verse: Let them ·give thanks to [praise] the LORD for his ·love [loyalty] and for the ·miracles [wonderful works] he does for people [vv. 8, 15, 21].

32.verse: Let them ·praise his greatness [exalt him] in the ·meeting [assembly] of the people; let them praise him in the meeting of the elders.

33.verse: He ·changed [turned; set] rivers into a ·desert [wilderness] and springs of water into ·dry [parched; thirsty] ground.

34.verse: He made ·fertile [fruitful] land salty because the people there did evil [Gen. 19].

35.verse: He ·changed [turned; set] the ·desert [wilderness] into pools of water and ·dry [parched] ground into springs of water.

36.verse: He had the hungry settle there so they could ·build [establish] a city in which to live.

37.verse: They ·planted seeds in the fields and vineyards [sowed fields and planted vineyards], and they had a ·good harvest [fruitful crop].

38.verse: God blessed them, and they ·grew in number [multiplied greatly]. Their cattle did not ·become fewer [diminish].

39.verse: Because of ·disaster [oppression], ·troubles [evil], and sadness, ·their families [they] ·grew smaller [diminished] and ·weaker [were brought low].

40.verse: He ·showed he was displeased with [poured contempt on] their ·leaders [princes] and made them wander in a pathless ·desert [waste].

41.verse: But he lifted the ·poor [needy] out of their suffering and ·made their families grow [set their clans] like flocks of sheep.

42.verse: ·Good people [The upright/virtuous] see this and are happy, but the wicked ·say nothing [shuts their mouths].

43.verse: Whoever is wise will ·remember [keep; guard] these things and will ·think about [consider] the ·love [loyalty] of the LORD.

1.verse: A Prayer for Victory - A song. A psalm of David. God, my heart is ·steady [steadfast; ready]. I will sing and ·praise [play a psalm for] you ·with all my being [as will my soul/or glory].

2.verse: Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn.

3.verse: LORD, I will ·praise [thank] you among the ·nations [peoples]; I will sing ·songs of praise [psalms] about you to all the nations.

4.verse: Your great ·love [loyalty] ·reaches to [is greater than] the ·skies [heavens], your ·truth [faithfulness] to the heavens.

5.verse: God, you are ·supreme [exalted] above the ·skies [heavens]. Let your glory [manifest presence] be over all the earth [57:5–11].

6.verse: Answer us and ·save us [give us victory] by your ·power [right hand] so ·the people you love [your beloved] will be rescued.

7.verse: God has said ·from his Temple [from his Holy Place; or in his holiness], “·When I win [or With joy], I will ·divide [parcel up] Shechem and measure off the Valley of Succoth [Gen. 33:17–20].

8.verse: Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is like my helmet. Judah holds my royal scepter [Gen. 49:10; they are agents of God’s power].

9.verse: Moab is like my washbowl. I throw my sandals at Edom [showing contempt]. I shout [in triumph] at Philistia [enemies of Israel].”

10.verse: Who will bring me to the ·strong, walled [fortified] city? Who will lead me to Edom?

11.verse: God, ·surely you have rejected [have you not rejected…?] us; you do not go out with our armies.

12.verse: ·Help us fight the enemy [Give us help against the foe]. Human ·help [aid] is useless,

13.verse: but we can ·win [fight bravely] with God’s help. He will ·defeat [tread on] our ·enemies [foes; 60:5–12].

1.verse: A Prayer Against an Enemy - For the director of music. A psalm of David. God, I praise you. Do not be silent.

2.verse: ·Wicked [The mouth of evil] people and ·liars [the mouth of deceivers] have ·spoken [opened] against me; they ·have told lies about me [speak against me with lying tongues].

3.verse: They have ·said hateful things about me [surrounded me with hateful words] and attack me for no reason.

4.verse: They ·attacked [accuse; charge] me, ·even though I loved them and prayed for them [in return for my love and prayer].

5.verse: I was good to them, but they ·repay [reward] me with evil. I loved them, but they hate me in return.

6.verse: They say about me [this added phrase suggests another speaker, or perhaps the psalmist is speaking about his accusers], “·Have an evil person work [Appoint an evil person] against him, and let an ·accuser [adversary] stand ·against him [at his right hand; Job 1:6].

7.verse: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, and let even his prayers ·show [be counted as] his ·guilt [sin].

8.verse: Let his ·life [days] be ·cut short [brief], and let another man ·replace him as leader [take his position/office; Acts 1:20].

9.verse: Let his children become orphans and his wife a widow [socially vulnerable, dependent on others].

10.verse: Make his children wander around, begging for food [Jer. 18:21]. Let them be forced out of the ruins in which they live.

11.verse: Let ·the people to whom he owes money [creditors] ·take [ensnare] everything he owns [2 Kin. 4:1], and let strangers ·steal [plunder] everything he has worked for.

12.verse: Let no one ·show [extend to] him ·love [loyalty] or have ·mercy [compassion] on his orphaned children.

13.verse: Let all his descendants ·die [be cut off] and ·be forgotten [their name be blotted/wiped out] by ·those who live after him [a later generation].

14.verse: LORD, ·remember how wicked his ancestors were [let the guilt of his fathers be remembered], and don’t let the sins of his mother be ·wiped [blotted] out.

15.verse: ·LORD, always remember their sins [Let them be before the LORD forever]. ·Then make people forget about them completely [Let memory of them be cut off from the land].

16.verse: “He did not remember to be ·loving [loyal]. He ·hurt [persecuted; pursued] the poor, the needy, and those who were ·sad [depressed; brokenhearted] ·until they were nearly dead [to their death].

17.verse: He loved to put curses on others, so let those same curses ·fall on [come to] him. He did not like to bless others, so ·do not let good things happen to him [let them (blessings) be far from him].

18.verse: He ·cursed others as often as he wore clothes [wore curses like a coat]. ·Cursing others filled his body and his life, like drinking water and using olive oil [Let them come like water in his innards and like oil in his bones].

19.verse: So let curses ·cover [wrap] him like ·clothes [a garment] and ·wrap around him like a belt [continually gird him].”

20.verse: May the LORD do these things to those who ·accuse [charge] me, to those who speak evil against me.

21.verse: But you, Lord GOD, ·be kind to me so others will know you are good [act on my behalf for the sake of your name]. Because your ·love [loyalty] is good, ·save [protect] me.

22.verse: I am poor and helpless and ·very sad [my heart is pierced/wounded in me].

23.verse: I am ·dying [gone] like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.

24.verse: My knees ·are weak [buckle; stumble] from fasting, and ·I have grown thin [my flesh is lean of fat].

25.verse: ·My enemies insult me [I am a reproach to them]; they look at me and shake their heads [in scorn].

26.verse: LORD my God, help me; because you are ·loving [loyal], ·save me [give me victory].

27.verse: Then they will know that ·your power has done this [this is your hand]; they will know that you have done it, LORD.

28.verse: They may curse me, but you bless me. They may ·attack [rise against] me, but they will be ·disgraced [embarrassed]. Then I, your servant, will be glad.

29.verse: Let those who ·accuse [charge; attack] me be ·disgraced [clothed with disgrace] and ·covered [wrapped up] with shame like a coat.

30.verse: I will ·thank [praise] the LORD very much [with my mouth]; I will praise him in ·front [the midst] of many people.

31.verse: He ·defends [stands at the right hand of] the helpless and ·saves them from [gives them victory over] those who ·accuse [judge] them.

1.verse: The Lord Appoints a King - A psalm of David. ·The LORD said [Utterance/Oracle of the LORD] to my Lord, “Sit at my right ·side [hand] until I put your enemies under your ·control [feet; Matt. 22:44; 26:64; Mark 12:36; 16:19; Luke 20:42–44; 22:59; Acts 2:34–35; Rom. 8:34; 1 Cor. 15:25; Eph. 1:20; Col. 3:1; Heb. 1:3, 13; 8:1; 10:12–13; 12:2].”

2.verse: The LORD will ·enlarge [send] ·your kingdom [the scepter of your strength; symbol of royal power] beyond ·Jerusalem [Zion; location of the Temple], and ·you will rule over [give you dominion in the midst of] your enemies.

3.verse: Your people will ·join [freely offer themselves to] you on ·your day of battle [the day of your power/army]. You have been dressed in ·holiness [splendor of holiness] from ·birth [the womb of dawn]; you have the ·freshness of a child [dew of your youth].

4.verse: The LORD has made a promise and will not ·change his mind [waver]. He said, “You are a priest forever, a priest like Melchizedek [in reference to an ancient priest-king in Jerusalem; ultimately fulfilled in Christ; Gen. 14:18; Heb. 5:6; 7:17, 21].”

5.verse: The Lord is ·beside you to help you [by your right hand]. ·When he becomes angry [In the day of his anger], he will ·crush [shatter] kings.

6.verse: He will judge those nations, filling them with ·dead bodies [corpses]; he will ·defeat rulers [crush/shatter heads] ·all over the [throughout the wide] world.

7.verse: ·The king [or The Lord; He] will drink from the brook on the way. Then he will ·be strengthened [lift up his head].

1.verse: Praise the Lord’s Goodness - Praise the LORD! I will ·thank [praise] the LORD with all my heart in the ·meeting of his good people [council of the upright/virtuous, in the assembly].

2.verse: The ·LORD does great things [deeds of the LORD are great]; those who enjoy them ·seek [study] them.

3.verse: ·What he does is [His deeds are] ·glorious [beautiful] and ·splendid [majestic], and his ·goodness [righteousness] ·continues [stands] forever.

4.verse: His ·miracles [wonderful acts] are ·unforgettable [remembered; well-known]. The LORD is ·kind [gracious] and ·merciful [compassionate].

5.verse: He gives ·food [prey] to those who fear him [Prov. 1:7]. He remembers his ·agreement [covenant; treaty] forever.

6.verse: He has ·shown [proclaimed to] his people ·his power [the power/strength of his deeds] when he gave them the ·lands [inheritance] of other nations [the conquest; Josh. 1–12].

7.verse: ·Everything he does is [The deeds of his hands are] ·good [faithful; true] and ·fair [just]; all his ·orders [precepts] ·can be trusted [are faithful/true/reliable].

8.verse: They will ·continue [endure; be unshakeable] forever. They were made ·true [faithful] and ·right [virtuous; with integrity].

9.verse: He ·sets his people free [sent redemption to his people]. He ·made his agreement everlasting [commanded his covenant/treaty forever]. ·He [His name] is holy and ·wonderful [awesome].

10.verse: ·Wisdom begins with respect for [The beginning/foundation of wisdom is fear of] the LORD [Prov. 1:7]; those who ·obey [do] ·his orders [them] have good ·understanding [insight]. He ·should be praised [endures; stands] forever.

1.verse: Honest People Are Blessed - Praise the LORD! ·Happy [Blessed] are those who ·respect [fear] the LORD [Prov. 1:7; 31:30], who ·want [take great delight in] ·what he [his] commands.

2.verse: Their ·descendants [seed] will be ·powerful [strong] in the land; the ·children [generation] of ·honest [virtuous] people will be blessed.

3.verse: Their houses will be full of wealth and riches, and their ·goodness [righteousness] will ·continue [endure; stand] forever.

4.verse: A light shines in the dark for ·honest [virtuous] people, for those who are ·merciful [gracious] and ·kind [compassionate] and ·good [merciful].

5.verse: It is good to be ·merciful [gracious] and ·generous [to lend]. Those who ·are fair in their business [conduct their affairs justly]

6.verse: will never be ·defeated [moved]. ·Good [Righteous] people will always be remembered.

7.verse: They ·won’t be afraid of [do not fear] ·bad news [to hear evil; Prov. 30:25]; their hearts are ·steady [steadfast; established; prepared] because they ·trust [have confidence in] the LORD.

8.verse: They ·are confident [endure; are unshakeable; 111:8] and will not ·be afraid [fear]; they will look down on their ·enemies [foes].

9.verse: They ·give freely [distribute/scatter, they give] to the ·poor [needy]. ·The things they do are right and [Their righteousness] will ·continue [endure] forever [2 Cor. 9:9]. ·They will be given great honor [Their horn is exalted in glory; an animal’s horn symbolizes strength].

10.verse: The wicked will see this and become angry; they will ·grind [gnash] their teeth [in anger] and then ·disappear [melt away]. The ·wishes [cravings; desires] of the wicked will ·come to nothing [perish].

1.verse: Praise for the Lord’s Kindness - Praise the LORD! Praise him, you servants of the LORD; praise the name of the LORD.

2.verse: The LORD’s name ·should [is to] be ·praised [blessed] now and forever.

3.verse: The LORD’s name ·should [is to] be praised from where the sun rises to where it sets.

4.verse: The LORD is ·supreme [exalted] over all the nations [99:2]; his glory [God’s manifest presence] ·reaches to the skies [is over the heavens].

5.verse: ·No one [Who…?] is like the LORD our God, who ·rules [is seated/enthroned] ·from heaven [on high],

6.verse: who ·bends [stoops] down to look at the ·skies [heavens] and the earth.

7.verse: The LORD ·lifts [raises] the poor from the ·dirt [dust] and ·takes [exalts] the ·helpless [needy] from the ashes.

8.verse: He ·seats [enthrones] them with princes, the princes of his people [1 Sam. 2:8; Luke 1:52].

9.verse: He gives ·children to the woman who has none [the barren woman a home] and makes her ·a happy mother [joyful with children]. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: God Brought Israel from Egypt - When ·the Israelites [Israel] went out of Egypt, the ·people [house] of Jacob left ·that foreign country [a people of incomprehensible language].

2.verse: Then Judah became God’s holy place [Ex. 19:6]; Israel became ·the land he ruled [his dominion].

3.verse: The Sea [Red (or Reed) Sea; Ex. 14–15] looked and ·ran away [fled]; the Jordan River turned back [Josh. 3].

4.verse: The mountains ·danced [skipped] like ·sheep [rams] and the hills like little lambs.

5.verse: Sea, why did you ·run away [flee]? Jordan, why did you turn back?

6.verse: Mountains, why did you ·dance [skip] like ·sheep [rams]? Hills, why did you ·dance [skip] like little lambs?

7.verse: Earth, ·shake with fear [writhe; tremble] before the Lord, before the God of Jacob.

8.verse: He turned a rock into a pool of water, a hard ·rock [flint] into a spring of water [Ex. 17:1–7; Num. 20:1–13].

1.verse: The One True God - ·It does not belong [Not to us, not] to us, LORD. The glory belongs to ·you [your name] because of your ·love [loyalty] and ·loyalty [faithfulness].

2.verse: Why do the nations ask, “Where is their God?”

3.verse: Our God is in heaven. He does what he pleases.

4.verse: Their idols are made of silver and gold, the work of human hands.

5.verse: They have mouths, but they cannot speak. They have eyes, but they cannot see.

6.verse: They have ears, but they cannot hear. They have noses, but they cannot smell.

7.verse: They have hands, but they cannot feel. They have feet, but they cannot walk. No sounds come from their throats.

8.verse: People who make ·idols [them] ·will be [or are] like them, and so will those who ·trust [have confidence in] them [135:15–18; Is. 44:9–20; 46:6–7; Jer. 10:1–9; Hab. 2:18–19].

9.verse: ·Family of [O] Israel, ·trust [have confidence in] the LORD; he is your helper and your ·protection [shield].

10.verse: ·Family [House] of Aaron [the priests], ·trust [have confidence in] the LORD; he is your helper and your ·protection [shield].

11.verse: You who ·respect [fear] the LORD [Prov. 1:7] should ·trust [have confidence in] him; he is your helper and your ·protection [shield].

12.verse: The LORD remembers us and will bless us. He will bless the ·family [house] of Israel; he will bless the ·family [house] of Aaron [the priests].

13.verse: The LORD will bless those who ·respect [fear] him [Prov. 1:7], from the ·smallest [or least] to the greatest.

14.verse: May the LORD ·give you success [make you increase], and may he give you and your children ·success [increase].

15.verse: May you be blessed by the LORD, who made heaven and earth [Gen. 1].

16.verse: Heaven belongs to the LORD, but he gave the earth to people.

17.verse: Dead people do not praise the LORD; those ·in the grave are silent [who go down in silence].

18.verse: But we will praise the LORD now and forever. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Escaping Death - I love the LORD, because he ·listens to my prayers for help [hears/or heard my voice, my prayer of supplication].

2.verse: He ·paid attention [extends his ear] to me, so I will ·call to him for help [call; pray] ·as long as I live [in my days].

3.verse: The ·ropes [cords] of death ·bound [encompass] me, and the ·fear [hardship; distress] of ·the grave [Sheol; the grave or the underworld] ·took hold of [reached; found] me. I ·was troubled and sad [found distress and sadness].

4.verse: Then I ·called out [prayed in] the name of the LORD. I said, “Please, LORD, ·save [rescue] me!”

5.verse: The LORD is ·kind [gracious] and ·does what is right [righteous]; our God is ·merciful [compassionate; Ex. 34:6–7].

6.verse: The LORD ·watches over [keeps; guards] the ·foolish [immature; simpleminded]; when I was ·helpless [brought low], he ·saved me [gave me victory].

7.verse: I said to myself, “·Relax [Return, my soul/life to your rest], because the LORD ·takes care of you [treats you well].”

8.verse: LORD, you ·saved [rescued] me from death. ·You stopped my eyes from crying […and my eyes from tears]; ·you kept me from being defeated […my feet from stumbling].

9.verse: So I will walk ·with [before; in the presence of] the LORD in the land of the living [as opposed to the grave].

10.verse: I ·believed [trusted], so I said, “I am ·completely ruined [afflicted greatly; 2 Cor. 4:13].”

11.verse: In my ·distress [worry] I said, “All people are liars [Rom. 3:4].”

12.verse: What can I ·give [return to] the LORD for all the ·good things [benefits] he has given to me?

13.verse: I will lift up the cup of salvation, and I will pray ·to [in the name of] the LORD.

14.verse: I will ·give the LORD what I promised [pay my vow to the LORD] in front of all his people.

15.verse: The death of ·one that belongs to the LORD [his loyal ones/saints] is precious in his ·sight [eyes].

16.verse: LORD, I am your servant; I am your servant and the son of your female servant. You have ·freed me from [loosened] my chains.

17.verse: I will give you ·an offering to show thanks to you [a thanksgiving offering], and I will pray ·to [in the name of] the LORD.

18.verse: I will ·give the LORD what I promised [pay my vow to the LORD] in front of all his people,

19.verse: in the ·Temple courtyards [courtyards of the house of the LORD] in your midst, Jerusalem. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: A Hymn of Praise - All you nations, praise the LORD. All you people, ·praise [extol] him

2.verse: because ·the LORD loves us very much [great is his loyalty/love toward us], and his ·truth [faithfulness] is everlasting. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Victory - ·Thank [Praise] the LORD because he is good. His ·love [loyalty] ·continues [endures] forever.

2.verse: Let Israel say, “His ·love [loyalty] ·continues [endures] forever.”

3.verse: Let the ·family [house] of Aaron [the priests] say, “His ·love [loyalty] ·continues [endures] forever.”

4.verse: Let those who ·respect [fear] the LORD [Prov. 1:7] say, “His ·love [loyalty] ·continues [endures] forever.”

5.verse: I was in ·trouble [distress], so I ·called [prayed] to the LORD. The LORD answered me and set me ·free [in a broad place].

6.verse: I will not ·be afraid [fear], because the LORD is with me [Rom. 8:31]. ·People can’t do anything [What can people do…?] to me [Heb. 13:6].

7.verse: The LORD is with me to help me, so I will ·see my enemies defeated [look on my enemy; in triumph].

8.verse: It is better to ·trust [find refuge in] the LORD than to ·trust [have confidence in] people.

9.verse: It is better to ·trust [find refuge in] the LORD than to ·trust [have confidence in] princes.

10.verse: All the nations surrounded me, but I ·defeated them [warded them off] in the name of the LORD.

11.verse: They surrounded me; they surrounded me on every side, but ·with the LORD’s power [in the name of the LORD] I ·defeated them [warded them off].

12.verse: They surrounded me like a swarm of bees, but they ·died [were extinguished] as quickly as thorns burn. ·By the LORD’s power [In the name of the LORD], I ·defeated them [warded them off].

13.verse: They [or You] ·chased me [pushed me hard] until I ·was almost defeated [almost fell], but the LORD helped me.

14.verse: The LORD ·gives me strength and a song [is my strength and song/or might]. He has ·saved me [given me victory].

15.verse: Shouts of joy and victory come from the tents of ·those who do right [the righteous]: “The right hand of the LORD has done powerful things.”

16.verse: The ·power [right hand] of the LORD ·has won the victory [is exalted]; with his ·power [right hand] the LORD has done powerful things.

17.verse: I will not die, but live, and I will ·tell [recount] what the LORD has done.

18.verse: The LORD has ·taught me a hard lesson [surely disciplined/instructed me], but he did not ·let me die [give me over to death].

19.verse: Open for me the ·Temple gates [gates of righteousness]. Then I will come in and ·thank [praise] the LORD.

20.verse: This is the LORD’s gate; only ·those who are good [the righteous] may enter through it [15; 24:3–6].

21.verse: LORD, I ·thank [praise] you for answering me. You have ·saved me [given me victory].

22.verse: The stone that the builders rejected became the chief cornerstone [Luke 20:17; Acts 4:11; Eph. 2:20; 1 Pet. 2:7].

23.verse: ·The LORD did this [This is from the LORD], and it is wonderful ·to us [in our eyes; Matt. 21:42; Mark 12:10–11].

24.verse: This is the day that the LORD has made. Let us rejoice and be glad ·today [in it]!

25.verse: Please, LORD, ·save us [give us victory]; please, LORD, give us ·success [prosperity].

26.verse: ·God bless [Blessed be] the one who comes in the name of the LORD. We bless all of you from the ·Temple [house] of the LORD [Mark 11:9; Luke 13:35; 19:38].

27.verse: The LORD is God, and he has ·shown kindness to [illuminated; given light to] us. ·With branches in your hands, join the feast [Bind the feast/procession with branches]. Come to the ·corners [horns; Ex. 27:2] of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I will ·thank [praise] you; you are my God, and I will ·praise your greatness [exalt you].

29.verse: ·Thank [Praise] the LORD because he is good. His ·love [loyalty] ·continues [endures] forever.

1.verse: The Word of God - ·Happy [Blessed] are those ·who live pure lives [whose way is blameless], who follow the LORD’s ·teachings [instructions; law].

2.verse: Happy are those who keep his ·rules [decrees; testimonies], who ·try to obey [seek] him with their whole heart.

3.verse: They don’t do what is wrong; they follow his ways.

4.verse: LORD, you ·gave [commanded] your ·orders [precepts] to be obeyed completely.

5.verse: ·I wish I [O that my ways] were more ·loyal [steadfast; established; set] in obeying your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

6.verse: Then I would not be ashamed ·when I study [staring/gazing at] your commands.

7.verse: When I learned that your ·laws [judgments] are fair, I ·praised [thanked] you with an ·honest [upright] heart.

8.verse: I will obey your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements], so please don’t ever ·leave [abandon; forsake] me.

9.verse: How can a young person ·live a pure life [keep his way pure]? By ·obeying [guarding; keeping] your word.

10.verse: With all my heart I ·try to obey [seek] you. Don’t let me ·break [stray from] your commands.

11.verse: I have ·taken your words to heart [treasured/stored your words in my heart] so I would not sin against you.

12.verse: LORD, you ·should be praised [are blessed]. Teach me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

13.verse: My lips will ·tell about [recount] all the ·laws you have spoken [judgments of your mouth].

14.verse: I enjoy ·living by your rules [the way of your decrees/testimonies] as people enjoy great riches.

15.verse: I ·think about [meditate on] your ·orders [precepts] and ·study [look at] your ways.

16.verse: I enjoy ·obeying your demands [your statutes/ordinances/requirements], and I will not forget your word.

17.verse: ·Do good [Grant this] to me, your servant, so I can live, so I can ·obey [keep; guard] your word.

18.verse: Open my eyes to see the ·miracles [wonders] in your ·teachings [instructions; law].

19.verse: I am a ·stranger [sojourner; alien resident] ·on earth [or in the land]. Do not hide your commands from me.

20.verse: ·I wear myself out [My soul pines away] with ·desire [longing] for your ·laws [judgments] all the time.

21.verse: You ·scold [rebuke; reprimand] ·proud [arrogant] people; those who ·ignore [wander from] your commands are cursed.

22.verse: ·Don’t let me be insulted and hated [Take away insult and contempt] because I keep your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

23.verse: Even if princes sit around and speak against me, I, your servant, will ·think [meditate] about your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

24.verse: Your ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements] give me pleasure; they ·give me good advice [are my advisors/counselors].

25.verse: ·I am about to die [My soul clings to the dust]. Give me life, as you have promised.

26.verse: I ·told you about my life [recounted my way], and you answered me. Teach me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

27.verse: Help me understand your ·orders [the way of your precepts]. Then I will ·think [meditate] about your ·miracles [wonders].

28.verse: ·I am sad and tired [My soul is weary/melts with sorrow affliction]. Make me ·strong [rise up] again as you have promised.

29.verse: ·Don’t let me be dishonest [Turn me away from a false way]; ·have mercy on me by helping me obey your teachings [graciously teach me your instructions/laws].

30.verse: I have chosen the way of ·truth [faithfulness]; I have ·obeyed [placed before me] your ·laws [judgments].

31.verse: I ·hold on [cling] to your ·rules [decrees; testimonies]. LORD, do not let me be ·disgraced [shamed].

32.verse: I will ·quickly obey [run the way of] your commands, because you have ·made me happy [enlarged my heart/mind].

33.verse: LORD, teach me ·your demands [the way of your demands/statutes/ordinances/requirements], and I will ·keep [observe] them until the end.

34.verse: Help me understand, so I can ·keep [protect] your ·teachings [instructions; laws], ·obeying [guarding] them with all my heart.

35.verse: Lead me in the path of your commands, because ·that makes me happy [I take pleasure in them].

36.verse: Make me want to keep your ·rules [decrees; testimonies] ·instead of wishing for riches [not to gain/profit].

37.verse: ·Keep me [Turn my eyes] from looking at ·worthless [false; vain] things. Let me live ·by your word [in your path].

38.verse: ·Keep your promise [Confirm your word] to me, your servant, so you will be ·respected [feared; Prov. 1:7].

39.verse: Take away ·the shame [my scorn/humiliation] I fear, because your ·laws [judgments] are good.

40.verse: How I ·want to follow [long for] your ·orders [precepts]. Give me life because of your ·goodness [righteousness].

41.verse: LORD, ·show [bring] me your ·love [loyalty], and ·save me [give me victory] as you have ·promised [said].

42.verse: I have an answer for people who ·insult [scorn] me, because I ·trust [find refuge in] what you say.

43.verse: Never ·keep me from speaking your truth [take the word of truth from my mouth], because I ·depend [pin my hopes] on your ·fair laws [judgments].

44.verse: I will ·obey [keep; guard] your ·teachings [instructions; laws] forever and ever.

45.verse: So I will live in ·freedom [liberty], because I ·want to follow [seek] your ·orders [precepts].

46.verse: I will discuss your ·rules [decrees; testimonies] with kings and will not be ashamed.

47.verse: I ·enjoy obeying [delight in] your commands, which I love.

48.verse: I ·praise [lift my palms/hands to] your commands, which I love, and I ·think [meditate] about your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

49.verse: Remember your promise to me, your servant; it gives me hope.

50.verse: When I suffer, this comforts me: Your promise gives me life.

51.verse: ·Proud [Arrogant] people always ·make fun of [mock] me, but I do not ·reject [stray from] your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

52.verse: I remember your ·laws [judgments] from long ago, and they comfort me, LORD.

53.verse: ·I become angry with wicked people [Indignation seizes me because of the wicked] who ·do not keep [abandon; forsake] your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

54.verse: I sing about your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements] ·wherever I live [in the house of my dwelling].

55.verse: LORD, I remember ·you [your name] at night, and I will ·obey [keep; guard] your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

56.verse: This is what I do: I ·follow [protect] your ·orders [precepts].

57.verse: LORD, you are my ·share in life [portion; lot]; I have promised to ·obey [keep; guard] your words.

58.verse: I ·prayed to [entreat; implore] you with all my heart. ·Have mercy on [Be gracious to] me as you have promised.

59.verse: I ·thought about [considered] my ·life [path], and I ·decided to follow [turned my feet to] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

60.verse: I hurried and did not wait to ·obey [keep; obey] your commands.

61.verse: Wicked people have ·tied me up [ensnared me], but I have not forgotten your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

62.verse: In the middle of the night, I get up to ·thank [praise] you because your ·laws [judgments] are ·right [righteous].

63.verse: I am a ·friend [companion] to everyone who fears you, to anyone who ·obeys [keeps; guards] your ·orders [precepts].

64.verse: LORD, your ·love [loyalty] fills the earth. Teach me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

65.verse: You have done good things for your servant, as you have promised, LORD.

66.verse: Teach me ·wisdom [good judgment] and knowledge because I ·trust [believe] your commands.

67.verse: Before I ·suffered [was humbled], I ·did wrong [wandered], but now I ·obey [keep; guard] your word.

68.verse: You are good, and you do what is good. Teach me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

69.verse: ·Proud [Arrogant] people ·have made up lies about me [smear me with lies], but I will ·follow [keep; protect] your ·orders [precepts] with all my heart.

70.verse: ·Those people have no feelings [Their hearts are gross and fat], but I ·love [delight in] your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

71.verse: It was good for me to ·suffer [be humbled] so I would learn your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

72.verse: ·Your teachings [The instructions/laws of your mouth] are ·worth more to [better for] me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.

73.verse: You made me and ·formed [fashioned; or established] me with your hands. Give me understanding so I can learn your commands.

74.verse: Let those who ·respect [fear; Prov. 1:7] you rejoice when they see me, because I put my hope in your word.

75.verse: LORD, I know that your ·laws [judgments] are ·right [righteous] and that it was ·right [faithful] for you to ·punish [humble] me.

76.verse: Comfort me with your ·love [loyalty], as you promised me, your servant.

77.verse: ·Have mercy [Let your mercy/compassion come] on me so that I may live. I ·love [delight in] your ·teachings [laws; instructions].

78.verse: Make ·proud [arrogant] people ashamed because they ·lied about me [perverted me with lies]. But I will ·think about [meditate on] your ·orders [precepts].

79.verse: Let those who ·respect [fear; Prov. 1:7] you return to me, those who know your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

80.verse: ·Let me obey your demands perfectly [May my heart be blameless in regard to your statutes/ordinances/requirements] so I will not be ashamed.

81.verse: I ·am weak from waiting for you to save me [grow weak for your salvation/victory], but I hope in your word.

83.verse: Even though I am like a wine bag in smoke [shrunken and dried out], I do not forget your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

84.verse: ·How long will I live [Like what are the days of your servant]? When will you ·judge [perform judgment on] those who are ·hurting [pursuing] me?

85.verse: ·Proud [Arrogant] people have dug pits [to trap him]. They ·have nothing to do with your teachings [are not according to your teachings/instructions/laws].

86.verse: All of your commands ·can be trusted [are reliable]. Liars are ·hurting [pursuing] me. Help me!

87.verse: They have almost put me in the ·grave [earth], but I have not ·rejected [abandoned; forsaken] your ·orders [precepts].

88.verse: Give me life ·by your love [according to your loyalty] so I can ·obey [keep; guard] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

89.verse: ·LORD, your word is everlasting [or The LORD is everlasting]; ·it [your word] ·continues forever [is firm] in heaven.

90.verse: Your ·loyalty [faithfulness; truth] will go on and on; you ·made [established] the earth, and it ·still stands [endures].

91.verse: All things ·continue [endure] to this day because of your ·laws [judgments], because all things ·serve you [are your servants].

92.verse: If I had not ·loved [delighted in] your ·teachings [instructions; laws], I would have ·died [perished] ·from my sufferings [in my afflictions].

93.verse: I will never forget your ·orders [precepts], because you have given me life by them.

94.verse: I am yours. ·Save me [Give me victory]. I ·want to obey [seek] your ·orders [precepts].

95.verse: Wicked people ·are waiting [hope] to ·destroy me [make me perish], but I will ·think about [consider] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

96.verse: Everything I see has its limits, but your commands ·have none [are very broad].

97.verse: How I love your ·teachings [instructions; laws]! I ·think about [ponder; meditate on] them all day long.

98.verse: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, because they are mine forever.

99.verse: I am ·wiser [more insightful] than all my teachers, because I ·think about [ponder; meditate on] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

100.verse: I have more understanding than the elders, because I ·follow [protect] your ·orders [precepts].

101.verse: I have ·avoided [kept my feet from] every evil way so I could ·obey [keep; guard] your word.

102.verse: I haven’t ·walked [turned] away from your ·laws [judgments], because you yourself are my teacher.

103.verse: ·Your promises are sweet to me [How sweet your words slip/slide down my palate], sweeter than honey in my mouth!

104.verse: Your ·orders [precepts] give me understanding, so I hate lying ways.

105.verse: Your word is like a lamp for my feet and a light for my path [it shows how life should be lived].

106.verse: I ·will do what I have promised [have sworn and confirmed it] and ·obey [keep; guard] your ·fair [righteous] ·laws [judgments].

107.verse: I have suffered ·for a long time [or greatly]. LORD, ·give me [spare my] life by your word.

108.verse: LORD, accept my ·willing [offering of] praise and teach me your ·laws [judgments].

109.verse: My life is always in ·danger [my hand], but I haven’t forgotten your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

110.verse: Wicked people have set a trap for me, but I haven’t ·strayed [wandered] from your ·orders [precepts].

111.verse: ·I will follow your rules forever [Your rules/decrees/precepts are my inheritance forever], because they make ·me [my heart] happy.

112.verse: I will ·try [incline my heart] to do ·what you demand [your statutes/ordinances] forever, until the end.

113.verse: I hate ·disloyal [or double-minded] people, but I love your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

114.verse: You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.

115.verse: Get away from me, you who do evil, so I can ·keep [protect] my God’s commands.

116.verse: ·Support [Uphold] me as you promised so I can live. Don’t let me be embarrassed because of my hopes.

117.verse: ·Help [Strengthen] me, and I will ·be saved [have victory]. I will always ·respect [care about] your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

118.verse: You ·reject [treat as worthless] those who ·ignore [go astray from] your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements], because their lies ·mislead them [leave them in the lurch].

119.verse: You throw away the wicked of the world like ·trash [dross]. So I will love your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

120.verse: ·I [My flesh] ·shake [shudder] in ·fear [dread] of you; I ·respect [fear] your ·laws [judgments].

121.verse: I have done what is ·fair [just] and ·right [righteous]. Don’t leave me to ·those who wrong me [my oppressors/exploiters].

122.verse: ·Promise that you will help me, [Stand as security for/Guarantee good for] your servant. Don’t let ·proud [arrogant] people ·wrong [oppress; exploit] me.

123.verse: My eyes ·are tired from looking [fail; grow weak] for your ·salvation [victory] and for your good promise.

124.verse: ·Show your love to me, your servant [Deal with your servant according to your love/loyalty], and teach me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

125.verse: I am your servant. ·Give me wisdom [Make me understand] so I can ·understand [know] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

126.verse: LORD, it is time for you to do something, because ·people have disobeyed your teachings [your teachings/instructions/laws have been broken].

127.verse: I love your commands more than ·the purest gold [gold, the finest gold].

128.verse: I ·respect [or follow] all your ·orders [precepts], so I hate ·lying [false] ways.

129.verse: Your ·rules [decrees; testimonies] are wonderful. That is why I ·keep [protect] them.

130.verse: ·Learning [Opening] your words ·gives wisdom [illuminates; gives light] and understanding for the ·foolish [immature; simpleminded].

131.verse: ·I am nearly out of breath [I crack/open my mouth and pant]. I ·really want to learn [long for] your commands.

132.verse: ·Look at [Turn to] me and have ·mercy [compassion] on me ·as you do [as is your custom] for those who love ·you [your name].

133.verse: ·Guide my steps [Steady my feet] as you promised; don’t let any ·sin [guilt] ·control [dominate] me.

134.verse: ·Save [Redeem] me from ·harmful [oppressive; exploitative] people so I can ·obey [keep; guard] your ·orders [precepts].

135.verse: ·Show your kindness to [Make your face shine on] me, your servant [Num. 6:24–26]. Teach me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

136.verse: ·Tears stream [Streams of water come down] from my eyes, because people do not ·obey [keep; guard] your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

137.verse: LORD, you ·do what is right [are righteous], and your ·laws [judgments] are ·fair [virtuous; upright].

138.verse: ·The rules [Your decrees/testimonies] you commanded are ·right [righteous] and completely ·trustworthy [true; faithful].

139.verse: ·I am so upset I am worn out [My passion/zeal consumes; or silences me], because my ·enemies [foes] have forgotten your words.

140.verse: Your promises are ·proven [refined], so I, your servant, love them.

141.verse: I am ·unimportant [small] and ·hated [despised], but I have not forgotten your ·orders [precepts].

142.verse: Your ·goodness continues forever [righteousness is an everlasting righteousness], and your ·teachings [instructions; laws] are ·true [faithful].

143.verse: ·I have had troubles and misery [Distress and pressure have found me], but I ·love [delight in] your commands.

144.verse: Your ·rules [decrees; testimonies] are always ·good [righteous]. ·Help [Make] me understand so I can live.

145.verse: I call to you with all my heart. Answer me, LORD, and I will ·keep [protect] your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

146.verse: I call to you. ·Save me [Give me victory] so I can ·obey [keep; guard] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

147.verse: I ·wake up early in the morning [get up before dawn] and cry out. I hope in your word.

148.verse: ·I stay awake all night [My eyes awake in the watches of the night] so I can ·think about [meditate on] your promises.

149.verse: ·Listen to me [Hear my voice] because of your ·love [loyalty]; LORD, ·give me [spare my] life by your ·laws [judgments].

150.verse: Those who ·love evil [pursue/persecute me with an evil plan] are near, but they are far from your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

151.verse: But, LORD, you are also near, and all your commands are ·true [faithful].

152.verse: Long ago I learned from your ·rules [decrees; testimonies] that you made them ·to continue [foundational] forever.

153.verse: See my ·suffering [affliction] and rescue me, because I have not forgotten your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

154.verse: Argue my case and ·save [redeem] me. ·Let me live [Spare my life] by your promises.

155.verse: ·Wicked people are far from being saved [Salvation/Victory is far from the wicked], because they do not ·want [seek] your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

156.verse: LORD, ·you are very kind [your compassion/mercies are abundant]; give me life by your ·laws [judgments].

157.verse: Many ·enemies [foes] ·are after [pursue; persecute] me, but I have not ·rejected [swerved from] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies].

158.verse: I see those traitors, and I ·hate [loathe; am disgusted by] them, because they do not ·obey [keep; guard] what you say.

159.verse: See how I love your ·orders [precepts]. LORD, give me life by your ·love [loyalty].

160.verse: ·Your words are true from the start [The head of your word is true/faithful], and all your ·laws [judgments] will be ·fair [righteous] forever.

161.verse: Leaders ·attack [pursue] me for no reason, but ·I fear your law in my heart [my heart fears your words].

162.verse: I ·am as happy over [delight in] your promises as if I had found ·a great treasure [much plunder].

163.verse: I hate and ·despise [loathe] lies, but I love your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

164.verse: Seven times a day I praise you for your ·fair laws [righteous judgments].

165.verse: Those who love your ·teachings [instructions; laws] will find ·true peace [or much prosperity], and nothing will ·defeat them [make them stumble].

166.verse: I am ·waiting [hoping] for ·you to save me [your salvation/victory], LORD. I will ·obey [do] your commands.

167.verse: I ·obey [keep; guard] your ·rules [decrees; testimonies], and I love them very much.

168.verse: I ·obey [keep; guard] your ·orders [precepts] and ·rules [decrees; testimonies], because ·you know everything I do [all my ways are before you].

169.verse: ·Hear my cry to you [Let my shout of joy come near you], LORD. Let your word help me understand.

170.verse: Listen to my ·prayer [supplication]; ·save [protect] me as you promised.

171.verse: Let ·me [my lips] ·speak [bubble forth] your praise, because you have taught me your ·demands [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

172.verse: Let ·me [my tongue] sing about your promises, because all your commands are ·fair [righteous].

173.verse: Give me your helping hand, because I have chosen your ·commands [precepts].

174.verse: I ·want you to save me [desire your salvation/victory], LORD. I ·love [delight in] your ·teachings [instructions; laws].

175.verse: Let me live so I can praise you, and let your ·laws [judgments] help me.

176.verse: I have ·wandered [gone astray] like a lost sheep. ·Look for [Seek] your servant, because I have not forgotten your commands.

1.verse: A Prayer of Someone Far from Home - A psalm ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. When I was in ·trouble [distress], I called to the LORD, and he answered me.

2.verse: LORD, ·save [protect] me from ·liars [false lips] and from ·those who plan evil [a deceptive tongue].

3.verse: ·You who plan evil [O deceptive tongue], what will ·God do [he give] to you? ·How will he punish [What will he add to] you?

4.verse: ·He will punish you with the sharp arrows of a warrior and with burning coals of wood [The sharp arrows of a warrior and the burning coals of a broom tree; the broom tree produces excellent charcoal].

5.verse: ·How terrible it is for [Woe to] me to ·live in the land of [sojourn/wander in] Meshech [by the Black Sea in Asia Minor; Gen. 10:2; Ezek. 38:2], to ·live [dwell; reside] among the ·people [tents] of Kedar [in the Arabian desert; Is. 21:16–17; Jer. 2:10; 49:28; Ezek. 27:21].

6.verse: I have ·lived [dwelt; resided] too long with people who hate peace.

7.verse: When I talk peace, they want war.

1.verse: The Lord Guards His People - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. I ·look up [raise my eyes] to the hills [the hills surrounding Zion, the location of the Temple], but where does my help come from?

2.verse: My help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth [Gen. 1].

3.verse: He will not let ·you be defeated [your feet be moved/slip]. He who ·guards [watches] you never sleeps.

4.verse: He who ·guards [watches] Israel never ·rests [sleeps] or ·sleeps [slumbers].

5.verse: The LORD ·guards [watches] you. The LORD is the shade ·that protects you from the sun [at your hand, your right hand; 91:1].

6.verse: The sun cannot ·hurt [strike] you during the day, and the moon cannot ·hurt [strike] you at night.

7.verse: The LORD will ·protect [guard; watch] you from all ·dangers [trouble; evil]; he will ·guard [watch] your life.

8.verse: The LORD will ·guard [watch] you as you come and go, both now and forever.

1.verse: Happy People in Jerusalem - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. Of David. I ·was happy [rejoiced] when they said to me, “Let’s ·go [walk] to the ·Temple [house] of the LORD.”

2.verse: Jerusalem, ·we [our feet] are standing at your gates.

3.verse: Jerusalem is built as a city ·with the buildings close together [that is closely tied together].

4.verse: The tribes [the twelve tribes of Israel] go up there, the tribes who belong to the LORD. It is the ·rule [decree; testimony] in Israel to ·praise [thank the name of] the LORD at Jerusalem.

5.verse: There ·are set thrones to judge the people [dwell thrones of judgment], the thrones of the ·descendants [dynasty; house] of David.

6.verse: ·Pray [Ask] for peace in Jerusalem: “May those who love her ·be safe [prosper].

7.verse: May there be peace within her ·walls [ramparts] and ·safety [security] within her strong towers.”

8.verse: To help my ·relatives [brothers] and ·friends [neighbors], I say, “Let ·Jerusalem have peace [peace be within you].”

9.verse: For the sake of the ·Temple [house] of the LORD our God, I ·wish [seek] ·good [prosperity] for her.

1.verse: A Prayer for Mercy - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. LORD, I ·look upward [lift up my eyes] to you, you who ·live [are enthroned; sit] in heaven.

2.verse: ·Slaves depend on their masters [Like the eyes of servants/slaves to the hand of their master], and ·a female servant depends on her mistress [like the eyes of a maidservant to the hand of her mistress]. ·In the same way, we depend on the LORD our God […thus our eyes are to the LORD our God as…]; we wait for him to show us ·mercy [grace].

3.verse: ·Have mercy on [Be gracious to] us, LORD. ·Have mercy on [Be gracious to] us, because we have been insulted.

4.verse: We ·have suffered [are filled with the] ·many insults [much ridicule] from ·lazy [untroubled; unworried] people and much ·cruelty [scorn] from the proud.

1.verse: The Lord Saves His People - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. Of David. What if the LORD had not been on our side? (Let Israel ·repeat this [say].)

2.verse: What if the LORD had not been on our side when ·we were attacked [people rose against us]?

3.verse: When they were angry with us, they would have swallowed us alive.

4.verse: They would have been like ·a flood [water] ·drowning [overflowing] us; they would have ·poured [passed] over us like a ·river [torrent].

5.verse: They would have ·swept us away [passed over us] like ·a mighty stream [raging waters].

6.verse: ·Praise [Blessed be] the LORD, who did not ·let them chew us up [give us as prey to their teeth].

1.verse: God Protects Those Who Trust Him - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. Those who ·trust [have confidence in] the LORD are like Mount Zion [the location of the Temple], which sits unmoved forever.

1.verse: Lord, Bring Your People Back - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. When the LORD ·brought the prisoners back to [brought back those who returned to; or restored the fortunes of] Jerusalem [Zion; probably the return from the exile; 2 Chr. 36:22–23; Ezra 1], it seemed as if we were dreaming [so surprised and happy that it did not seem real].

1.verse: All Good Things Come from God - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. Of Solomon. If the LORD doesn’t build the house, the builders are working ·for nothing [in vain; without purpose]. 1.verse: The Happy Home - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. ·Happy [Blessed] are those who ·respect [fear] the LORD [Prov. 1:7] and ·obey him [walk in his ways].
