1.verse: A Prayer Against the Enemies - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. ·They have treated me badly all my life [Many are my foes from my youth]. (Let Israel ·repeat this [say].)

1.verse: A Prayer for Mercy - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. LORD, ·I am in great trouble [from the depths], so I ·call out [pray] to you.

2.verse: Lord, hear my voice; ·listen to my prayer for help [let your ear pay attention to the sound of my supplication].

3.verse: LORD, if you ·punished people for all their sins [observed/watched/guarded against iniquity], ·no one would be left [who could stand…?], Lord.

5.verse: I ·wait [hope] for the LORD ·to help me [my soul hopes], and I ·trust [hope in] his word.

7.verse: People of Israel, put your hope in the LORD because he is ·loving [loyal] and ·able to save [with him is abundant redemption].

8.verse: He will ·save [redeem] Israel from all their ·sins [iniquities].

1.verse: Childlike Trust in the Lord - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. Of David. LORD, my heart is not proud; ·I don’t look down on others [my eyes are not haughty/lifted up]. I don’t ·do [consider doing] great things, and I ·can’t do [don’t consider doing] ·miracles [wonderful acts].

1.verse: In Praise of the Temple - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. LORD, remember David and all his ·suffering [afflictions].

2.verse: He ·made an oath [swore] to the LORD, a ·promise [vow] to the Mighty God of Jacob [Gen. 49:24].

4.verse: or ·close [give sleep to] my eyes, or ·let myself sleep [slumber to my pupils]

17.verse: “I will ·make a king come from the family of [cause a horn to sprout up for; an animal’s horn symbolizes strength] David [Luke 1:69–70]. I will ·provide my appointed one descendants to rule after him [prepare a lamp for my anointed king; 2 Sam. 21:17].

1.verse: The Love of God’s People - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. Of David. ·It is [How] good and pleasant when ·God’s people [brothers] live together [in unity]!

2.verse: It is like ·perfumed [fine] oil on the head and running down his beard [Ex. 30:22–33]. It ran down Aaron’s beard and on to the collar of his robes.

1.verse: Temple Guards, Praise the Lord - A song ·for going up to worship [of ascents; perhaps sung while traveling to Jerusalem to celebrate an annual religious festival like Passover]. ·Praise [Bless] the LORD, all you servants of the LORD, you who ·serve [stand] at night in the ·Temple [house] of the LORD.

1.verse: The Lord Saves, Idols Do Not - Praise the LORD! Praise the name of the LORD; praise him, you servants of the LORD,

19.verse: ·Family [House] of Israel, ·praise [bless] the LORD. ·Family [House] of Aaron [the priests], ·praise [bless] the LORD.

1.verse: God’s Love Continues Forever - ·Give thanks to [Praise] the LORD because he is good. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

5.verse: With his ·wisdom [understanding; 104:24; Prov. 3:19; Jer. 10:12] he made the ·skies [heavens; Gen. 1:6–7]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

7.verse: He made the ·sun and the moon [great lights; Gen. 1:14–15]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

15.verse: But ·the king of Egypt [Pharaoh] and his army ·drowned in [were swept into] the ·Red [Reed] Sea [v. 13]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

16.verse: He led his people through the ·desert [wilderness; Deut. 8:15; Jer. 2:6]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

17.verse: He ·defeated [struck] great kings. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

18.verse: He killed ·powerful [mighty] kings. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

19.verse: He defeated Sihon king of the Amorites [Num. 21:21–32]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

20.verse: He defeated Og king of Bashan [Num. 21:32–35]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

21.verse: He gave their land as a ·gift [inheritance]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

22.verse: It was a ·gift [inheritance] to his servants, the Israelites. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

23.verse: He remembered us ·when we were in trouble [in our low condition]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

24.verse: He ·freed us from [pulled us away from] our ·enemies [foes]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

25.verse: He gives ·food [bread] to ·every living creature [all flesh]. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

26.verse: ·Give thanks to [Praise] the God of heaven. His ·love [loyalty] continues forever.

1.verse: Israelites in Captivity - By the rivers in Babylon we sat and ·cried [wept; during the Babylonian exile] when we remembered ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple].

2.verse: On the ·poplar [or willow] trees nearby we hung our harps.

3.verse: ·Those who captured us [Our captors] asked us to sing; our ·enemies [oppressors] wanted happy songs. They said, “Sing us a song about ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple]!”

4.verse: But we cannot sing songs about the LORD while we are in this foreign ·country [land]!

5.verse: Jerusalem, if I forget you, let my right hand ·lose its skill [forget; its skill of playing a musical instrument].

6.verse: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not ·think about Jerusalem as my greatest joy [or go up to Jerusalem with joy on my head].

7.verse: LORD, remember ·what the Edomites did [the sons of Edom] on the day ·Jerusalem fell [of Jerusalem; Lam. 4:21; Ezek. 25:12–14; 35:5–15; Obad. 11–14]. They said, “Tear it down! Tear it down to its foundations!”

8.verse: ·People [Daughter] of Babylon, you will be destroyed. The people who pay you back for what you did to us will be ·happy [blessed].

1.verse: A Hymn of Thanksgiving - A psalm of David. LORD, I will ·thank [praise] you with all my heart; I will ·sing [make a psalm] to you before the gods.

2.verse: I will bow down facing your holy Temple, and I will ·thank [praise] ·you [your name] for your ·love [loyalty] and ·loyalty [faithfulness]. You have ·made your name and your word greater than anything [exalted your word above all your name].

3.verse: On the day I ·called [prayed] to you, you answered me. You ·made me strong and brave [have emboldened/encouraged my soul with strength].

4.verse: LORD, let all the kings of the earth ·praise [thank] you when they hear the words ·you speak [of your mouth].

5.verse: They will sing about ·what the LORD has done [the way of the LORD], because the LORD’s glory [his manifest presence] is great.

6.verse: Though the LORD is ·supreme [exalted], he ·takes care of [looks on] ·those who are humble [the lowly], but he ·stays away from the proud [perceives the proud from far away].

7.verse: LORD, ·even when I have trouble all around me [if I walk in the midst of distress], you will keep me alive. When my enemies are angry, you will ·reach down [send out your hand] and save me by your ·power [right hand].

8.verse: LORD, you ·do everything [fulfill/accomplish your plan] for me. LORD, your ·love [loyalty] continues forever. Do not ·leave [abandon; forsake] us, ·whom you made [the work of your hands].

1.verse: God Knows Everything - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, you have ·examined [investigated; searched] me and know all about me.

2.verse: You know when I sit down and when I ·get up [rise]. You ·know [understand] my thoughts ·before I think them [from afar].

3.verse: You ·know [measure] ·where I go [my path] and ·where I lie down [my lying down]. You ·know [are familiar with] ·everything I do [all my path].

4.verse: LORD, even ·before I say a word [when no word is on my tongue], you already know ·it [all of it].

5.verse: You ·are all around me [hem me in]—in front and in back— and have put your hand on me.

6.verse: Your knowledge is ·amazing [wonderful; or overwhelming] to me; it is ·more than I can understand [too high/unattainable. I am not able to grasp it; Rom. 11:33].

7.verse: Where can I go to get away from your Spirit? Where can I ·run [flee] from you?

8.verse: If I ·go [climb] up to the heavens, you are there. If I ·lie down [spread out; make my bed] in ·the grave [Sheol; the grave or the underworld], you are there.

9.verse: If I rise with the ·sun in the east [wings of the dawn] and settle in the ·west beyond [back of] the sea,

10.verse: even there ·you [your hand] would guide me. With your right hand you would ·hold [grab; seize] me.

11.verse: I could say, “The darkness will ·hide [cover] me. Let the light around me turn into night.”

12.verse: But even the darkness is not dark to you. The night ·is as light as [shines like] the day; darkness and light are the same to you.

13.verse: You ·made [created] my ·whole being [inward parts]; you ·formed [knitted] me in my mother’s ·body [belly; womb].

14.verse: I ·praise [thank] you because you made me in an ·amazing [awesome] and wonderful way. What you have done is wonderful. I know this very well.

15.verse: ·You saw my bones being formed [My bones were not hidden from you] as I ·took shape [was made] in ·my mother’s body [secret]. When I was ·put together [woven] ·there [in the depths of the earth],

16.verse: ·you [your eyes] saw my ·body as it was formed [embyro]. All the days ·planned [formed] for me were written in your book ·before I was one day old [not one of them existed].

17.verse: God, your thoughts are precious to me. ·They are so many [How vast are their sum; Job 42:3]!

18.verse: If I could count them, they would be more than all the grains of sand. When I ·wake up [or come to the end], I am still with you.

19.verse: God, I wish you would kill the wicked! Get away from me, you ·murderers [people of blood]!

20.verse: They ·say evil things about [make evil plans against] you. Your enemies ·use your name thoughtlessly [lift in vain; Ex. 20:7].

21.verse: LORD, ·I hate [Do I not hate…?] those who hate you; ·I hate [Do I not abhor…?] those who rise up against you.

22.verse: I ·feel only hate for them [hate them with a perfect/complete hatred]; they are my enemies.

23.verse: God, ·examine [investigate; search; v. 1] me and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts.

24.verse: See if there is any ·bad thing [hurtful way] in me. Lead me on the ·road to everlasting life [everlasting/or ancient way].

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, rescue me from evil people; protect me from ·cruel [violent] people

2.verse: who ·make evil plans [consider evil in their hearts], who ·always start fights [every day stir up war; Prov. 15:18; 29:22].

3.verse: They make their tongues sharp as a snake’s; ·their words are like snake poison [the venom of vipers is under their lips; Rom. 3:13]. ·Selah [Interlude]

4.verse: LORD, ·guard [keep] me from the ·power [hand] of wicked people; protect me from ·cruel [violent] people who plan ·to trip me up [my downfall].

5.verse: The ·proud [arrogant] hid a trap for me. They spread out a net [with cords] beside the road; they set ·traps [snares] for me. ·Selah [Interlude]

6.verse: I said to the LORD, “You are my God.” LORD, ·listen [give ear] to my prayer ·for help [of supplication].

7.verse: LORD God, my ·mighty [strong] ·savior [victor], you ·protect me in [cover my head in the day of] battle.

8.verse: LORD, do not give the wicked what they ·want [desire]. Don’t let their plans succeed, or they will become ·proud [exalted]. ·Selah [Interlude]

9.verse: Those around me have ·planned trouble [uplifted heads]. Now let ·it [the trouble of their lips] come to them.

10.verse: Let burning coals ·fall [rain] on them. ·Throw them [Let them fall] into the fire or into pits from which they cannot ·escape [get up].

11.verse: Don’t let ·liars [a tongue-man] ·settle [be established] in the land. Let evil ·quickly [or with blows] hunt down ·cruel [violent] people.

12.verse: I know the LORD will get justice for the poor and will defend the needy in court.

13.verse: ·Good [Righteous] people will ·praise [thank] his name; ·honest [virtuous] people will live in his presence.

1.verse: A Prayer Not to Sin - A psalm of David. LORD, I ·call [pray] to you. Come quickly to me. ·Listen to me [Give ear to my voice] when I ·call [pray] to you.

2.verse: Let my prayer be like incense placed before you [Ex. 30:7–8; Rev. 5:8], and ·my praise [the lifting of my hands] like the evening sacrifice.

3.verse: LORD, ·help me control my tongue [set a guard on my mouth]; ·help me be careful about what I say [keep watch on the door of my mouth; Prov. 13:3; 21:23; James 3:1–12].

4.verse: ·Take away my desire to do evil [Don’t incline my heart to an evil matter] or to join others in doing wrong. Don’t let me eat tasty food with those who do evil.

5.verse: If a ·good [righteous] person ·punished [hit] me, that would be ·kind [an act of loyalty]. If he corrected me, that would be like perfumed oil on my head. ·I [My head] shouldn’t refuse it. But I pray against those who do evil.

6.verse: Let their ·leaders [judges] be thrown down the cliffs. Then people will ·know that I have spoken correctly [listen to my words for they are pleasant]:

7.verse: “·The ground [or The rock; Like it] is plowed and broken up. In the same way, our bones have been scattered at the ·grave [mouth of Sheol; the grave or the underworld].”

8.verse: GOD, ·I look to you for help [my eyes are to you]. I ·trust [find refuge] in you, LORD. Don’t let ·me die [my life pour out].

9.verse: ·Protect [Guard; Keep] me from the traps they set for me and from the net that evil people have spread.

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, but let me pass by safely.

1.verse: A Prayer for Safety - A ·maskil [skillful psalm; meditation] of David when he was in the cave [at Adullam (1 Sam. 22:1, 4) or En-Gedi (1 Sam. 24:1–22)]. A prayer. I cry out to the LORD; I ·pray [cry out] to the LORD for ·mercy [grace].

2.verse: I pour out my ·problems [complaint] to him; I tell him my ·troubles [distress].

3.verse: When ·I am afraid [I am depressed; my spirit is faint], you, LORD, know ·the way out [my way]. In the path where I walk, ·a trap is hidden [they have hidden a trap] for me.

4.verse: Look ·around me [at/on my right hand] and see. No one cares about me. ·I have no place of safety [A place of refuge perishes from me]; no one ·cares if I live [seeks for my soul].

5.verse: LORD, I cry out to you. I say, “You are my ·protection [refuge]. ·You are all I want in this life […my portion in the land of the living].”

6.verse: ·Listen [Pay attention] to my cry, because I am ·helpless [brought very low]. ·Save [Protect] me from those who are ·chasing [pursuing; persecuting] me, because they are too strong for me.

7.verse: ·Free me [Bring me out] from my prison, and then I will ·praise [thank] your name. Then ·good [righteous] people will surround me, because you have ·taken care of me [given me my reward].

1.verse: A Prayer Not to Be Killed - A psalm of David. LORD, hear my prayer; ·listen [give ear] to my ·cry for mercy [prayer of supplication]. Answer me because you are ·loyal [faithful] and ·good [righteous].

2.verse: Don’t ·judge me [bring me into judgment], your servant, because no one alive is ·right [righteous] before you [Rom. 3:22; Gal. 2:16].

3.verse: My enemies are ·chasing [pursuing; persecuting] me; they crushed me to the ground. They made me ·live [sit] in darkness like those long dead [Lam. 3:6].

4.verse: ·I am afraid [I am depressed; my spirit is faint; 142:3]; my ·courage is gone [heart within me is desolated].

5.verse: I remember ·what happened long ago [the former days]; I ·consider [meditated on] everything you have done. I ·think [considered] ·about all you have made [the work of your hands].

6.verse: I ·lift my hands to you in prayer [spread out my hands to you]. ·As a dry land needs rain, I thirst [My life/soul is like a thirsty/parched land] for you. ·Selah [Interlude]

7.verse: LORD, answer me quickly, because ·I am getting weak [my spirit languishes]. Don’t ·turn away [hide your face] from me, or I will be like those who ·are dead [go down to the pit].

8.verse: ·Tell me [Make me hear] in the morning about your ·love [loyalty], because I ·trust [have confidence in] you. ·Show me what I should do [Make me know the way I should walk], because ·my prayers go up [I lift up my soul] to you.

9.verse: LORD, ·save [protect] me from my enemies; I hide in you.

10.verse: Teach me to do ·what you want [your will], because you are my God. Let your good Spirit [or spirit] ·lead [guide] me on level ground.

11.verse: LORD, let me live ·so people will praise you [for the sake of your name]. In your ·goodness [righteousness] ·save me [bring me out] from my ·troubles [distress].

12.verse: In your ·love [loyalty] ·defeat [destroy] my enemies. ·Destroy [Make perish] all those who ·trouble [distress] me, because I am your servant.

1.verse: A Prayer for Victory - Of David. ·Praise [Blessed be] the LORD, my Rock [61:2], who trains ·me [my hands] for war, who trains ·me [my fingers] for battle.

2.verse: ·He protects me like a strong, walled city, and he loves me [He is my loyal one and my fortress]. He is my ·defender [stronghold] and my ·Savior [rescuer], my shield ·and my protection [in whom I find refuge]. He ·helps me keep my people under control [subdues my people under me].

3.verse: LORD, ·why are people important to you [what are people that you care about them]? ·Why do you even think about human beings [What are human beings that you think about them; 8:4]?

4.verse: People are like ·a breath [vapor; 39:5, 11; 62:9; Eccl. 1:2]; their ·lives [days] are like passing shadows [102:11; 109:23; Eccl. 6:12].

5.verse: LORD, ·tear open [bend] the ·sky [heavens] and come down. Touch the mountains so they will smoke [18:9; Ex. 19:11, 18–19].

6.verse: Send the lightning and scatter ·my enemies [them]. Shoot your arrows and ·force them away [rout them; 18:14].

7.verse: ·Reach down [Send forth your hand] from above. ·Save me [Set me free] and ·rescue [protect] me ·out of this sea of enemies [from the mighty waters; symbolizing chaos], from ·these [the hand/power of] foreigners.

8.verse: ·They are liars [Their mouths speak vanities/falsehood]; ·they are dishonest [their right hand is a false right hand].

9.verse: God, I will sing a new song [celebrating victory; 33:3; 40:3; 96:1; 98:1; 149:1; Is. 42:10; Rev. 5:9; 14:3] to you; I will ·play [make a psalm] to you on the ten-stringed harp.

10.verse: You give ·victory [salvation] to kings. You ·save [set free] your servant David from ·cruel [evil] swords.

11.verse: ·Save me [Set me free], ·rescue [protect] me from ·these [the hand/power of the] foreigners. ·They are liars [Their mouths speak vanities/falsehood]; ·they are dishonest [their right hand is a false right hand].

12.verse: Let our sons in their youth ·grow like plants [or be like full-grown plants; robust and vital; 128:3]. Let our daughters be like the ·decorated [cut] ·stones [or pillars] in the ·Temple [or palace; stately and beautiful].

13.verse: Let our barns be filled with crops of all kinds. Let our sheep in the fields have thousands and tens of thousands of lambs.

14.verse: Let our cattle be ·strong [well fed; or heavy with young]. Let ·no one break in [there be no breach; or no miscarriage; in the city walls]. Let there be no ·war [going out; in war or exile, or perhaps referring to premature birth], no screams in our ·streets [public areas].

15.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are ·those [the people] who are like this; ·happy [blessed] are the people whose God is the LORD.

1.verse: Praise to God the King - A psalm of praise. Of David. I ·praise your greatness [exalt you], my God the King; I will ·praise [bless] ·you [your name] forever and ever.

2.verse: I will ·praise [bless] you every day; I will praise ·you [your name] forever and ever.

3.verse: The LORD is great and ·worthy of our praise [greatly to be praised; 48:1]; ·no one can understand how great he is [there is no searching out/limit to his greatness].

4.verse: ·Parents [A generation] will ·tell their children [praise to a generation] what you have done. They will ·retell [proclaim] your mighty acts,

5.verse: ·wonderful majesty, and glory [and the majestic glory of your splendor; God’s manifest presence]. And I will ·think about [meditate on] your ·miracles [wonderful works].

6.verse: They will tell about the ·amazing things you do [might of your awesomeness], and I will ·tell [recount] how great you are.

7.verse: They will ·remember [bubble forth with] ·your great goodness [the remembrance of your goodness] and will sing about your ·fairness [righteousness].

8.verse: The LORD is ·kind [gracious] and ·shows mercy [compassionate]. He ·does not become angry quickly [is slow to anger] but ·is full of love [has great loyalty].

9.verse: The LORD is good to everyone; he is ·merciful [compassionate] to all he has made [86:15; 103:8; Ex. 34:6–7; Neh. 9:17, 31; Joel 2:13; Jon. 4:2].

10.verse: LORD, everything you have made will ·praise [bless] you; ·those who belong to you [your saints/loyal ones] will bless you.

11.verse: They will tell about the glory of your kingdom and will speak about your ·power [strength].

12.verse: Then everyone will know the mighty things you do and the glory and ·majesty [splendor] of your kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom ·will go on and on [is an eternal kingdom], and you will rule ·forever [from generation to generation; Dan. 4:3]. The LORD ·will keep all his promises [is faithful/true in all his words]; he is loyal to all he has made.

14.verse: The LORD ·helps [supports] those who have ·been defeated [fallen] and ·takes care of [lifts up] those who are ·in trouble [bowed down].

15.verse: ·All living things look to you for food [The eyes of all look to you], and you give ·it [their food] to them at the right time.

16.verse: You open your hand, and you satisfy the desire of all living things [Matt. 6:25–27].

17.verse: ·Everything the LORD does is right [The LORD is righteous in all his ways]. He is loyal ·to all he has made [or in all his deeds].

18.verse: The LORD is ·close [near] to everyone who ·prays to [calls on] him, to all who ·truly pray to him [call on him in truth/faithfulness].

19.verse: He ·gives those who respect him what they want [accomplishes the desire of all who fear him; Prov. 1:7]. He listens when they cry, and he ·saves them [gives them victory].

20.verse: The LORD ·protects [guards; keeps] everyone who loves him, but he will destroy the wicked.

21.verse: ·I will praise [My mouth will speak the praise of] the LORD. Let ·everyone [all flesh] ·praise [bless] his holy name forever.

1.verse: Praise God Who Helps the Weak - Praise the LORD! My ·whole being [soul; life], praise the LORD.

2.verse: I will praise the LORD ·all [with] my life; I will ·sing praises [make a psalm] to my God as long as I live.

3.verse: Do not put your ·trust [confidence] in princes or other people, who cannot ·save you [give you victory; 118:8–9].

4.verse: ·When people die [Their spirit goes out], they ·are buried [return to the ground]. ·Then all of [On that day] their plans ·come to an end [perish].

5.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] are those who are helped by the God of Jacob [another name for Israel]. Their hope is in the LORD their God.

6.verse: He made heaven and earth, the sea and everything in it [Gen. 1]. He ·remains [keeps; observes; guards] ·loyal [faithfulness; truth] forever.

7.verse: He does ·what is fair [justice] for those who have been ·wronged [oppressed; exploited]. He gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets the prisoners free.

8.verse: The LORD ·gives sight to [opens the eyes of] the blind. The LORD lifts up people who are ·in trouble [bowed down; 145:14]. The LORD loves ·those who do right [the righteous].

9.verse: The LORD ·protects [guards] the ·foreigners [sojourners]. He ·defends [supports] the orphans and widows [the socially vulnerable], but he ·blocks [frustrates] the way of the wicked.

10.verse: The LORD will ·be King [reign] forever [47:2; 93:1; 96:10; 97:1; 98:6; 99:1; Rev. 19:6]. ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple], your God is everlasting. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Praise God Who Helps His People - Praise the LORD! It is good to ·sing praises [make a psalm] to our God; it is pleasant and ·good [fitting] to praise him.

2.verse: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem [51:18; 102:16; Is. 64:8–12]; he ·brings back [gathers; assembles] the ·captured [scattered; dispersed] Israelites [perhaps a reference to those who returned after the Babylonian exile; Deut. 30:1–4; Is. 11:12].

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and ·bandages [binds up] their wounds.

4.verse: He ·counts [measures the number of] the stars and ·names [assigns names to] each one [Is. 40:26].

5.verse: Our Lord is great and very powerful. There is no limit to ·what he knows [his understanding].

6.verse: The LORD ·defends [supports] the ·humble [needy], but he throws the wicked to the ground.

7.verse: Sing ·praises [thanksgiving] to the LORD; ·praise [make a psalm to] our God with harps.

8.verse: He ·fills [covers] the ·sky [heavens] with clouds and ·sends [sets; establishes] rain to the earth and makes grass ·grow [sprout] on the ·hills [mountains].

9.verse: He gives food to cattle and to the ·little birds [young ravens] that call.

10.verse: He ·is not impressed with [does not delight in] the strength of a horse, nor does he take pleasure in ·human might [the thighs of a person].

11.verse: The LORD ·is pleased with [takes pleasure in] those who ·respect [fear] him [Prov. 1:7], with those who ·trust [wait for; hope in] his ·love [loyalty].

12.verse: Jerusalem, ·praise [celebrate] the LORD; ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple], praise your God.

13.verse: He ·makes your city gates strong [strengthens the bars of your gates] and blesses your children ·inside [within you].

14.verse: He ·brings [sets] peace to your ·country [boundaries] and ·fills [satisfies; satiates] you with the finest ·grain [wheat].

15.verse: He ·gives a command [sends forth his word] to the earth, and ·it quickly obeys him [his word quickly runs].

16.verse: He ·spreads [gives] the snow like wool and scatters the frost like ashes.

17.verse: He throws down hail like ·rocks [morsels; bits; pieces]. No one can stand ·the cold he sends [before his cold].

18.verse: Then he ·gives a command [sends forth his word], and it melts. He sends the breezes, and the waters flow.

19.verse: He ·gave [announced] his word to Jacob [another name for Israel], his laws [statutes; requirements; ordinances] and ·demands [judgments] to Israel [Ex. 19–24].

20.verse: He didn’t do this for ·any other [all the] nation. They don’t know his ·laws [judgments]. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: The World Should Praise the Lord - Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD from the ·skies [heavens]. Praise him ·high above the earth [in the heights].

2.verse: Praise him, all you ·angels [messengers]. Praise him, all ·you armies of heaven [his hosts; the angelic army].

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon. Praise him, all you ·shining stars [stars of light].

4.verse: Praise him, ·highest heavens [heaven of heavens] and you waters above the ·sky [heavens].

5.verse: Let them praise the name of the LORD, because ·they were created by his command [he commands and they were created; Gen. 1].

6.verse: He ·put them in place [made them stand] forever and ever; he made a ·law [statute; requirement; ordinance] that will never ·change [pass].

7.verse: Praise the LORD from the earth, you large sea ·animals [monsters; like Leviathan; 74:12–17; 104:26; Gen. 1:21; Job 3:8; 41; Is. 27:1] and all the ·oceans [deeps],

8.verse: ·lightning [fire] and hail, snow and ·mist [cloud; or smoke], and stormy winds that ·obey him [do his word],

9.verse: mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,

10.verse: wild animals and all cattle, crawling animals and birds,

11.verse: kings of the earth and all ·nations [peoples], princes and all ·rulers [judges] of the earth,

12.verse: young men and women, old people and ·children [youth].

13.verse: Praise the name of the LORD, because ·he [his name] alone is ·great [exalted]. ·He is more wonderful than [His splendor is over] heaven and earth.

14.verse: God has ·given his people a king [exalted/raised a horn over his people; an animal’s horn symbolizes power]. He should be praised by all ·who belong to him [his saints/loyal ones]; he should be praised by the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], the people ·closest to his heart [nearest to him]. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Praise the God of Israel - Praise the LORD! Sing a new song [celebrating victory; 33:3; 40:3; 96:1; 98:1; 144:9; Is. 42:10; Rev. 5:9; 14:3] to the LORD; sing his praise in the ·meeting [assembly; congregation] of his ·people [saints; loyal ones].

2.verse: Let the Israelites ·be happy [rejoice] because of God, [in] their Maker. Let the ·people of Jerusalem [sons of Zion; location of the Temple] rejoice ·because [in] of their King.

3.verse: They should praise him with dancing. They should ·sing praises [make a psalm] to him with tambourines and harps.

4.verse: The LORD is pleased with his people; he ·saves [endows with salvation/victory] the ·humble [needy].

5.verse: Let ·those who worship him [the saints/loyal ones] rejoice in his glory [God’s manifest presence]. Let them sing for joy even in bed!

6.verse: Let them ·shout his praise [exalt God with their throats] with their two-edged swords in their hands.

7.verse: They will ·punish [execute vengeance against] the nations and ·defeat [punish] the people.

8.verse: They will put those kings in chains and ·those important men [honored men] in iron bands.

9.verse: They will ·punish them as God has written [accomplish a written judgment]. God is honored by ·all who worship him [his saints/loyal ones]. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Praise the Lord with Music - Praise the LORD! Praise God in his ·Temple [holy place; or holiness]; praise him in his ·mighty heaven [strong firmament; Gen. 1:7].

2.verse: Praise him for his strength; praise him for his [abundant] greatness.

3.verse: Praise him with trumpet blasts; praise him with harps and lyres.

4.verse: Praise him with tambourines and dancing; praise him with stringed instruments and flutes.

5.verse: Praise him with loud cymbals; praise him with crashing cymbals.

6.verse: Let everything that breathes praise the LORD. Praise the LORD!
